original: 'on te sngon po rdzas nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po rdzas nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if it is the substance blue that is understood,

original: sngon po tsam ni ma yin na de lta yin na ni sgra gcig gis gnyis brjod la ;
analyzed: sngon po tsam ni ma yin na de lta yin na ni sgra gcig gis gnyis brjod la ;
translated: and not just blue, then since one word expresses two things,üîΩand another does the same, why would it not express four or three things?

original: gzhan gyis kyang de bzhin yin pa'i phyir bzhi 'am gsum brjod pas ji ltar gzhi mthun pa'am khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos por 'gyur sgra gcig gam du ma bstan pa rang bzhi tha dad pa rnams gzhi mthun pa la brten pa ni ma yin no
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang de bzhin yin pa'i phyir bzhi 'am gsum brjod pas ji ltar gzhi mthun pa'am khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos por 'gyur sgra gcig gam du ma bstan pa rang bzhi tha dad pa rnams gzhi mthun pa la brten pa ni ma yin no
translated: How could there be a common locus or the relationship of qualifier and qualified?

original: // 'on te sngon po la sogs pa yan 'gar ba rtogs par mi nus pa des na gzhan dang gzhan rtogs pa gzhi mthun pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: // 'on te sngon po la sogs pa yan 'gar ba rtogs par mi nus pa des na gzhan dang gzhan rtogs pa gzhi mthun pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is impossible to understand blue and so on individually, then it is not the case that the understanding of one thing and another is a common locus.

original: sngon po la sogs pa de dag ni rigs ma nges pa yin la rigs la sogs pa yang yon tan ma yin par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de dag ni rigs ma nges pa yin la rigs la sogs pa yang yon tan ma yin par nges pa yin no //
translated: Because those things such as blue are not ascertained to be a type, and so on, and it is ascertained that a type and so on is not a quality.

original: des na nges pa bstan pa'i phyir sgra gzhan sbyor ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na nges pa bstan pa'i phyir sgra gzhan sbyor ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that ascertainment, another word is applied.

original: gal te sdo sogs mngon sum gyis //
analyzed: gal te sdo sogs mngon sum gyis //
translated: If blue and so on are directly perceived,

original: tha dad med par rtogs na ni //üîΩdon de nyid ni sgra yis kyang //
analyzed: tha dad med par rtogs na ni // don de nyid ni sgra yis kyang //
translated: If it is understood as not different,üîΩthen how can the meaning be understood

original: ji ltar gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: differently by the word?

original: gal te mngon sum la sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa med pa snang na sgra las kyang de kho na nyid snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum la sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa med pa snang na sgra las kyang de kho na nyid snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the non-difference of blue, etc. appears in perception, then reality would appear from the word also,

original: de nyid la 'brel pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de nyid la 'brel pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because the connection with that is understood.

original: 'on te lkog tu gyur pas de ltar snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lkog tu gyur pas de ltar snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it does not appear in that way because it is hidden,

original: rtogs bzhin pa nyid ji ltar lkog tu gyur pas de ltar snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa nyid ji ltar lkog tu gyur pas de ltar snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: how can that which is being understood be hidden?

original: rtogs bzhin pa nyid ci ltar ldog tu gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa nyid ci ltar ldog tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: How can that which is being understood be hidden?

original: nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not present.

original: nye bar gnas pa ma yin yang sgra'i shes pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ma yin yang sgra'i shes pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Even though it is not present, the cognition of the word occurs.

original: dbang po'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no activity of the sense faculty.

original: dbang po nyid rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po nyid rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The sense faculty itself is not the cause of understanding.

original: gal te rang bzhin rtogs na ni dbang po dang dbang po ma yin pa dag la khyad par ci yod gang du nye bar gnas pa yod pa der ci ltar gzhan du rtogs /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin rtogs na ni dbang po dang dbang po ma yin pa dag la khyad par ci yod gang du nye bar gnas pa yod pa der ci ltar gzhan du rtogs /
translated: If you realize that it is the nature of the object, then what is the difference between the sense faculties and the non-sense faculties? If it exists in one place, how could it be realized elsewhere?

original: dbang po'i byed pa med pas na ci yang nyams su myong ba med do //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa med pas na ci yang nyams su myong ba med do //
translated: Since the function of the sense faculties does not exist, nothing is experienced at all.

original: gsal ba nyid nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúClarity itself would be destroyed,‚Äù

original: gal te gsal ba nyid med mod /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba nyid med mod /
translated: then if clarity itself does not exist,

original: de ltar yod kyang rdzas so sor nges pa la ltos par bya ba'i sngon po nyid gzhan du rtogs pa ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar yod kyang rdzas so sor nges pa la ltos par bya ba'i sngon po nyid gzhan du rtogs pa ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could blue, which must rely on a substance that is ascertained individually, be realized elsewhere?

original: de lta yin dang tshig gzhan sbyor ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang tshig gzhan sbyor ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, there would be no need to apply other words.

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa rdzas ma nges pa @256a * //üîΩla 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa rdzas ma nges pa @256a * // la 'jug pa yin na /
translated: But if blue and so on are applied to a substance that is not ascertained,

original: de lta yin na yang sngon po sgra las sngon po nyid kyang ma nges par rtogs la /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang sngon po sgra las sngon po nyid kyang ma nges par rtogs la /
translated: then even if that were the case, blue would be realized without ascertaining blue itself from sound.

original: autpala'i sgra las yang autpala'i rjod byed las ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir nges na slar gzhi mthun pa med na de nyid de /
analyzed: autpala'i sgra las yang autpala'i rjod byed las ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir nges na slar gzhi mthun pa med na de nyid de /
translated: And from the word utpala, because of the uncertainty of the expression utpala, there is no common locus when there is certainty.

original: ma nges pa brjod pa gnyis la don gcig rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa brjod pa gnyis la don gcig rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no understanding of the same meaning in the two expressions of uncertainty.

original: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i phyir de ltar rtogs so zhes bya ba yang 'brel pa ma yin te /üîΩzin pa gzhan dang gzhan las ni //
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i phyir de ltar rtogs so zhes bya ba yang 'brel pa ma yin te / zin pa gzhan dang gzhan las ni //
translated: And it is not related to say that it is understood in that way because of mutual exclusion,

original: rnam par gcod pa ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: because how could there be exclusionüîΩfrom that which is already grasped and that which is not?

original: gal te rnam par gcod byed na //
analyzed: gal te rnam par gcod byed na //
translated: If it is exclusion,

original: gzhan sel ba nyid brjod byar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba nyid brjod byar 'gyur //
translated: the object of expression would be the exclusion of other.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i sgras ma nges par rtogs na phyis gzhan gyis nges par bya nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i sgras ma nges par rtogs na phyis gzhan gyis nges par bya nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If the word blue and so on is understood without certainty, it cannot be ascertained later by another.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni gzhan gyis bzlog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni gzhan gyis bzlog pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is understood by direct perception is not refuted by another,

original: 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be mistaken.

original: 'o na sgra gzhan las the tshom bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na sgra gzhan las the tshom bzlog pa yin te /
translated: Well then, it is the other word that refutes doubt.

original: bsdu bas rtogs pa ni bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsdu bas rtogs pa ni bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible to refute the understanding of the meaning of a word through the collection of letters.

original: gang tshe sngon po autpala yin nam ci 'on te gzhan yin zhes rnam par rtog pa de'i tshe sgra gzhan las rnam par rtogs pa bzlog par 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang tshe sngon po autpala yin nam ci 'on te gzhan yin zhes rnam par rtog pa de'i tshe sgra gzhan las rnam par rtogs pa bzlog par 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúIs the blue the utpala or is it something else?‚Äù then it is correct to refute the understanding of the meaning of a word from another word.

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: But that also is not correct.

original: 'di ltar gal te sgra las rtogs pa'i don rnam par brtags pa bden na ni /üîΩsgra gzhan dang ni 'brel pa las //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te sgra las rtogs pa'i don rnam par brtags pa bden na ni / sgra gzhan dang ni 'brel pa las //
translated: Thus, if the meaning of the word that is imagined through understanding is true,üîΩthen how could it be refuted

original: de ni ci ltar ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ci ltar ldog par 'gyur //
translated: through the connection with another word?

original: gal te rtogs pa'i yul gyi don de bden pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'i yul gyi don de bden pa yin na /
translated: If the meaning of the object of understanding is true,

original: gzhan gyis de ltar ma yin par bya ci ltar nus te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de ltar ma yin par bya ci ltar nus te /
translated: then how could another make it not so?

original: gnyi ga yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are valid cognitions.

original: 'on te des the tshom du gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs par byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te des the tshom du gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs par byas pa yin la /
translated: But if it is said that the nature of the understanding is doubt,

original: the tshom gyi rang bzhin yang bstan par rtogs pas bzlog par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rang bzhin yang bstan par rtogs pas bzlog par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: and the nature of doubt is also understood to be taught, then it is only to be refuted.

original: des na gzhan gyis bzlog par 'thad de /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis bzlog par 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, it is correct to refute it with another.

original: de lta bu nyid ni de ltar gyur pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ni de ltar gyur pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it is not tenable that it is just that which is not like that.

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: That also is not correct.

original: gang phyir sgra de nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: gang phyir sgra de nyid kyis ni //
translated: Because that very sound

original: bzlog bya nyid du rtogs byas la //
analyzed: bzlog bya nyid du rtogs byas la //
translated: is understood to be the object of refutation,

original: des na sgra gzhan dag gis kyang //
analyzed: des na sgra gzhan dag gis kyang //
translated: then by other sounds

original: bsgrub par bya ba ci zhig yod //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ci zhig yod //
translated: what is to be established?

original: gal te rtogs pa snga mas ni ma nges par bzlog par bya ba nyid du rtogs la /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa snga mas ni ma nges par bzlog par bya ba nyid du rtogs la /
translated: If you think that the former understanding is not definite, but the object of refutation is understood,

original: phyi mas ni nges par yin pa'i phyir mkho ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: phyi mas ni nges par yin pa'i phyir mkho ba yod do zhe na /
translated: and the latter is definite, therefore it is necessary,

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: that also is not so.

original: 'di ltar / tshad ma'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tshad ma'i stobs kyis 'ongs pa yi //
translated: Because

original: nges pa med pa gang yin te //üîΩgzhan du bya bar tshad gzhan ni //
analyzed: nges pa med pa gang yin te // gzhan du bya bar tshad gzhan ni //
translated: what is indefinite,üîΩwhich comes from the power of valid cognition,üîΩcannot be made otherwise

original: brgya phrag gis kyang nus ma yin //
analyzed: brgya phrag gis kyang nus ma yin //
translated: even by a hundred other valid cognitions.

original: de'i phyir snga ma'am phyi ma gang yang @256b rung ba gcig ni tshad ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma'am phyi ma gang yang @256b rung ba gcig ni tshad ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, either the former or the latter is valid cognition alone.

original: des ni gzhan yang de ltar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir na sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni gzhan yang de ltar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir na sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the other is like that, it is not a proof.

original: spyi tsam brjod pa yin na ni gzhan don med do //
analyzed: spyi tsam brjod pa yin na ni gzhan don med do //
translated: If it is a general statement, then it is useless for the other person.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa ni gnod par byed pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa ni gnod par byed pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if it is an inference, then it is invalidated.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not,

original: de yang mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because that is also invalidated by perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas ni rno ba dang 'bar ba la sogs pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ni rno ba dang 'bar ba la sogs pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: An inference does not apprehend the particulars of sharpness, heat, etc.

original: des na der yang the tshom za ba kho na'o //
analyzed: des na der yang the tshom za ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, there is only doubt about that.

original: spyi la the tshom mi za'o zhe na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi la the tshom mi za'o zhe na ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that there is no doubt about the universal, that is not so,

original: spyi rtogs pa'i khyad par ma nges par rtogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyi rtogs pa'i khyad par ma nges par rtogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: because the apprehension of the universal is the apprehension of the particulars without certainty.

original: spyi la ni rnam par nges par srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi la ni rnam par nges par srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to be certain about the universal.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / spyi gang yin pa de la ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / spyi gang yin pa de la ni //
translated: That which is a universal

original: khyad par rnam pa 'di ltar zhes //
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa 'di ltar zhes //
translated: cannot be ascertained in this way.

original: rtogs med nges na spyi yi ni //
analyzed: rtogs med nges na spyi yi ni //
translated: If it is ascertained without being apprehended,

original: shes pa thams cad bslad pa nyid //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad bslad pa nyid //
translated: then all cognitions of universals are mistaken.

original: spyi rtogs kyang gsal ba so sor nges pa nyid du rtogs pa 'dren pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi rtogs kyang gsal ba so sor nges pa nyid du rtogs pa 'dren pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if the universal is apprehended, it does not induce the apprehension of the individual particulars.

original: des na spyi rtogs pa ni nye bar bslad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na spyi rtogs pa ni nye bar bslad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of the universal is a mistake.

original: gsal ba la 'khrul pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gsal ba la 'khrul pa yin gyi /
translated: [Objection:] The mistake is in regard to the particular,

original: spyi la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: spyi la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: not in regard to the universal.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: [Reply:] That is not correct.üîΩIf the mistake is in regard to the particular, where is the universal to which the word is applied?üîΩThe universal is not in any particular,üîΩand the particular is not in the universal.

original: gal te de ni gsal ba la 'khrul pa spyi ni gang du 'dogs so //üîΩspyi ni 'gar yang bzho gsal las //
analyzed: gal te de ni gsal ba la 'khrul pa spyi ni gang du 'dogs so // spyi ni 'gar yang bzho gsal las //
translated: The universal is not in the particular,

original: sogs pa nye bar mkho ma yin //üîΩgal te gang gi don du 'di brtsams pa de la 'khrul na de'i tshe gzhan las ma 'khrul yang ci bya /üîΩgal te spyi rtogs pa med na gsal ba'i yul can gyi rtogs pa de nyid mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: sogs pa nye bar mkho ma yin // gal te gang gi don du 'di brtsams pa de la 'khrul na de'i tshe gzhan las ma 'khrul yang ci bya / gal te spyi rtogs pa med na gsal ba'i yul can gyi rtogs pa de nyid mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: and the particular is not in the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not in the particular, then the universal is not the object of the word.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.

original: spyi nges pas kyang spyi de nyid nges par 'gyur mod /üîΩgzhan la the tshom za bar ci ltar 'gyur /üîΩgzhan nges par gzhan la the tshom za bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: spyi nges pas kyang spyi de nyid nges par 'gyur mod / gzhan la the tshom za bar ci ltar 'gyur / gzhan nges par gzhan la the tshom za bar mi 'thad de /
translated: If the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.

original: nges pa thams cad kyis thams cad la the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa thams cad kyis thams cad la the tshom za bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal.üîΩIf the universal is not the object of the word, then the word is not the cause of the understanding of the universal

original: ci ste yang srid pa nyid the tshom gyi yul yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang srid pa nyid the tshom gyi yul yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that existence itself is the object of doubt, not something else,üîΩthen in that case,

original: 'di ltar / gang zhig gang la srid pa de //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang zhig gang la srid pa de //
translated: That which exists in relation to something

original: de la 'khrul rten mthong ba ni //
analyzed: de la 'khrul rten mthong ba ni //
translated: is seen as the basis of error.

original: de mthong pa yis de nyid la //
analyzed: de mthong pa yis de nyid la //
translated: When that is seen,

original: the tshom 'jug par byed pa yin //
analyzed: the tshom 'jug par byed pa yin //
translated: doubt arises in relation to that.

original: the tshom ni srid pa dang 'khrul pa la 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom ni srid pa dang 'khrul pa la 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Doubt is tenable in relation to existence and error.

original: spyi la yang gang la gang srid pa de mthong bas de la the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: spyi la yang gang la gang srid pa de mthong bas de la the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: And in general, when something exists in relation to something, doubt arises in relation to that when that is seen.

original: ba lang nyid nges pa ni khra bo la sogs pa la yin la /
analyzed: ba lang nyid nges pa ni khra bo la sogs pa la yin la /
translated: The determination of cow is in relation to a cow with spots and so on.

original: rta nyid nges na ni /
analyzed: rta nyid nges na ni /
translated: But when the determination of horse is in relation to a horse,üîΩit is also in relation to a swan and so on.

original: ngang pa la sogs pa la yang yin pa'i phyir ha cang thal ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ngang pa la sogs pa la yang yin pa'i phyir ha cang thal ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not overextension.üîΩThat is not tenable.

original: de ni de ltar mi rung ste /üîΩ'di ltar khra bo la sogs the tshom gyi //üîΩrang bzhin @257a * //
analyzed: de ni de ltar mi rung ste / 'di ltar khra bo la sogs the tshom gyi // rang bzhin @257a * //
translated: In that case,

original: tsam gyis rtogs pa las //
analyzed: tsam gyis rtogs pa las //
translated: the mere nature of a cow with spots and so on is understood.

original: rtog pa gzhan ni 'dir yod min //
analyzed: rtog pa gzhan ni 'dir yod min //
translated: There is no other conception in relation to that.

original: spyi rtogs par ci ni ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: spyi rtogs par ci ni ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could a universal be understood?

original: ci ltar 'di khra bo 'am 'on te khu yu yin /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di khra bo 'am 'on te khu yu yin /
translated: What is it like? Is it variegated or is it a blur?üîΩWhen one hears the mere sound, one does not ascertain the specific features of the variegated, etc.

original: sgra cam zhig ni thos na khra bo la sogs pa'i khyad par ni nges par ma zin to zhes khra bo la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa nyid 'ba' zhig 'jig rten pas rtogs so //
analyzed: sgra cam zhig ni thos na khra bo la sogs pa'i khyad par ni nges par ma zin to zhes khra bo la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa nyid 'ba' zhig 'jig rten pas rtogs so //
translated: Thus, the world understands only the conceptual thought that has the aspect of the variegated, etc.üîΩThe same is true of the aspect of the universal.

original: spyi'i rnam pa dag gzhan yang de bzhin du lta'o //üîΩyang na / thog med bag chags dang 'brel can //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa dag gzhan yang de bzhin du lta'o // yang na / thog med bag chags dang 'brel can //
translated: Moreover,

original: spyi yi rnam par rig pa las //
analyzed: spyi yi rnam par rig pa las //
translated: the cognition of the universalüîΩis related to beginningless latent propensities.

original: rnam rtog 'dir 'gyur de yi phyir //
analyzed: rnam rtog 'dir 'gyur de yi phyir //
translated: From that, conceptual thought arises.

original: spyi yi dngos po rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: spyi yi dngos po rtogs ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the universal is not a real entity.

original: des na bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad ni phyi rol brten pa ma yin la gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad ni phyi rol brten pa ma yin la gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the conventions of affirmation and negation do not depend on external objects, because it is not possible for them to have a common locus, and so on.

original: 'on te sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gis ni khyad par 'ba' zhig rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gis ni khyad par 'ba' zhig rtogs pa yin la /
translated: But if the sound and the conceptual thought apprehend only the specific feature,

original: khyad par de dang ldan pa ni mtshon zin pas mtshon pas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par de dang ldan pa ni mtshon zin pas mtshon pas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and the possessor of that specific feature is already indicated by the indication of the specific feature, then it is understood.

original: khyad par gyi dbye ba rnams ni rtags yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi dbye ba rnams ni rtags yin te /
translated: The distinctions are the reason.

original: des na rtags kyi rdzas des na the tshom med pas khyad par gzhan rtogs pas ci bya /
analyzed: des na rtags kyi rdzas des na the tshom med pas khyad par gzhan rtogs pas ci bya /
translated: Therefore, since there is no doubt about the substance due to the reason, what use is it to understand another distinction?

original: rdzas ci lta bur gyur pa mi shes pas na de'i don du khyad par gzhan ston to zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas ci lta bur gyur pa mi shes pas na de'i don du khyad par gzhan ston to zhe na /
translated: Since it is not known what kind of substance it is, another distinction is taught for that purpose.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩgal te khyad cig gis don te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / gal te khyad cig gis don te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rang gi rang bzhin du rtogs na /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin du rtogs na /
translated: If it is understood that the meaning is due to one distinction,

original: khyad par gzhan gyis rigs pa yin //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan gyis rigs pa yin //
translated: then it is reasonable that it is due to another distinction.

original: gzhan pa ci zhig byed par 'gyur //üîΩ'on te khyad cig dang 'brel pas //
analyzed: gzhan pa ci zhig byed par 'gyur // 'on te khyad cig dang 'brel pas //
translated: What other purpose would there be?

original: don de gzhan du rtogs na ni //üîΩkhyad par gzhan dang 'brel pa yis //
analyzed: don de gzhan du rtogs na ni // khyad par gzhan dang 'brel pa yis //
translated: But if the meaning is understood to be different due to being related to another distinction,

original: gzhan pa byed par nus ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan pa byed par nus ma yin //
translated: then it is not possible for another to be produced due to being related to another distinction.

original: 'on te khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa tsam kho nar sgra gzhan gyis rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa tsam kho nar sgra gzhan gyis rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: But if it is understood by another word that it merely possesses another distinction,

original: de'i khyad par ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is not its distinction.

original: de lta yin na yan 'gar du rtogs pas don byed pa ci ltar 'grub /
analyzed: de lta yin na yan 'gar du rtogs pas don byed pa ci ltar 'grub /
translated: If that were so, how could the accomplishment of the purpose be established by understanding it in parts?

original: khyad par yan 'gar bas ni don bya ba byed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par yan 'gar bas ni don bya ba byed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: In particular, the Vai≈õe·π£ika cannot perform the function of a cause.

original: ci ste de'i sgo nyid khyad par ldan pa rtogs na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste de'i sgo nyid khyad par ldan pa rtogs na ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that the specific property itself is understood to be qualified, that is not so.

original: khyad par snga ma nyid kyis rtogs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par snga ma nyid kyis rtogs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is already understood by the previous specific property.

original: 'on te khyad par snga mas ni khyad par gzhan dang bral ba rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par snga mas ni khyad par gzhan dang bral ba rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But if you think that the previous specific property is understood to be free from other specific properties,

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: then you yourself have stated:

original: des na tha dad rnam par gnas //üîΩzhes rang nyid kyis brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na tha dad rnam par gnas // zhes rang nyid kyis brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, they are distinct and remain so.

original: 'o na gal te khyad par gzhan gyis 'di gzhan du gyur par tshad mar gyur pa'i rtogs pas rtogs par bya bar byas na khyad par gzhan stong gis kyang ci ltar gzhan du @257b byed par nus //
analyzed: 'o na gal te khyad par gzhan gyis 'di gzhan du gyur par tshad mar gyur pa'i rtogs pas rtogs par bya bar byas na khyad par gzhan stong gis kyang ci ltar gzhan du @257b byed par nus //
translated: If you think that this is to be understood by valid knowledge that this becomes different through another specific property, then how can another specific property that is empty make it different?

original: tshad mas grub pa ni tshad ma gzhan gyis gzhan du byed nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa ni tshad ma gzhan gyis gzhan du byed nus pa ma yin no //
translated: What is established by valid knowledge cannot be made different by another valid knowledge.

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba'i 'brel pas khyad par thams cad dbyer med par gnas pa nyid pas de ji ltar gzhan du rtogs par nus na rtogs na ni de nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pas ci ltar gzhan gyis gzhan du byed /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba'i 'brel pas khyad par thams cad dbyer med par gnas pa nyid pas de ji ltar gzhan du rtogs par nus na rtogs na ni de nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pas ci ltar gzhan gyis gzhan du byed /
translated: Since all distinctions are inseparable due to the connection of their compatibility, how could it be possible to realize them as other? If they were realized as other, then since they are the nature of that, how could they be made other by another?

original: 'on te gzhan gyis gzhan du byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis gzhan du byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But they are not made other by another.

original: 'on kyang lhag par rnam pa tsam zhig gzhan la gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhag par rnam pa tsam zhig gzhan la gyur pa yin no //
translated: However, only the aspect is transformed into another.

original: de las gzhan bzlog pa ni mi srid par nges pa las de /
analyzed: de las gzhan bzlog pa ni mi srid par nges pa las de /
translated: Since it is certain that the opposite of that is impossible,

original: de dang ldan pa'ang yin la de las gzhan pa'i chos dang ldan par yang 'gyur ba na ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'ang yin la de las gzhan pa'i chos dang ldan par yang 'gyur ba na ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it is endowed with that and also endowed with a phenomenon that is other than that.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not true.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gal te phyogs gzhan thob na ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te phyogs gzhan thob na ni //
translated: If one obtains the other side,

original: tshad ma yis ni 'thad pa nyid //
analyzed: tshad ma yis ni 'thad pa nyid //
translated: then it is tenable by valid knowledge.

original: lhag ma stong phrag bsnan pas kyang //
analyzed: lhag ma stong phrag bsnan pas kyang //
translated: Even if the remainder is added in thousands,

original: de bzlog pa ni nus ma yin //
analyzed: de bzlog pa ni nus ma yin //
translated: it cannot reverse that.

original: 'on te gzhan rnams thob med na //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan rnams thob med na //
translated: But if the others are not obtained,

original: don de nyid ni bcad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don de nyid ni bcad pa'i phyir //
translated: then in order to eliminate that object,

original: khyad par gzhan gyis ci bya ste //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan gyis ci bya ste //
translated: What is the use of any other distinction?

original: 'dir ni bzlog bya 'ga' yod min //
analyzed: 'dir ni bzlog bya 'ga' yod min //
translated: There is nothing to be excluded here.

original: de'i phyir ma 'khrul pa'i rtogs pas ni thams cad rtogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'khrul pa'i rtogs pas ni thams cad rtogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, by non-erroneous cognition, everything is to be cognized,

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin no //
translated: like a valid cognition of direct perception.

original: des na khyad par gzhan rtogs par byed pa ni don med do //
analyzed: des na khyad par gzhan rtogs par byed pa ni don med do //
translated: Therefore, it is pointless to cognize any other distinction.

original: gal te khyad par rnams tha dad pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te khyad par rnams tha dad pa yin zhing /
translated: If the distinctions are different,

original: khyad par dang ldan pa yang tha dad pa yin na de'i phyir khyad par rtogs pa tsam gyis na mtshon pas mtshon pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos can gcig la mi 'du ba nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa yang tha dad pa yin na de'i phyir khyad par rtogs pa tsam gyis na mtshon pas mtshon pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos can gcig la mi 'du ba nyid do //
translated: and that which possesses the distinctions is also different, then because the mere cognition of the distinctions is not the indication by the indication, there would be no combination in one substratum.

original: 'on te khyad par rtogs pas kyang khyad par can rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par rtogs pas kyang khyad par can rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: But if by cognizing the distinctions, the possessor of the distinctions is also cognized,

original: de lta yin na slar yang khyad par gcig gis rtogs pas khyad par gcig gis thams cad bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na slar yang khyad par gcig gis rtogs pas khyad par gcig gis thams cad bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that case, by cognizing one distinction, everything would be apprehended by one distinction.

original: mngon sum gyis ni de ltar mi 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni de ltar mi 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: But direct perception does not apprehend in that way.

original: 'on te mngon sum gyis kyang res 'ga' thag ring po nas dbyibs tsam 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyis kyang res 'ga' thag ring po nas dbyibs tsam 'dzin la /
translated: But sometimes, by direct perception, one apprehends only the shape of something from a distance,

original: don nye ba na ni mdog 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don nye ba na ni mdog 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and when it is near, one apprehends its color.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /üîΩgal te rdzas dang mi ldan par //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de / gal te rdzas dang mi ldan par //
translated: This is not tenable.üîΩIf one apprehends only color and shape

original: mdog dang dbyibs tsam 'dzin na ni //
analyzed: mdog dang dbyibs tsam 'dzin na ni //
translated: without apprehending substance,

original: nam yang rdzas 'dzin mi 'gyur bas ;
analyzed: nam yang rdzas 'dzin mi 'gyur bas ;
translated: then one never apprehends substance,

original: / des ni dngos po med par 'gyur //
analyzed: / des ni dngos po med par 'gyur //
translated: and therefore it would be nonexistent.

original: 'on te dbyibs ni rdzas med par //
analyzed: 'on te dbyibs ni rdzas med par //
translated: But if one cannot apprehend shape

original: 'dzin par nus pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'dzin par nus pa ma yin te //
translated: without apprehending substance,

original: mdog kyang rdzas med min zhe na //
analyzed: mdog kyang rdzas med min zhe na //
translated: and if color is not without substance,

original: de las rdzas gzhan ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las rdzas gzhan ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could it be different from substance?

original: de'i phyir gzhi mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not a common locus.

original: khyed la yang der ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: khyed la yang der ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But what about you?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: sna tshogs @258a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs @258a * //
translated: The various

original: chos kyi gzhir gyur pa //
analyzed: chos kyi gzhir gyur pa //
translated: are the basis of phenomena.

original: chos can gcig gis dbang byas te //
analyzed: chos can gcig gis dbang byas te //
translated: They are controlled by a single phenomenon.

original: gcig bsgrub pa na de brten dang // gzhan rnams btang snyoms lta bu dang // 'gog na de yang dben pa dang // de las gzhan la ltos lta bur //
analyzed: gcig bsgrub pa na de brten dang // gzhan rnams btang snyoms lta bu dang // 'gog na de yang dben pa dang // de las gzhan la ltos lta bur //
translated: And as if it depends on something else.

original: med pa yis ni don can gyi //
analyzed: med pa yis ni don can gyi //
translated: How can the meaning of non-existence

original: tha snyad ci ltar blos bstan pa//
analyzed: tha snyad ci ltar blos bstan pa//
translated: Be indicated by the mind through conventions?

original: de bzhin nyid de ma btags par //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ma btags par //
translated: That suchness is not imputed,

original: tha dad don rten khas len pas //
analyzed: tha dad don rten khas len pas //
translated: Is accepted as the basis of distinct meanings.

original: thog med bag chags las byung ba //
analyzed: thog med bag chags las byung ba //
translated: Arising from beginningless latent tendencies,

original: 'jig rten don la gnod med 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten don la gnod med 'gyur //
translated: The worldly meaning is not undermined.

original: kho bo cag gi ltar ni gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po la gnas pa ma yin gyi tha snyad 'di don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ltar ni gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po la gnas pa ma yin gyi tha snyad 'di don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: According to us, it is not based on things such as common loci. This convention is not ultimate.

original: gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po la gnas pa ma yin pa sgra'i don la brten nas yin te /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po la gnas pa ma yin pa sgra'i don la brten nas yin te /
translated: It is not based on things such as common loci, but is based on the meaning of words.

original: sgra'i don la brten nas dngos po la gnas pa ma yin pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i don la brten nas dngos po la gnas pa ma yin pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages based on the meaning of words, not based on things.

original: 'di ltar sgra zhes bya ba sgra ma yin pa la ldog pa la ltos nas sgra'i sgra chos can nyid du 'jog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra zhes bya ba sgra ma yin pa la ldog pa la ltos nas sgra'i sgra chos can nyid du 'jog go //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúsound‚Äù is posited as the subject, the word ‚Äúsound,‚Äù in dependence on the exclusion of what is not sound.

original: sgra de yang ngo shes pa'i stobs kyis rtag tu gnas pa nyid dang / 'brel pa nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra de yang ngo shes pa'i stobs kyis rtag tu gnas pa nyid dang / 'brel pa nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la brten pa yin no //
translated: And that sound is based on the power of recognition, on the fact that it endures forever, and on the fact that it is not external to the relationship.

original: des ni mi rtag pa nyid snang ba yin yang phyin ci log tha snyad kyis zin pa'i phyir na ma dmigs pa lta bu dang / med pa zhes bya ba lta bur rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni mi rtag pa nyid snang ba yin yang phyin ci log tha snyad kyis zin pa'i phyir na ma dmigs pa lta bu dang / med pa zhes bya ba lta bur rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though impermanence is manifest, because it is grasped by a mistaken convention, it is as if it were not perceived, or as if it did not exist.

original: des na mi rtag pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas tha snyad gzhan bcug pas phyin ci log gi tha snyad kyi yul gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas tha snyad gzhan bcug pas phyin ci log gi tha snyad kyi yul gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the valid cognition that proves impermanence clarifies the object of mistaken convention by introducing another convention,

original: de'i tshe yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pas bsgrubs so zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pas bsgrubs so zhes rtogs so //
translated: at that time, one understands that it proves the existence of the object by positing it as existent.

original: des na chos can sgra'i don de la brten pa'i bdag gi ngo bor rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na chos can sgra'i don de la brten pa'i bdag gi ngo bor rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of the subject, sound, is understood to be the essence of the self that is based on it.

original: 'gog na ni de dang bral bar de /
analyzed: 'gog na ni de dang bral bar de /
translated: If it is refuted, then it is free from that.

original: des na des dben pa nyid du rtogs pas na de las bzlog pa'i chos la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: des na des dben pa nyid du rtogs pas na de las bzlog pa'i chos la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, by understanding it to be free from that, one understands it to be dependent on the opposite phenomenon.

original: bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dang ldan pa ni rtogs pa 'ba' zhig kho nar zad de /
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dang ldan pa ni rtogs pa 'ba' zhig kho nar zad de /
translated: Affirmation and negation are merely conceptual.

original: dngos po ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: A thing does not have such a nature.

original: 'di ltar 'di kho na bzhin du kho bos rtogs so zhes mngon sum gyis rtogs pa de nyid du tha snyad kyi yul du 'grub pa yin gyi /üîΩde la rnam par rtog pa rnams gzhan dang gzhan gyis bsgrub pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di kho na bzhin du kho bos rtogs so zhes mngon sum gyis rtogs pa de nyid du tha snyad kyi yul du 'grub pa yin gyi / de la rnam par rtog pa rnams gzhan dang gzhan gyis bsgrub pa 'am /
translated: In this way, I understand it to be just this is established as the object of conventional expression by that very direct understanding.

original: dgag pa cung zad byas pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa cung zad byas pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In that regard, there is no affirmation or negation whatsoever by other conceptual thoughts.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la reg pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la reg pa ma yin te /
translated: Conceptual thought does not touch the nature of the past, etc.

original: de'i tshe de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist at that time.

original: de nyid kyi phyir @258b sgra dang rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir @258b sgra dang rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin te /
translated: Therefore, sound and conceptual thought have the object of excluding other.

original: 'khrul pa tsam sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa tsam sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they merely exclude error.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe 'khrul pa ma zhugs par 'di bum pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa glo bur du du ba las me rtogs pa der ci ltar sgra gzhan sel ba'i yul du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe 'khrul pa ma zhugs par 'di bum pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa glo bur du du ba las me rtogs pa der ci ltar sgra gzhan sel ba'i yul du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But when error does not occur, and conceptual thought suddenly arises, thinking ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù how can sound have the object of excluding other, as in the case of inferring fire from smoke?

original: 'di yang mi bzang ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mi bzang ste /
translated: This is not good.

original: 'di ltar ; mi 'jug pa yi yul gyi me //
analyzed: 'di ltar ; mi 'jug pa yi yul gyi me //
translated: The fire that is not the object of engagement

original: 'jug pa yul gyi byed pa yin //
analyzed: 'jug pa yul gyi byed pa yin //
translated: is the object of the activity of engagement.

original: 'dir yang 'jug pa'i yul ma yin //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'jug pa'i yul ma yin //
translated: Here, it is not the object of engagement.

original: bzlog pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: The opposite is certainly the case.

original: 'di ltar me nges pas ni me 'di ni 'jug pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar me nges pas ni me 'di ni 'jug pa'i yul yin te /
translated: In this way, the fire that is ascertained is the object of engagement of fire.

original: 'di la khyod ci ltar bya ba med par 'jug ces brjod pa yin pas de'i tshe bya ba med pa'i yul bzlog pa tsam rnam par rtog pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di la khyod ci ltar bya ba med par 'jug ces brjod pa yin pas de'i tshe bya ba med pa'i yul bzlog pa tsam rnam par rtog pa ni med do //
translated: Since it is said, ‚ÄúWhat do you do with this fire that is not the object of engagement?‚Äù at that time, there is no conceptual thought that merely excludes the object of non-activity.

original: gzhan du rtogs pa yang rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du rtogs pa yang rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that there is understanding of something else.

original: mngon sum gyi dus phyis 'byung ba'i dngos po rnam par rtog pas sgra'i yul gyi sngon po rtogs pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dus phyis 'byung ba'i dngos po rnam par rtog pas sgra'i yul gyi sngon po rtogs pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The entity that occurs after the time of perception is not the nature of the prior cognition of the object of the word ‚Äúblue‚Äù by conceptual cognition,

original: nye bar mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist at that time.

original: de 'di'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa 'di ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'di'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa 'di ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is that‚Äù is not conceptual cognition,

original: yid kyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te des skad cig ma nyid ma rtogs pa des na /
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro // 'on te des skad cig ma nyid ma rtogs pa des na /
translated: because it is mental perception.

original: mngon sum nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not perception because it does not realize momentariness,

original: ma yin te /üîΩda ltar ba rtogs pa nyid skad cig ma rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan zin la /
analyzed: ma yin te / da ltar ba rtogs pa nyid skad cig ma rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan zin la /
translated: that is not so.

original: ston par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It has already been demonstrated and will be demonstrated again that the realization of the present is the realization of momentariness.

original: de'i phyir gzhan sel ba la brten nas chos dang chos can gyi dngos po dang / gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan sel ba la brten nas chos dang chos can gyi dngos po dang / gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, based on the exclusion of other, the conventions of the relation of qualifier and qualified, common locus, and so on are possible.

original: tha dad pa'i don tha snyad kyi yul yin na ni thams cad 'thad de /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i don tha snyad kyi yul yin na ni thams cad 'thad de /
translated: If the object of convention is a different object, then everything is tenable,

original: de nyid thams cad las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid thams cad las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the opposite of everything else.

original: gang gis don gcig la 'du bar mi 'gyur ba ldog pa ni de las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis don gcig la 'du bar mi 'gyur ba ldog pa ni de las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The exclusion is not something other than that.

original: 'o na ci ltar sgra'i mi rtag pa zhes tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar sgra'i mi rtag pa zhes tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is there a differentiation of the form of the expression ‚Äúimpermanent sound‚Äù that has a basis of difference?

original: dper na mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the expression ‚Äúthe body of the lump.‚Äù

original: gal te ldog pa rnams tha dad ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa rnams tha dad ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If the exclusions are not different,

original: ci ltar tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: how can they be different?

original: ldog pa ni dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ldog pa ni dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The exclusions are not different from the entities.

original: nyes pa 'di med do //üîΩkun rdzob tu ni de dag las //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di med do // kun rdzob tu ni de dag las //
translated: There is no fault.üîΩThey are different conventionally,

original: tha dad don dam du ni min //
analyzed: tha dad don dam du ni min //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: des na sgra don tha dad dang // tha dad med pa'i rgyu mtshan yin //
analyzed: des na sgra don tha dad dang // tha dad med pa'i rgyu mtshan yin //
translated: Therefore, the reason for the difference and non-difference of the word and meaning is this.

original: don dam pa la ltos nas ni nam yang tha dad pa yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam pa la ltos nas ni nam yang tha dad pa yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In terms of the ultimate, they are never different.

original: kun rdzob tu ni de dag gnyis ka'i rang bzhin nyid do //üîΩ'di ltar / de 'bras @259a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni de dag gnyis ka'i rang bzhin nyid do // 'di ltar / de 'bras @259a * //
translated: But conventionally, they are both natures.üîΩThus:

original: can dang de 'bras med //
analyzed: can dang de 'bras med //
translated: It has a result, it does not have a result.

original: de de la tha dad don gcig / tha dad rten can 'phel ba dang // 'grib pa lta bur byed pa yi //üîΩbslad pa de dang de dag gis //
analyzed: de de la tha dad don gcig / tha dad rten can 'phel ba dang // 'grib pa lta bur byed pa yi // bslad pa de dang de dag gis //
translated: And is like an increase or decrease of something supported.üîΩBy these various corruptions,

original: 'brel pa 'ga' las de ldan nyid //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'ga' las de ldan nyid //
translated: It is related to them, and so it is said to possess them.

original: mi na yang mthong bar sbyor des na //
analyzed: mi na yang mthong bar sbyor des na //
translated: Even when not sick, one sees it, and so it is applied.

original: de dag bslad pa 'am shes ma yin //
analyzed: de dag bslad pa 'am shes ma yin //
translated: Therefore, they are corrupted, or not knowledge.

original: gal te tha snyad 'di kun rdzob tu yin na bag chags tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can tsam yin pas ci ltar mi slu ba yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad 'di kun rdzob tu yin na bag chags tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can tsam yin pas ci ltar mi slu ba yin zhing /
translated: If all these conventions are conventional, being mere reasons for mere imprints, how are they non-deceptive?

original: 'jig rten pa dag gis brtags te mi 'dor /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag gis brtags te mi 'dor /
translated: And why do worldly people not investigate and abandon them?

original: slu ba'i tha snyad ni 'ga' yang mi 'dor ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: slu ba'i tha snyad ni 'ga' yang mi 'dor ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Is it not the case that no deceptive convention is not abandoned?

original: 'di ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: This is just as it is.

original: ma brtags par zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: ma brtags par zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that it is without investigation.

original: gal te de nyid ci ltar rmongs tshabs che yang tshad mas gnod pa ma brtags par 'dug pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid ci ltar rmongs tshabs che yang tshad mas gnod pa ma brtags par 'dug pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: Even if delusion is very strong, if it is not investigated by valid cognition, it does not exist.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this, it is said:

original: mi slu ba'i phyir mi rtog go //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i phyir mi rtog go //
translated: It is not imagined because it is non-deceptive.

original: mi slu ba yod na tha snyad pa nang gi bye brag zhib mor rtogs pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: mi slu ba yod na tha snyad pa nang gi bye brag zhib mor rtogs pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: If there were nondeception, it would be impossible to understand the subtle distinctions of the conventional.

original: mi slu ba'i don du gnyer ba de thob pa na yang rtogs par 'os pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: mi slu ba'i don du gnyer ba de thob pa na yang rtogs par 'os pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: And even if one were to attain the goal of nondeception, it would not be proper to understand it.

original: / tha dad tha dad med slu ba //
analyzed: / tha dad tha dad med slu ba //
translated: Deception is neither different nor nondifferent

original: de la gang du dgos pa yin //
analyzed: de la gang du dgos pa yin //
translated: from that in which it is found.

original: bu ram las ni tha dad pa //
analyzed: bu ram las ni tha dad pa //
translated: If molasses were different from sugar,

original: sbrang rtsis don bya med par 'gyur //
analyzed: sbrang rtsis don bya med par 'gyur //
translated: sugar would not serve as its purpose.

original: don bya ba skye ba ni de ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam thob pas yin no //
analyzed: don bya ba skye ba ni de ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam thob pas yin no //
translated: The arising of a purpose is the attainment of mere exclusion from that which is not it.

original: chos kyi dbye ba ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las de'i 'bras bu can dang cig shos kyi mthar thug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbye ba ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags las de'i 'bras bu can dang cig shos kyi mthar thug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa yin no //
translated: The division of phenomena is imputed by conceptual thought, which has that as its result, from beginningless latent propensities.

original: mi slu ba dang ldan pa de ni dngos po dang 'brel pa las so //
analyzed: mi slu ba dang ldan pa de ni dngos po dang 'brel pa las so //
translated: That which possesses nondeception is related to things.

original: de la snang ba tha dad pa brtags pa dngos po'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa la ni mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de la snang ba tha dad pa brtags pa dngos po'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa la ni mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu nus pa ma yin la /
translated: In that regard, a person who desires to understand the reality of things should not investigate the imputation of different appearances.

original: don bya ba de don du gnyer ba gzhan dag kyang 'jig rten kyi tha snyad rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: don bya ba de don du gnyer ba gzhan dag kyang 'jig rten kyi tha snyad rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: And other people who are interested in the matter follow the conventions of the world.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩdpyod dang tha snyad dag gis ni //
analyzed: de skad du yang / dpyod dang tha snyad dag gis ni //
translated: And it is said:

original: 'jig rten pa yi lam gnas pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi lam gnas pa //
translated: The world abides in the path ofüîΩanalysis and convention.üîΩThe ignorant and the wise

original: byis pa dang ni mkhas pa dag / shes dang brjod pa 'dra ba nyid //üîΩces bshad do //
analyzed: byis pa dang ni mkhas pa dag / shes dang brjod pa 'dra ba nyid // ces bshad do //
translated: are alike in their knowledge and expression.

original: des na chos can de rtogs pa tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nye bar bslad pa 'grib pa dang 'phel ba lta bur byed pa dag gis tha snyad kyi 'brel pa 'ga' zhig las mthong ba la nye bar sbyor te /
analyzed: des na chos can de rtogs pa tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nye bar bslad pa 'grib pa dang 'phel ba lta bur byed pa dag gis tha snyad kyi 'brel pa 'ga' zhig las mthong ba la nye bar sbyor te /
translated: Therefore, the connection of a convention is applied to a seeing that is somehow affected by the characteristic of a conceptual discrimination, which has a cause for the difference in its understanding of that subject, as if it were a decrease or an increase.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba las thob pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba'i lam du byed do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba las thob pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba'i lam du byed do //
translated: And it is seen that the path of seeing is characterized by the attainment of that nature and the arising from that.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad pa de dag bslad pa'i shes pa ma yin no //üîΩde bas na @259b mthun pa'i phyogs sam /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad pa de dag bslad pa'i shes pa ma yin no //üîΩde bas na @259b mthun pa'i phyogs sam /
translated: Therefore, those conventions are not the knowledge that is affected by that.üîΩTherefore, the path of seeing is the attainment of the nature of the object of knowledge and the arising from that.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las kyang ldog par mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las kyang ldog par mi 'gal lo //
translated: It is not contradictory that it is reversed from the absence of the discordant class.

original: gzhan yang bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par grub pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par grub pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the pot, etc. are established as selfless,

original: srog la sogs pa med pa 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pa 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: the non-existence of life, etc. would be established.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med par ni grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med par ni grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And the pot, etc. are not established as selfless,

original: yod nyid sgrub byed byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yod nyid sgrub byed byed pa'i phyir //
translated: because the existence of the self is established by the proof.

original: de med ma yin the tshom 'gyur //
analyzed: de med ma yin the tshom 'gyur //
translated: There is doubt that it does not exist.

original: khas blangs tshad ma yin pa la //
analyzed: khas blangs tshad ma yin pa la //
translated: If the assertion is valid,

original: med pa nyid kyang rigs ma yin //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyang rigs ma yin //
translated: non-existence is also not reasonable.

original: gson po'i lus la bdag the tshom za ba na bum pa la sogs pa la the tshom mi za bar ji ltar 'gyur the tshom mi za ba ni srog la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: gson po'i lus la bdag the tshom za ba na bum pa la sogs pa la the tshom mi za bar ji ltar 'gyur the tshom mi za ba ni srog la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa 'am /
translated: When there is doubt about the self in the living body, how can there be no doubt about the pot, etc.? Without doubt, the proof of life, etc.

original: gzhan gyis yul du bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yul du bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: is not able to be taken as an object by another.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / med pa las ldog med na yang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / med pa las ldog med na yang //
translated: even if it is reversed from non-existence,

original: mthun phyogs las ldog the tshom za //
analyzed: mthun phyogs las ldog the tshom za //
translated: there is doubt that it is reversed from the concordant class.

original: de la the tshom za phyir te //
analyzed: de la the tshom za phyir te //
translated: Because there is doubt about that.

original: mi mthun phyogs las ldog par yang //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs las ldog par yang //
translated: and it is not the case that it is reversed from the discordant side.

original: bdag la the tshom za pas bum pa la sogs pa nyid mthun pa'i phyogs sam mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa gtol med do //
analyzed: bdag la the tshom za pas bum pa la sogs pa nyid mthun pa'i phyogs sam mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa gtol med do //
translated: Since we have doubt about the self, we do not know whether the pot, etc. are the similar or the discordant side.

original: des na mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par the tshom za ba des na ci ltar 'di ldog pa can yin /
analyzed: des na mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par the tshom za ba des na ci ltar 'di ldog pa can yin /
translated: Therefore, since we have doubt about whether it is reversed from the similar side, how can it be a negative?

original: gal te sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the pot, etc. are not without a self, because the Buddhist accepts them?

original: de lta na chos thams cad bdag dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir gson pa'i lus kyang bdag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na chos thams cad bdag dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir gson pa'i lus kyang bdag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, since all things are devoid of a self, the living body would also be without a self.

original: sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pas tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pas tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not a valid cognition because the Buddhist accepts it,

original: 'o na de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa yang des khas blangs pas bdag med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir nyes pa de nyid do //üîΩde'i phyir / phung po gnyis las gcig la ni //
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa yang des khas blangs pas bdag med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir nyes pa de nyid do // de'i phyir / phung po gnyis las gcig la ni //
translated: then at that time, since the pot, etc. are also accepted by him, they would not be without a self. Therefore, the fault remains.üîΩTherefore,

original: nges par grub par gzhan las ni //
analyzed: nges par grub par gzhan las ni //
translated: one of the two alternatives is definitely established,üîΩbut not the other.

original: ldog grub ma mthong ba yin yang //
analyzed: ldog grub ma mthong ba yin yang //
translated: But even though one does not see the absence of the counter-correlate,

original: mthong med dag la the tshom za //
analyzed: mthong med dag la the tshom za //
translated: one doubts what is not seen.

original: ma mthong ba yin yang mthong ba med pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir ma gyur pa dag las the tshom gyis ni 'ga' yang dngos po med par bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba yin yang mthong ba med pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir ma gyur pa dag las the tshom gyis ni 'ga' yang dngos po med par bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though one does not see the absence of the counter-correlate, one doubts what is not seen, but one cannot prove the non-existence of anything on the basis of what is not seen, but is characterized by non-perception.

original: gzhan yang bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med par sgrub tu chug pa de ltar na yang srog la sogs pas bdag bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med par sgrub tu chug pa de ltar na yang srog la sogs pas bdag bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, even if one grants that the self is established as non-existent in the case of the pot, etc., still one cannot establish the self by means of life, etc.

original: de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: For these are not established as the counter-correlate of the non-self.

original: 'jug pa yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their occurrence is possible.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa yin na ci ltar @260a * //üîΩde nyid la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa yin na ci ltar @260a * // de nyid la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If they are the counter-correlate of the non-self, how can they be the self?

original: bdag med pa gcig nyid srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang gzhan du yang 'gyur ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa gcig nyid srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang gzhan du yang 'gyur ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that the very same non-self should be endowed with life, etc., and also different.

original: 'di phyir rgas par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di phyir rgas par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that this is not so because of old age.

original: gcig gi ngo bor nges pa nyid du rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bor nges pa nyid du rigs so zhe na /
translated: It is reasonable that it is ascertained as the nature of one.üîΩThis is not so.

original: 'di ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus,

original: 'di ltar / gsal la khyab byed ma yin yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gsal la khyab byed ma yin yang //
translated: Although it is clear and not pervasive,

original: de yi rigs gyur don yod pas //
analyzed: de yi rigs gyur don yod pas //
translated: Its type exists, so

original: ma mthong pas 'gar de med do //
analyzed: ma mthong pas 'gar de med do //
translated: It is not nonexistent anywhere due to not being seen.

original: mkhregs pa mtshon gyis bcad pa bzhin //
analyzed: mkhregs pa mtshon gyis bcad pa bzhin //
translated: Like hardness cut by a weapon.

original: yod la 'gal ba ma mthong na //
analyzed: yod la 'gal ba ma mthong na //
translated: If the contradiction of existence is not seen,

original: the tshom gang las ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: the tshom gang las ldog par 'gyur //
translated: From what doubt will one turn back?

original: gang gis na bdag med pas gson po'i lus la srog la sogs pa yang mi ldan par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis na bdag med pas gson po'i lus la srog la sogs pa yang mi ldan par 'gyur ba /
translated: By what is it that, due to selflessness, the living body does not possess life, etc.?

original: bdag med do cog thams cad mtshungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag med do cog thams cad mtshungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Not all selflessnesses are the same.

original: 'on kyang bdag med pa nyid las 'ga' zhig ni srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / gzhan ni de lta ma yin par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag med pa nyid las 'ga' zhig ni srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / gzhan ni de lta ma yin par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: However, from selflessness, some possess life, etc., and others do not.

original: dper na mkhregs pa nyid las 'ga' zhig ni mtshon gyis bcad pa dang / gzhan ni gzhan du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mkhregs pa nyid las 'ga' zhig ni mtshon gyis bcad pa dang / gzhan ni gzhan du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, from hardness, some are cut by weapons and others are not.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / yod pa 'gal ba ma mthong na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yod pa 'gal ba ma mthong na //
translated: If the contradiction of existence is not seen,

original: the tshom gang las ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: the tshom gang las ldog par 'gyur //
translated: What is the contradiction from which it is reversed?

original: bdag med pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba grub pa med par ni srog la sogs pa las bdag med pa ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang lhan cig 'gal ba grub pa med par ni srog la sogs pa las bdag med pa ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The self is not reversed from life, etc. without the establishment of the contradiction of non-self.

original: gang gis de bzlog par 'gyur ba srog la sogs pa ni bdag med pa dang ; lhan cig mi gnas pa las gzhan pa'i 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de bzlog par 'gyur ba srog la sogs pa ni bdag med pa dang ; lhan cig mi gnas pa las gzhan pa'i 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Life, etc. are not a contradiction characterized by the contradiction of non-coexistence with non-self, other than that.

original: 'o na dngos su 'gal ba med kyang brgyud nas 'gal ba'i phyir srog la sogs pa bdag med pa ldog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos su 'gal ba med kyang brgyud nas 'gal ba'i phyir srog la sogs pa bdag med pa ldog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Well, although there is no direct contradiction, life, etc. reverse non-self because of the contradiction of the indirect.üîΩThat is not so.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: For,üîΩIn some cases, it is the result of that,

original: 'di ltar / de yang la lar de 'bras dang // bdag tu nges pa gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de yang la lar de 'bras dang // bdag tu nges pa gzhan ci yod //
translated: and what else is there that is definitely the self?

original: gal te srog la sogs pa bdag la nges pa yin na bdag med pa dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te srog la sogs pa bdag la nges pa yin na bdag med pa dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If life, etc. were definitely the self, they would be a contradiction with non-self.

original: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal bas khyab par bya ba yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dang 'gal bas khyab par bya ba yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pervasion is contradictory when there is a contradiction with the pervader.

original: srog la sogs pa ni bdag la nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni bdag la nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Life force and so on are not ascertained to be the self,

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las 'byung pa med pa nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las 'byung pa med pa nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not possible to ascertain that they are of the nature of the self or arise from the self,

original: de lta ma yin par nges pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsrog la sogs pa ni bdag gi 'bras bu nyid dam /
analyzed: de lta ma yin par nges pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro // srog la sogs pa ni bdag gi 'bras bu nyid dam /
translated: because it is impossible that they not be so.üîΩLife force and so on are not established by valid cognition to be the effect of the self

original: bdag gi bdag nyid du tshad mas mi 'grub pa //
analyzed: bdag gi bdag nyid du tshad mas mi 'grub pa //
translated: or to be of the nature of the self.

original: bdag dang 'brel pa med pa /
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel pa med pa /
translated: They are not related to the self.

original: des ni bdag med pa las kyang //
analyzed: des ni bdag med pa las kyang //
translated: Therefore, even if they were not the self,

original: de ni ldog par the tshom za //
analyzed: de ni ldog par the tshom za //
translated: there would be doubt that they are different from the self.

original: der 'brel pa @260b med pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ni ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der 'brel pa @260b med pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ni ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: If they were not related to it, they would not be different from its opposite.

original: ldog tu chug pa de lta na 'ang //
analyzed: ldog tu chug pa de lta na 'ang //
translated: Even if they were different,

original: bdag med med las bdag mi 'grub //
analyzed: bdag med med las bdag mi 'grub //
translated: the self would not be established as not being the self.

original: gang gis de ni ldog med pa //
analyzed: gang gis de ni ldog med pa //
translated: By what means would it be ascertained that it is not different?

original: nges pa dngos por 'dod ma yin //üîΩdper na srog sogs mthun phyogs la //
analyzed: nges pa dngos por 'dod ma yin // dper na srog sogs mthun phyogs la //
translated: It is not asserted to be a real entity.

original: ldog pa med kyang yod min bzhin //
analyzed: ldog pa med kyang yod min bzhin //
translated: For example, even though life force and so on are not different from the concordant class,üîΩthey are not existent.

original: gal te gtan tshigs mthun phyogs las //
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs mthun phyogs las //
translated: If a reason is not different from the concordant class,

original: ldog med de rgyu rjes 'gro can //
analyzed: ldog med de rgyu rjes 'gro can //
translated: it is not a reason that follows the pervasion.

original: rjes 'gro can min ldog med pa //
analyzed: rjes 'gro can min ldog med pa //
translated: It is not a subsequent state, nor is it a reversal.

original: bdag med ma yin bdag bcas min //
analyzed: bdag med ma yin bdag bcas min //
translated: It is not a non-self, nor is it a self.üîΩJust as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,üîΩand the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,üîΩso too the absence of a self is not in the body.üîΩJust as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,

original: ci ltar mthun phyogs la med pa med kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar mthun phyogs la med pa med kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: and the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,üîΩso too the absence of a self is not in the body.üîΩJust as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,üîΩand the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,üîΩso too the absence of a self is not in the body.

original: bdag med pa med kyang gson po'i lus la bdag yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa med kyang gson po'i lus la bdag yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,

original: mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa ma yin nam /
translated: and the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,üîΩso too the absence of a self is not in the body.üîΩJust as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,

original: 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la ni ldog pa med kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la ni ldog pa med kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: and the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,

original: de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: so too the absence of a self is not in the body.üîΩJust as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,

original: med pa la ni dngos po srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa la ni dngos po srid pa ma yin no //
translated: and the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,üîΩso too the absence of a self is not in the body.üîΩJust as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,üîΩand the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,üîΩso too the absence of a self is not in the body.

original: de yod pa'i phyir gson po'i lus la ldog pa med na don mi za bar yod par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir gson po'i lus la ldog pa med na don mi za bar yod par 'gyur te ;
translated: Just as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,

original: phung po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phung po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: and the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,üîΩso too the absence of a self is not in the body.üîΩJust as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,üîΩand the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,üîΩso too the absence of a self is not in the body.üîΩJust as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,üîΩand the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: so too the absence of a self is not in the body.üîΩJust as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye bar bkod pa tsam nyid kyis ni 'dod pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye bar bkod pa tsam nyid kyis ni 'dod pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: and the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,üîΩso too the absence of a self is not in the body.üîΩJust as the absence of a pot is not in a cloth,

original: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ma yin na /
translated: and the absence of a cloth is not in a pot,üîΩso too the absence of a self is not in the body.üîΩJust as the absence of

original: 'o na de nyid med pa mi ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na de nyid med pa mi ldog pa yin no //
translated: But if the absence of that is not refuted, then it is not possible to refute the existence of the self.

original: med pa log na ni gdon mi za bar dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa log na ni gdon mi za bar dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: If the absence is refuted, then the existence of the self is established,

original: yod pa ni med pa ldog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ni med pa ldog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existence of the self is the absence of its nonexistence.

original: 'on te mthun phyogs med pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhes na /
analyzed: 'on te mthun phyogs med pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhes na /
translated: But if you say that it is not so, because there is no similar instance,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: med pa nyid du med 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid du med 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that nonexistence is nonexistent.
