original: srog la sogs pa yod na ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs med par 'gyur /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa yod na ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs med par 'gyur /
translated: If life and so on exist, how can there be no similar instance?

original: ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa ldog pa med kyang bzlog par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gson po'i lus la bdag med pa ldog kyang bzlog par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te gson po'i lus ni yod pa'i phyir bzlog par 'gyur gyi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la sogs pa ldog pa med kyang bzlog par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gson po'i lus la bdag med pa ldog kyang bzlog par mi 'gyur ro // 'on te gson po'i lus ni yod pa'i phyir bzlog par 'gyur gyi mthun pa'i phyogs la ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as the absence of life and so on is not refuted even though there is no similar instance, in the same way, the absence of the self in the living body is not refuted even though it is not refuted in the similar instance.

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you say that the absence of the self in the living body is refuted because the living body exists, but not in the similar instance because it does not exist,

original: med pa la ni dngos po srid pa ma yin no zhe na /üîΩ'o na med pa nyid mi ldog go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa la ni dngos po srid pa ma yin no zhe na /üîΩ'o na med pa nyid mi ldog go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not possible for a nonexistent thing to exist.üîΩBut if the absence of the self in the living body is not refuted, then the absence of the self is not refuted.

original: med pa ni yod pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir de ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: med pa ni yod pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir de ldog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: because nonexistence is incompatible with existence.

original: med pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir de ni mi ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: med pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir de ni mi ldog pa nyid do //
translated: But nonexistence is not incompatible with nonexistence, so it is not refuted.

original: ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as there is no similar instance,

original: de la gzhan yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gzhan yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: so there is no counterexample.

original: med pa la ni med pa nyid 'gal ba ma yin no //üîΩ'on te de de la @261a * //
analyzed: med pa la ni med pa nyid 'gal ba ma yin no // 'on te de de la @261a * //
translated: For nonexistence is not incompatible with nonexistence.

original: med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is nonexistence,üîΩthen it is not refuted.

original: de lta yin na gson po'i lus la bdag med pa ldog pa yin yang bdag med pa bzlog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na gson po'i lus la bdag med pa ldog pa yin yang bdag med pa bzlog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, even if the nonexistence of the self in the living body is refuted, nonexistence is not refuted.

original: dper na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa med kyang med pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa med kyang med pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though existence is not in the similar instance, nonexistence is not.

original: de yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it exists,

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: that is not so.üîΩHow can there be a mistaken ascertainment

original: gzhan yod pa yi ci ltar na //üîΩ'khrul pa can nges pa zhes byar 'gyur //üîΩrang gi nyes pas 'khrul pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan yod pa yi ci ltar na // 'khrul pa can nges pa zhes byar 'gyur // rang gi nyes pas 'khrul pa ni //
translated: of what exists in another?üîΩHow can the error of one

original: gzhan gyis ci ltar gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ci ltar gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: be the error of another?

original: rang nyid 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ji ltar gzhan yod pas mi 'khrul pa'am gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: rang nyid 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ji ltar gzhan yod pas mi 'khrul pa'am gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: How could that error of yours be non-erroneous or otherwise due to the existence of something else?

original: gzhan yang gal te med pa la yod pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin la med pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te med pa la yod pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin la med pa yang ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if something that does not exist does not exist, and also is not nonexistent,

original: med pa yang yod pa la yod pa yang ma yin no med pa yang ma yin no med pa yang ma yin no zhes ci ste khas mi len /
analyzed: med pa yang yod pa la yod pa yang ma yin no med pa yang ma yin no med pa yang ma yin no zhes ci ste khas mi len /
translated: why do you not accept that it is not nonexistent and also not existent?

original: ci ltar med pa gzhi ma yin pa de bzhin du rten pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: ci ltar med pa gzhi ma yin pa de bzhin du rten pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Just as it is not a basis because it does not exist, so it is not a support. This is nonsense.

original: 'dir yang sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'dir yang sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Here, too, it has already been explained.

original: gzhan yang dngos po med pa tsam ni bdag med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po med pa tsam ni bdag med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, mere non-entity is not selflessness.

original: 'on kyang so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: However, the self that has a nature of determination is a non-entity.

original: so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin ma mthong par der 'grub pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin ma mthong par der 'grub pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it established as that without seeing the nature of determination.

original: dngos po med pa ni phan tshun ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni phan tshun ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: Non-entity is not mutually exclusive.

original: dngos po tha dad na dngos po rnams kyi de med pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad na dngos po rnams kyi de med pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are different things, then the non-existence of those things would be different.

original: dngos po so sor nges pa med na /
analyzed: dngos po so sor nges pa med na /
translated: If there is no determination of individual things,

original: de'i dngos po med pas tha dad par ga la 'byung /
analyzed: de'i dngos po med pas tha dad par ga la 'byung /
translated: how could there be a difference due to the non-existence of those things?

original: gang gis de las bzlog pa med pa de yod par 'grub par bdag ni so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: gang gis de las bzlog pa med pa de yod par 'grub par bdag ni so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa med do //
translated: I do not observe a nature of self that is the opposite of that.

original: des na bdag med pa med na dngos po med pa ldog pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: des na bdag med pa med na dngos po med pa ldog pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, if there is no self, then the mere negation of things is exhausted.

original: bdag 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag 'grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the establishment of a self is not.üîΩThus, the summary:

original: de'i phyir / gal te gtan tshigs mthun phyogs las //üîΩldog med de rgyu rjes 'gro can //üîΩrjes 'gro can min ldog min na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te gtan tshigs mthun phyogs las // ldog med de rgyu rjes 'gro can // rjes 'gro can min ldog min na //
translated: If the reason does not negate the similar class,üîΩthen it is not a reason that follows.üîΩIf it is not a reason that follows, then it is not a reason that negates.

original: bdag med ma yin bdag bcas min //üîΩzhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //üîΩgzhan yang / 'jug la gang gi rang bdag nyid //
analyzed: bdag med ma yin bdag bcas min // zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o // gzhan yang / 'jug la gang gi rang bdag nyid //
translated: It is not a reason that is not a reason that negates.üîΩMoreover:

original: gang med mi 'byung can grub pa //
analyzed: gang med mi 'byung can grub pa //
translated: That which does not occur without a specific nature is established.

original: de phyir de nyid ldog byed de //
analyzed: de phyir de nyid ldog byed de //
translated: Therefore, it is the negation of that.

original: 'jug pa na yang 'jug byed yin //
analyzed: 'jug pa na yang 'jug byed yin //
translated: When it occurs, it is the cause of occurrence.

original: 'jug la rten sgrub pa dag la //
analyzed: 'jug la rten sgrub pa dag la //
translated: The reason is established by the proof of the forward and reverse pervasions.

original: du ba gang gis rang gi ngo bo me med na mi 'byung ba can du grub pa'i me de nyid rang log pa na ldog par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: du ba gang gis rang gi ngo bo me med na mi 'byung ba can du grub pa'i me de nyid rang log pa na ldog par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The reason is established as having the nature of not occurring without the property to be established. When the fire is reversed, the reason is reversed.

original: gzhan ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that another reason is established.

original: 'jug pa na yang me de nyid du ba la sogs pa 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes @261b bya ba ni tshad ma'i rtogs pa yin no //üîΩmed na mi 'byung de yang ni //
analyzed: 'jug pa na yang me de nyid du ba la sogs pa 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes @261b bya ba ni tshad ma'i rtogs pa yin no // med na mi 'byung de yang ni //
translated: The understanding of the valid cognition is that when the reason occurs, it is the fire itself that causes the occurrence of the smoke, etc.

original: sgrub par byed la ldog pa yin //
analyzed: sgrub par byed la ldog pa yin //
translated: And that non-occurrence is the proof of the reverse pervasion.

original: 'bras bu mthong dang ma mthong ba //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong dang ma mthong ba //
translated: The effect is seen or not seen.

original: de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid //
analyzed: de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid //
translated: Those are the cause and effect.

original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid ni sgrub par byed pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can rjes su 'gro ldog gyi sgrub byed du gyur pa med pa rab tu bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid ni sgrub par byed pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i mtshan nyid can rjes su 'gro ldog gyi sgrub byed du gyur pa med pa rab tu bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Non-occurrence is not the proof of the establishment of the non-occurrence of the proof of the forward pervasion, which has the characteristic of being seen or not seen.

original: gal te tha dad pa dag ni med na mi 'byung ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa yin gyi mthong ba dang ma mthong bas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa dag ni med na mi 'byung ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa yin gyi mthong ba dang ma mthong bas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the non-existence of the different is the cause of the non-existence of the effect, and not the seeing or not seeing of the cause,

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the seeing and not seeing of the cause are the cause of the effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las gzhan ma yin la /
translated: The cause and effect are not different from the following and the ceasing.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag kyang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag kyang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The following and the ceasing are not different from the seeing and the not seeing.

original: de yod na yod nges med phyir //
analyzed: de yod na yod nges med phyir //
translated: The existence of the effect is certain when the cause exists, and it is not when the cause does not exist.

original: don gzhan rtogs par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: don gzhan rtogs par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the effect is not understood as a different object.

original: de khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the pervader.

original: khyab par byed pa ma yin pa ldog pa ni gzhan ldog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ma yin pa ldog pa ni gzhan ldog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The non-existence of the non-pervading is not the non-existence of the other.

original: bdag kyang khyab par byed pa ma grub pas de ci ltar 'dir srog la sogs pa ldog par byed pa yin /
analyzed: bdag kyang khyab par byed pa ma grub pas de ci ltar 'dir srog la sogs pa ldog par byed pa yin /
translated: And the self is not established as the pervader, so how can it cause the ceasing of life, etc.?

original: 'di ltar / rtag tu yod pa med pa na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rtag tu yod pa med pa na //
translated: If it always exists, it is not nonexistent.

original: de dag med pa mi srid phyir //
analyzed: de dag med pa mi srid phyir //
translated: Because it is impossible for it to be nonexistent.

original: bdag nyid rang nyid yul dang dus dag tu log pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid rang nyid yul dang dus dag tu log pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the self itself is absent in a particular place or time,

original: rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent and pervasive.

original: des na de med pas srog la sogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ma grub po //
analyzed: des na de med pas srog la sogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, since it is not nonexistent, it is not the case that life force and so on do not exist.

original: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba tsam nyid las bdag srog la sogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba tsam nyid las bdag srog la sogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: But if you think that the self is the cause of life force and so on merely through its presence,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po thams cad ni thams cad du ldog pa la ltos pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po thams cad ni thams cad du ldog pa la ltos pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then the status of cause and effect would not depend on anything else.

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: That also is not tenable.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar ; 'bras bu'i rang bzhin tha dad rnams //
analyzed: 'di ltar ; 'bras bu'i rang bzhin tha dad rnams //
translated: Because effects that have different natures

original: rgyu rnams las ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu rnams las ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: arise from causes,

original: de dag med par gzhan las 'byung //
analyzed: de dag med par gzhan las 'byung //
translated: they would arise from others if they did not exist.

original: ci ltar des bskyed rang bzhin yin //üîΩgal te rjes su 'gro ba tsam 'ba' zhig las /
analyzed: ci ltar des bskyed rang bzhin yin // gal te rjes su 'gro ba tsam 'ba' zhig las /
translated: How could they have a nature produced by that?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na /
translated: If the status of cause and effect were to exist merely through the presence of the effect,üîΩthen the effect would arise from others.

original: de'i tshe med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be nonexistent.

original: des na de dag med par yang gzhan las 'byung 'bras bu ci ltar des bskyed pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur /
analyzed: des na de dag med par yang gzhan las 'byung 'bras bu ci ltar des bskyed pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could an effect arise from something else, since it does not arise from that?

original: gzhan las kyang 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it arises from something else,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gzhan las de'i rang bzhin mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan las de'i rang bzhin mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its nature does not arise from something else.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni de nyid ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni de nyid ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: If it does not have that nature, it is not that.

original: tshogs pa'i nus pa tha dad phyir //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i nus pa tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the capacity of the assemblage is different,

original: @262a * // dngos rnams sna tshogs ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: @262a * // dngos rnams sna tshogs ngo bo nyid //
translated: things have a variety of natures.

original: gal te de tha dad byed min //
analyzed: gal te de tha dad byed min //
translated: If it is not a differentiator,

original: 'gro ba'i ngo bo gcig tu 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ngo bo gcig tu 'gyur //
translated: the nature of the world would be the same.

original: gal te tshogs pa tha dad pa las tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa tha dad pa las tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las /
translated: If you say that a difference arises from a different assemblage, where is that?

original: tha dad pa ni re zhig de dmigs na de'i rgyu'i dbye bas yin nam /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni re zhig de dmigs na de'i rgyu'i dbye bas yin nam /
translated: If a difference is observed, is it due to a difference in its cause?

original: 'on te de lta ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni dpyod pa gzhan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de lta ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni dpyod pa gzhan yin no zhe na /
translated: Or is it not so? This is another analysis.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar / srog sogs 'brel pa dag las ni //üîΩma mthong bdag ni rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / srog sogs 'brel pa dag las ni // ma mthong bdag ni rtogs pa yin //
translated: The self is known from its relation to life force, etc.

original: nges pa med de de dang de //
analyzed: nges pa med de de dang de //
translated: It is not ascertained, and how could it

original: ci ltar 'gyur ba ma yin na //
analyzed: ci ltar 'gyur ba ma yin na //
translated: not be changed into something else?

original: ci ltar bdag khyab pa dang rtag pa dang rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar bdag khyab pa dang rtag pa dang rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyi rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the self is the cause of pervasion, permanence, and mere succession,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: so too are space, etc.

original: des na bdag bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa yang rtogs par 'gyur bas na don mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na bdag bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa yang rtogs par 'gyur bas na don mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, just like the self, space, etc. would be known, and so the point is not established.

original: 'on te skul bar byed pa'i bdag med par srog la sogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te skul bar byed pa'i bdag med par srog la sogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But if the self that is the instigator does not exist, then life force, etc. would not exist.

original: des na sbud pa 'bud mkhan lta bur bdag rtogs par byed pa'am /
analyzed: des na sbud pa 'bud mkhan lta bur bdag rtogs par byed pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the self is known to be like the bellows‚Äô blower,

original: byed pa dag las pho long 'phen mkhan lta bu'am /
analyzed: byed pa dag las pho long 'phen mkhan lta bu'am /
translated: or like the one who throws the ball,

original: mthong ba las skar khung gi bu gnas lta bar byed pa lta bur rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba las skar khung gi bu gnas lta bar byed pa lta bur rtogs so zhe na /
translated: or like the one who sees from the window‚Äôs opening.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That also is illogical.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / bya med khyab par skul byed du //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bya med khyab par skul byed du //
translated: The self is not known as the instigator of the inactive and pervasive.

original: tshad ma yis ni 'thad ma yin //üîΩbyed pa med na mi mthong phyir / bdag gi rab tu 'grub ma yin /
analyzed: tshad ma yis ni 'thad ma yin // byed pa med na mi mthong phyir / bdag gi rab tu 'grub ma yin /
translated: It is not established by a valid cognition.

original: // / bam po bcu bzhin pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu bzhin pa /
translated: And it is not established by the self, because it is not seen when the self does not exist.

original: sbud pa sbud par byed pa ci byed pa dang bcas pas skul bar byed pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: sbud pa sbud par byed pa ci byed pa dang bcas pas skul bar byed pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The bellows, which is the instrument, is activated by the effort of the agent.

original: de bzhin du khyab par byed pa ma yin kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyab par byed pa ma yin kyang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the self is not the pervader.

original: bdag ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar de sgrub par byed pa nyid yin /
analyzed: bdag ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar de sgrub par byed pa nyid yin /
translated: But the self is not like that. So how can it be the activator?

original: khyab pa dang lus can ma yin pa ni skul bar byed pa nyid du rigs pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa dang lus can ma yin pa ni skul bar byed pa nyid du rigs pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that the nonpervading and the nonembodied are the activators.

original: 'on te de skul bar byed pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te de skul bar byed pa yin na ni /
translated: But if the self is the activator,

original: de la yang skul bar byed pa gzhan yod pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
analyzed: de la yang skul bar byed pa gzhan yod pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
translated: then there would be an infinite regress, because there would have to be another activator for the self.

original: skar khung gi nang nas lta ba ni skyes bu mig la sogs pa'i byed pa dang ldan pa yin gyi bdag ni de ltar gyur pa ma yin na /
analyzed: skar khung gi nang nas lta ba ni skyes bu mig la sogs pa'i byed pa dang ldan pa yin gyi bdag ni de ltar gyur pa ma yin na /
translated: The person who sees through a window has eyes and so on, but the self is not like that.

original: ci ltar lta ba po yin /
analyzed: ci ltar lta ba po yin /
translated: So how can it be the seer?

original: de de la yang byed pa la sogs pa yod pa yin /
analyzed: de de la yang byed pa la sogs pa yod pa yin /
translated: and that would also have another agent, etc.

original: de la yang skar khung nas lta bar byed pa lta bu gzhan yod par rigs pas thug pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la yang skar khung nas lta bar byed pa lta bu gzhan yod par rigs pas thug pa med pa nyid do //
translated: and that would also have another, like one who looks through a window.

original: gzhan yang me la sogs pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang me la sogs pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the state of being cause and effect were due to the relation of concomitance and the reverse concomitance of fire, etc.,

original: de gzhan la rnam pa gzhan du ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de gzhan la rnam pa gzhan du ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could that be otherwise in another?

original: 'on te @262b der yang rjes su 'gro ba tsam 'ba' zhig las yin na /
analyzed: 'on te @262b der yang rjes su 'gro ba tsam 'ba' zhig las yin na /
translated: But if it were just the mere relation of concomitance,

original: de lta yin na de dag med par gzhan pa las kyang 'byung ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na de dag med par gzhan pa las kyang 'byung ngo zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it would follow that it would occur even in the absence of those,

original: de lta ma yin na ldog pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ldog pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise, the reverse concomitance would not exist.

original: de ltar yin dang de dag med par gzhan las kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang de dag med par gzhan las kyang 'byung ste /
translated: If that were so, it would occur even in the absence of those,

original: brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa dag kyang 'byung bas ci ltar mes bskyed par bya ba yin /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa dag kyang 'byung bas ci ltar mes bskyed par bya ba yin /
translated: but since it does not occur in the absence of those, how could it be generated by fire?

original: gnyi gas med par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi gas med par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: It is generated by both.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de las gzhan las 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan las 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: It is not a cause of both, because it arises from something other than those two.

original: gnyi ga la yang rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang rgyu ma yin no //
translated: It is not a cause of both, because it arises from something other than those two.

original: de las gzhan pa las kyang byung ba ni de'i 'bras bu ma yin la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa las kyang byung ba ni de'i 'bras bu ma yin la /
translated: That which arises from something other than that is not its effect.

original: gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar gyur na 'bras bu tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag / rgyu tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa la rag las pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ro // de ltar gyur na 'bras bu tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag / rgyu tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa la rag las pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: And that which is not the effect of that is not a cause, because the nature of cause and effect would not exist.

original: de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, then the effect, whether different or non-different from the cause, would not be dependent on the cause, whether different or non-different from the effect, because it would not exist.

original: mthong ba bzhin du ji ltar spang zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba bzhin du ji ltar spang zhe na /
translated: How can one abandon what is seen, as it were?

original: ma yin te rgyu dang 'bras bu med na mthong ba yang mi srid pa nyid do ;
analyzed: ma yin te rgyu dang 'bras bu med na mthong ba yang mi srid pa nyid do ;
translated: No, because if there is no cause and effect, then seeing is not possible.

original: / rtogs pa nges pa yin na sngon po'i rnam par shes pas sngon po rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: / rtogs pa nges pa yin na sngon po'i rnam par shes pas sngon po rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If there is ascertainment of the object, then consciousness of blue ascertains blue,

original: de lta ma yin na 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise there would be no distinction between correct and incorrect.

original: gal te tshogs 'di 'dra ba 'khrul pa dang cig shos kyi rtogs pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes pa de'i tshe ni gzhal bya so sor nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tshogs 'di 'dra ba 'khrul pa dang cig shos kyi rtogs pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes pa de'i tshe ni gzhal bya so sor nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this assembly of conditions generates error and the other, knowledge, then the object of apprehension would be ascertained individually.

original: de lta ma yin na ci zhig ltar snang ba tsam yin par 'gyur bas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mtha' dag tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ci zhig ltar snang ba tsam yin par 'gyur bas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad mtha' dag tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would be just as it appears, and all mundane conventions would be valid cognitions.

original: 'on te snang ba rang nyid phan tshun tha dad pa ni rang nyid rig pa'i rtogs pas gzhal bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba rang nyid phan tshun tha dad pa ni rang nyid rig pa'i rtogs pas gzhal bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the appearance itself, which is mutually different, is apprehended by the knowledge that is self-aware,

original: de yang mi bden te /üîΩsnang ba tsam las 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te / snang ba tsam las 'jig rten gyi //
translated: that is also not correct.üîΩMundane conventions are not established

original: tha snyad 'grub par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: tha snyad 'grub par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: from mere appearance.

original: de tsam 'ba' zhig snang ba ni de las gzhan pa ci byar yod /
analyzed: de tsam 'ba' zhig snang ba ni de las gzhan pa ci byar yod /
translated: If only that mere appearance appears, what else could be done about it?

original: don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po blang bar bya ba'am gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po blang bar bya ba'am gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi tha snyad yin no //
translated: The convention of the wise is that the entity that performs the function of an object is either to be adopted or rejected.

original: snang ba tsam ni de'i skad cig nyid la /
analyzed: snang ba tsam ni de'i skad cig nyid la /
translated: Mere appearance is just that moment.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba yin pas blang ba dang dor bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba yin pas blang ba dang dor bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not to be accepted or rejected.

original: de ltar na rnam par rig pa tsam gnyis med pa yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par rig pa tsam gnyis med pa yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because of the non-duality of mere representation, there is neither difference nor non-difference.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha dad med pa ni 'bras bu'i dngos po las yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha dad med pa ni 'bras bu'i dngos po las yin la /
translated: Therefore, difference and non-difference are due to the nature of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las yin pa'i phyir bdag gang gi @263a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las yin pa'i phyir bdag gang gi @263a * //
translated: And that nature of cause and effect is due to positive and negative concomitance.

original: yang rgyu ma yin pas na de ni gang las kyang rjes su dpag pa med do //
analyzed: yang rgyu ma yin pas na de ni gang las kyang rjes su dpag pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since it is not the cause of anything, it is not inferred from anything.üîΩThus:

original: des na / tshogs pa'i nus pa tha dad phyir //
analyzed: des na / tshogs pa'i nus pa tha dad phyir //
translated: Because of the difference in the power of the collection,

original: dngos rnams sna tshogs ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: dngos rnams sna tshogs ngo bo nyid //
translated: things have a variety of natures.

original: gal te de tha dad byed min //
analyzed: gal te de tha dad byed min //
translated: If that does not make them different,

original: 'gro 'di ngo bo gcig tu 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro 'di ngo bo gcig tu 'gyur //
translated: this world would have a single nature.

original: ngo bo gcig ces bya ba ni blang bya dang spang bya med pa'am /
analyzed: ngo bo gcig ces bya ba ni blang bya dang spang bya med pa'am /
translated: A single nature means that there is nothing to accept or reject,

original: snang ba tsam gnyis su med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba tsam gnyis su med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or it means that mere appearance is non-dual.

original: 'on te brgya byin gyi spyi bo ni me'i rang bzhin yang yin la /
analyzed: 'on te brgya byin gyi spyi bo ni me'i rang bzhin yang yin la /
translated: Or is the crown of ≈öakra‚Äôs head the nature of fire?üîΩ

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i rang bzhin yang yin no //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i rang bzhin yang yin no //
translated: But the head of Indra is of the nature of fire and also of a nature contrary to that of fire.

original: des na me'i 'bras bu de las kyang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na me'i 'bras bu de las kyang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the effect of fire is also different from that.

original: 'di la bshad pa ni /üîΩ'di tha dad byed tha dad byed //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ni / 'di tha dad byed tha dad byed //
translated: The response to this is:üîΩIf it is not different from that which produces it,

original: min na rang bzhin gcig nyid nyams //
analyzed: min na rang bzhin gcig nyid nyams //
translated: then its identity with it is undermined.

original: gcig ni rang bzhin du ma na //
analyzed: gcig ni rang bzhin du ma na //
translated: If one is of many natures,

original: me dang me min rang bzhin gnyis //
analyzed: me dang me min rang bzhin gnyis //
translated: then fire and non-fire are of two natures.

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of different things is that they have different natures.

original: des na du ba skyed par byed pa ni me nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na du ba skyed par byed pa ni me nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since it is fire itself that produces smoke,

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: there is no error in the inference from effect to cause.

original: de me'i rang bzhin yin na brgya byin gyi spyi bo gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de me'i rang bzhin yin na brgya byin gyi spyi bo gzhan ma yin no //
translated: If that is of the nature of fire, then the head of Indra is not different from that.

original: rang bzhin gang gis tha dad pa de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid pas 'khrul pa'i dogs pa ga la yod /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis tha dad pa de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid pas 'khrul pa'i dogs pa ga la yod /
translated: Since that which is different by nature is not a producer, how can there be any doubt of error?

original: des na gzhan ni des bskyed pa'i //
analyzed: des na gzhan ni des bskyed pa'i //
translated: Therefore, the other is generated by that.üîΩ

original: rang bzhin yin te de nyid ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin yin te de nyid ni //
translated: Therefore, the other is the nature produced by that.üîΩThat itself

original: de bskyed rang bzhin ma yin na //
analyzed: de bskyed rang bzhin ma yin na //
translated: is not the nature produced by that.

original: de ni de las ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de las ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be that?

original: de phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag / phan tshun rang bzhin nges pa nyid //
analyzed: de phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag / phan tshun rang bzhin nges pa nyid //
translated: Therefore, cause and effect are mutually ascertained natures.üîΩTherefore,

original: des na rang nyid mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: des na rang nyid mthong ba bzhin //
translated: just as one sees oneself,

original: 'bras bu mthong yang de rtogs 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong yang de rtogs 'gyur //
translated: one understands that effect by seeing that cause.

original: 'o na / chu dang 'o mas rul 'gyur bzhin //
analyzed: 'o na / chu dang 'o mas rul 'gyur bzhin //
translated: But if it is said, ‚ÄúJust as water and milk spoil,

original: du ma las gcig ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: du ma las gcig ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could one arise from many?‚Äù

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gsher nus gang las rul 'gyur der //
analyzed: gsher nus gang las rul 'gyur der //
translated: From whatever has the ability to spoil,

original: gnyi ga gcig nyid ci 'di ni //
analyzed: gnyi ga gcig nyid ci 'di ni //
translated: how could both be the same?

original: tha dad gcig pa'i bdag nyid dam //
analyzed: tha dad gcig pa'i bdag nyid dam //
translated: Is it the nature of the different being the same?

original: tha dad gsher nyid ci ltar yin //
analyzed: tha dad gsher nyid ci ltar yin //
translated: How could the different be the same?

original: de yi rang bzhin can gyi blo //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin can gyi blo //
translated: The mind that has the nature of that

original: tha dad med phyir gcig ces brjod //
analyzed: tha dad med phyir gcig ces brjod //
translated: is said to be the same because it is not different.

original: chu dang 'o ma rang bzhin gcig pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma rang bzhin gcig pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Water and milk are not the same nature.

original: de las gzhan sra ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las gzhan sra ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid do //
translated: But in reality, the rotten fruit is not the same as the fruit, because it is different from it in the nature of being hard, etc.

original: 'bras bu rul pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rul pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true of the rotten fire.

original: don dam par na rul pa yang gcig nyid ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par na rul pa yang gcig nyid ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In reality, the rotten fire is not the same as the fire,

original: 'on kyang de las gzhan las ldog pas de skad brjod pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de las gzhan las ldog pas de skad brjod pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //
translated: but it is called that because it is different from other fires.

original: de gzhan me ni tha dad kyi //üîΩcha gang gis na mer rtogs pa'i //
analyzed: de gzhan me ni tha dad kyi // cha gang gis na mer rtogs pa'i //
translated: The fire is different from the other,üîΩbut by what part is it the basisüîΩof the cognition of fire?

original: rten yin des ni de skyed pa //
analyzed: rten yin des ni de skyed pa //
translated: That part produces the fire,

original: des na de ltar rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: des na de ltar rtogs pa yin //
translated: and so it is cognized as fire.

original: @263b mer shes yan lag gzhan la ni //
analyzed: @263b mer shes yan lag gzhan la ni //
translated: The cognition of fire is based on another part,

original: ltos pa nyid las 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ltos pa nyid las 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: because it arises in dependence on that.üîΩThe cognition of smoke is not mistaken

original: du ba de la 'khrul med can //
analyzed: du ba de la 'khrul med can //
translated: with regard to that smoke,

original: de ltar 'bras gzhan de bzhin grub //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras gzhan de bzhin grub //
translated: and so the other effect is established in the same way.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni chu dang 'o ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni chu dang 'o ma bzhin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way‚Äù means like the water and the milk.

original: chu dang 'o ma tha dad kyang gsher ba nyid kyis de las gzhan dag las ldog pas na gsher ba nyid du rtogs pa'i gzhi yin pa bzhin du me tha dad kyang de las gzhan dag la ldog pa nyid kyis me rtogs pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma tha dad kyang gsher ba nyid kyis de las gzhan dag las ldog pas na gsher ba nyid du rtogs pa'i gzhi yin pa bzhin du me tha dad kyang de las gzhan dag la ldog pa nyid kyis me rtogs pa'i rten yin no //
translated: Water and milk are different, but they are the basis for the understanding of wetness because of the exclusion of other things that are not wet. In the same way, fire is different, but it is the basis for the understanding of fire because of the exclusion of other things that are not fire.

original: cha gang gis zhes bya ba ni mer rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: cha gang gis zhes bya ba ni mer rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy what part‚Äù means by what cause of the understanding of fire.

original: de nyid kyis rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis rtogs pa yin te /
translated: It is understood by that alone,

original: gzhan du ni 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is mistaken in other cases.

original: mer rtogs pa'i yan lag med par ni du ba mi skyed pa'i phyir de la 'khrul pa med do //üîΩ'di ltar / du ba bud shing 'gyur ba yi //
analyzed: mer rtogs pa'i yan lag med par ni du ba mi skyed pa'i phyir de la 'khrul pa med do // 'di ltar / du ba bud shing 'gyur ba yi //
translated: There is no mistake in that, because smoke is not produced without the cause of the understanding of fire.üîΩThus:

original: yan lag la brten mer 'jog phyir //üîΩgal te me min de du min //
analyzed: yan lag la brten mer 'jog phyir // gal te me min de du min //
translated: Because fire is posited in dependence on the part of the transformation of fuel,üîΩif it is not fire, it is not smoke.

original: gal te de du de med nyid //
analyzed: gal te de du de med nyid //
translated: If it is smoke, it does not exist.

original: du ba dang bud shing gi rnam par 'gyur ba de dag gi /
analyzed: du ba dang bud shing gi rnam par 'gyur ba de dag gi /
translated: The transformation of fuel and smoke

original: yan lag nyid me yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag nyid me yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: are the parts of fire, but nothing else.

original: des na gal te brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa 'di dro ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin na de'i tshe de du ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gal te brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa 'di dro ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin na de'i tshe de du ba ma yin te /
translated: If the head of Indra and so on are not the characteristics of heat and so on, then at that time they are not smoke.

original: blangs pa la sogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: blangs pa la sogs pa nyid do //
translated: They are just the head of Indra and so on.

original: 'di nyid ga las gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes ma mthong ba ni nges par rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di nyid ga las gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes ma mthong ba ni nges par rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not reasonable to ascertain that ‚Äúthis is not seen elsewhere.‚Äù

original: 'o na sngon po la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las de lta min na sngon po nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sngon po la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las de lta min na sngon po nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is not so, then blue also is not seen elsewhere. If it is not so, then it is not blue.

original: du ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes 'di ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: du ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes 'di ni mtshungs so //
translated: This is similar to saying ‚Äúit is not smoke.‚Äù

original: 'di ga las zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ga las zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang mtshungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere is this?‚Äù is also similar.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa ni rang gi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa ni rang gi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Blue and so on are the characteristics of their own nature.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid med par ni 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid med par ni 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Without their own characteristics, they do not arise.

original: bskyed par bya ba nyid ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba nyid ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Being that which is to be produced is not the characteristic of smoke and so on.

original: der yang rang gi rang bzhin nyid mtshan nyid yin pas 'di ni mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: der yang rang gi rang bzhin nyid mtshan nyid yin pas 'di ni mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And even there, since its own nature is the characteristic, this is not the same.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: rang bzhin tsam du snang bas ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin tsam du snang bas ni //
translated: Because it appears as mere nature,

original: dngos po dngos por gnas ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po dngos por gnas ma yin //
translated: the thing does not exist as a thing.

original: rang gi ngo bor snang ba ni //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor snang ba ni //
translated: The appearance as its own nature

original: 'khrul dang cig shos shes pa mtshungs//
analyzed: 'khrul dang cig shos shes pa mtshungs//
translated: is the same whether the cognition is mistaken or not.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam du snang ba ni 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dngos po mi 'grub po //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam du snang ba ni 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dngos po mi 'grub po //
translated: Since the appearance as mere nature, such as blue or yellow, is the same whether the cognition is mistaken or not, the thing is not established.

original: rnam par dbye ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bus byas pa yin pa'i phyir te spros pas chog go //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bus byas pa yin pa'i phyir te spros pas chog go //
translated: Since the distinction is made by cause and effect, enough of this elaboration!

original: rang bzhin ci ltar med na mi 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin ci ltar med na mi 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how a nature does not arise without something else,

original: 'di brjod pa /üîΩ@264a * // ci lta'i rang rgyu la ltos nas //
analyzed: 'di brjod pa / @264a * // ci lta'i rang rgyu la ltos nas //
translated: this is stated:üîΩHow is it that without a nature

original: rang bzhin med na mi 'byung bar //
analyzed: rang bzhin med na mi 'byung bar //
translated: that does not arise in dependence on its own cause?

original: shes bya 'jig dang byas pa nyid //
analyzed: shes bya 'jig dang byas pa nyid //
translated: The object of cognition is impermanent and produced,

original: gong du ji skad bshad pa bzhin //
analyzed: gong du ji skad bshad pa bzhin //
translated: as explained above.

original: 'jig pa ni dngos po tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no zhes don 'di sngar bstan zin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni dngos po tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no zhes don 'di sngar bstan zin te /
translated: Destruction is related to mere things. This point has already been taught.

original: des na yang skyug ldad mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na yang skyug ldad mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not vomit and chew over and over again.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rjes su 'gro ldog gi mtshan nyid kho na yin pas bdag dang srog la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rjes su 'gro ldog gi mtshan nyid kho na yin pas bdag dang srog la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since cause and effect are characterized by positive and negative concomitance, the self, life force, and so on are not the reason.

original: slob dpon gyi dgongs pa mtha' dag kyang 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dgongs pa mtha' dag kyang 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This is the entire intention of the master.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ldog can mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩmnyan bya nyid ni brjod mdzad las //
analyzed: ldog can mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir // mnyan bya nyid ni brjod mdzad las //
translated: Because he taught the concomitance of the reason.

original: gtan tshigs min nyid rtogs pa yi //
analyzed: gtan tshigs min nyid rtogs pa yi //
translated: He taught that the reason is not ascertained.

original: tshul 'dis thams cad dpag par bya //
analyzed: tshul 'dis thams cad dpag par bya //
translated: By this method, all should be inferred.

original: ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs thams cad dper brjod pa mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs thams cad dper brjod pa mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that all reasons with a negative concomitance have the same example,

original: slob dpon gyis ldog pa can mnyan par bya ba nyid ma nges par bstan par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ldog pa can mnyan par bya ba nyid ma nges par bstan par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: the master taught that the reason with a negative concomitance, being audible, is not ascertained.

original: des na tshul 'di thams cad ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa la gnas pa yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: des na tshul 'di thams cad ni slob dpon gyi dgongs pa la gnas pa yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that all of these methods are in accordance with the purport of the Acarya.

original: de ltar na re zhig ldog pa can gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig ldog pa can gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it has been shown that a reason which is a negative concomitance is not a valid reason.

original: ldog pa can thams cad mnyan bya nyid dang mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / de yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa can thams cad mnyan bya nyid dang mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / de yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all negative concomitances are similar to the object of hearing, and because that is not a specific property, it is not a valid reason.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / mthun phyogs mi mthun phyogs dag las //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mthun phyogs mi mthun phyogs dag las //
translated: In the similar and dissimilar instances,

original: ldog pa yang dag nyid du ni //üîΩsrid min ma mthong ba tsam gyis //
analyzed: ldog pa yang dag nyid du ni // srid min ma mthong ba tsam gyis //
translated: the negative concomitance is not real.üîΩBecause it is not seen,

original: ldog pa can zhes bshad pa yin //
analyzed: ldog pa can zhes bshad pa yin //
translated: the negative concomitance is said to be a mere absence.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i phung po gnyis las ma gtogs pa'i phung po gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i phung po gnyis las ma gtogs pa'i phung po gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Apart from the two kinds of aggregates, the permanent and impermanent, and those with a self and those without a self, there is no other kind of aggregate.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba ni dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba ni dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the contradiction of being mutually exclusive and exhaustive is itself an entity.

original: de ltar ma yin pas 'gro ba rtsol med du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin pas 'gro ba rtsol med du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then going would occur without effort.

original: phyogs gnyis las ma gtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis las ma gtogs pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: And there is nothing that is not included in these two alternatives.

original: gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa gnyi ga las ldog pa yin 'o na ni med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa gnyi ga las ldog pa yin 'o na ni med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If what is to be heard is the negation of both permanent and impermanent, then it would be nonexistent,

original: rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would have no basis.

original: sgra ni rten yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgra ni rten yin no zhe na /
translated: Sound is its basis.

original: ma yin te sgra la yang nyes pa mtshungs te /
analyzed: ma yin te sgra la yang nyes pa mtshungs te /
translated: No, because the same error applies to sound.

original: de yang thams cad las ldog pa'i phyir med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang thams cad las ldog pa'i phyir med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And that would be nonexistent, because it is the negation of everything.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / sgra rtags mi rtag the tshom ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sgra rtags mi rtag the tshom ni //
translated: If one doubts that sound is a reason and impermanent,

original: za na gtan tshigs @264b tshol ba yin //
analyzed: za na gtan tshigs @264b tshol ba yin //
translated: then one is seeking a reason.

original: de ni gnyi ga dang bral na //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga dang bral na //
translated: If one is free from both,

original: de dag la 'dir the tshom ci //
analyzed: de dag la 'dir the tshom ci //
translated: then one has doubt about them here.

original: de las ldog pa nyid du nges pa de nyid la the tshom za bar mi srid do //
analyzed: de las ldog pa nyid du nges pa de nyid la the tshom za bar mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible to doubt that very ascertainment of the negation of that.

original: 'o na ni mnyan bya nyid the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni mnyan bya nyid the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: But if it is not the object heard that is the cause of doubt,

original: sgra tsam nyid las the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgra tsam nyid las the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then doubt arises from mere sound.

original: ci sgra nyid las the tshom za bas gzhan dag kyang the tshom gyi rgyu la brten pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci sgra nyid las the tshom za bas gzhan dag kyang the tshom gyi rgyu la brten pa ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: But if doubt arises from mere sound, then other things are not the cause of doubt.

original: gal te gang zhig la lar mthong ba de dag gzhan mthong ba na der dogs pa bskyed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gang zhig la lar mthong ba de dag gzhan mthong ba na der dogs pa bskyed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But when one sees something in one place, doesn‚Äôt he generate doubt about whether it is seen elsewhere?

original: the tshom gyi rgyu ni de nyid yin par brjod do //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu ni de nyid yin par brjod do //
translated: We say that is the cause of doubt.

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid go ci ltar the tshom gyi rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid go ci ltar the tshom gyi rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: But how can the object heard be the cause of doubt?üîΩIt is not.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / mthong ba bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis ni //üîΩthe tshom bkag pas dngos med la //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / 'di ltar / mthong ba bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis ni // the tshom bkag pas dngos med la //
translated: For,üîΩThe object heard is not the cause of doubt,üîΩBecause doubt is eliminated by the method of establishing what is seen.

original: the tshom za 'gyur rang gi phyogs //
analyzed: the tshom za 'gyur rang gi phyogs //
translated: But if one doubts the nonexistence of something,

original: yongs su 'dzin pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the use of grasping one‚Äôs own position?

original: gang du gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa thun mongs gi ma nges pa la the tshom za ba de ni mthong ba'i sgo nas sgrub pa'i tshul gyis yin la yul la thun mongs ma yin pa la ni dgag pa'i sgo nas yin pa'i phyir 'di gnyis la khyad
analyzed: gang du gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa thun mongs gi ma nges pa la the tshom za ba de ni mthong ba'i sgo nas sgrub pa'i tshul gyis yin la yul la thun mongs ma yin pa la ni dgag pa'i sgo nas yin pa'i phyir 'di gnyis la khyad
translated: But when there is doubt about the common object of evaluation, then it is by the mode of affirmation through seeing. But when there is no common object of evaluation, then it is by the mode of negation.

original: par ci yod /
analyzed: par ci yod /
translated: So what is the difference between these two?

original: gal te mnyan bya nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir de dag mi rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid du 'thad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mnyan bya nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir de dag mi rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid du 'thad pa ma yin nam /
translated: If one does not see the object of hearing as permanent or impermanent, is it not tenable that it is the cause of noncomprehension?

original: ma mthong ba ni mi rtogs pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni mi rtogs pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because nonseeing is a factor of noncomprehension.

original: 'di ni bzang po ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / 'gal bas gang tshe gcig ldog par //
analyzed: 'di ni bzang po ma yin te / 'di ltar / 'gal bas gang tshe gcig ldog par //
translated: This is not good.üîΩBecause when one is stopped by contradiction,

original: des phyir bzlog pa'i zla bo ni //
analyzed: des phyir bzlog pa'i zla bo ni //
translated: the opposite of that which is stopped

original: 'jug 'gyur gnyi ga dag las kyang //
analyzed: 'jug 'gyur gnyi ga dag las kyang //
translated: does not occur from either of the two

original: ldog pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: and it is impossible to stop.

original: phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba gnyi ga las gcig tu nges par ldog pa ni mi srid pas 'dir btang snyoms par gnas pa ni mi 'thob pa kho na'o //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba gnyi ga las gcig tu nges par ldog pa ni mi srid pas 'dir btang snyoms par gnas pa ni mi 'thob pa kho na'o //
translated: Since they are mutually exclusive, it is impossible for one to be ascertained as both. Therefore, it is impossible to remain indifferent in this case.

original: gal te gnyis las gcig la gnas par tshad ma med pa gnyis kyis the tshom za ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te gnyis las gcig la gnas par tshad ma med pa gnyis kyis the tshom za ba yin gyi /
translated: If one remains in one of the two, it is because of a doubt caused by the absence of a valid cognition.

original: mnyan bya nyid kyis byas pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid kyis byas pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not that the doubt is caused by the fact that it is a sound?

original: de ni de ltar na mi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur bar zad do zhe na //
analyzed: de ni de ltar na mi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur bar zad do zhe na //
translated: If so, then it would be the cause of non-understanding.

original: 'o na ni thun mong gi ma nges pa la yang tshad ma med pa nyid las the tshom za ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni thun mong gi ma nges pa la yang tshad ma med pa nyid las the tshom za ba yin gyi /
translated: If it is a doubt caused by the absence of a valid cognition regarding a common non-ascertainment,

original: de gtan tshigs kyis byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de gtan tshigs kyis byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then it is not caused by the reason.

original: de yang mthong ba'i sgo nas the tshom gyi rgyu nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang mthong ba'i sgo nas the tshom gyi rgyu nyid do zhe na /
translated: And that is the cause of doubt by seeing.

original: mnyan bya nyid kyang ma mthong ba'i kho nas yin pas 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid kyang ma mthong ba'i kho nas yin pas 'di mtshungs so //
translated: Since it is only by not seeing that it is a sound, it is the same.

original: 'on te the tshom za bar gyur pa ni de las the tshom mi ldog pas de the tshom gyi rgyu brjod pa na mnyan bya nyid kyang de bzhin nyid pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: 'on te the tshom za bar gyur pa ni de las the tshom mi ldog pas de the tshom gyi rgyu brjod pa na mnyan bya nyid kyang de bzhin nyid pas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: But if one is doubtful, then since doubt is not eliminated by that, when the cause of doubt is stated, it is also to be listened to, so this is nonsense.

original: gzhan yang / @265a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang / @265a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: gnyi ga la mthong gzhal bya nyid //
analyzed: gnyi ga la mthong gzhal bya nyid //
translated: Both are to be seen and evaluated.

original: gnyis kyis ci ste nges mi byed //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ci ste nges mi byed //
translated: Why do the two not ascertain?

original: gnyi ga la ni mthong ldan pa //
analyzed: gnyi ga la ni mthong ldan pa //
translated: One who possesses seeing

original: gnyi ga la'ang sgrub byed yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyi ga la'ang sgrub byed yin par 'gyur //
translated: with regard to both would be a prover with regard to both.

original: gang zhig gang la mthong bas na //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la mthong bas na //
translated: With regard to whatever is seen by someone,

original: de sgrub pa nyid du 'gyur gyi med do zhes cha gnyis pa la brten pa ga las /
analyzed: de sgrub pa nyid du 'gyur gyi med do zhes cha gnyis pa la brten pa ga las /
translated: that is established, not non-existent. How could one rely on a second part?

original: 'on te phan tshun 'gal ba dang ldan pa gnyi ga la gcig la yod pa ni mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te phan tshun 'gal ba dang ldan pa gnyi ga la gcig la yod pa ni mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: But if one has mutually contradictory properties, it is not tenable that both exist in one.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: 'o na phyogs nyid la the tshom pa yin gyi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgo nas gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na phyogs nyid la the tshom pa yin gyi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgo nas gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then one would doubt the position itself, but it would not be due to the concordant side.

original: mthong ba la yang phyogs la the tshom pa'i sgo kho nas the tshom ni 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba la yang phyogs la the tshom pa'i sgo kho nas the tshom ni 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Doubt is also doubt about the object seen, but only through the door of the sides.

original: de ni gnyi ga la ma mthong ba la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga la ma mthong ba la yang mtshungs so //
translated: And that is the same for both the seen and the unseen.

original: gcig tu nges par ldog par bya ste the tshom za ba ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: gcig tu nges par ldog par bya ste the tshom za ba ni ma yin nam /
translated: One should definitely turn away from doubt, but not from the seen.

original: gcig tu nges par gnyis las ldog par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par gnyis las ldog par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not definite that one should turn away from both, since one is definite about one.

original: gal te phung po gsum pa mi srid pa gnyi ga las ldog pa de ni rang bzhin nyid kyis mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gal te phung po gsum pa mi srid pa gnyi ga las ldog pa de ni rang bzhin nyid kyis mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: If the third possibility is impossible, then turning away from both is not understood by nature,

original: ldog pa can 'di ni slob dpon gyis kyang de ltar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa can 'di ni slob dpon gyis kyang de ltar bshad pa yin no //
translated: because the master has explained it that way.

original: de skad du yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos thun mongs ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni khyad par ci snyed kyis mtha' dag bsdus pa de la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de skad du yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos thun mongs ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni khyad par ci snyed kyis mtha' dag bsdus pa de la the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: And it is said: ‚ÄúThat which is the uncommon property of the probandum is the cause of doubt about that which is included by all the particulars,

original: de'i rten ni des bsdus pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu ngas par ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i rten ni des bsdus pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu ngas par ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: because its basis is included by that, and because one turns away from the definite.‚Äù

original: de ci ltar 'di ldog pa nyid la the tshom za bas dogs pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar 'di ldog pa nyid la the tshom za bas dogs pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: But why is it that one doubts just the reversal of that, and thus it is a cause of doubt?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang phyir gang zhig gnyi ga las //üîΩldog par nges te gzhan la ni //
analyzed: gang phyir gang zhig gnyi ga las // ldog par nges te gzhan la ni //
translated: Because that which is ascertained toüîΩrevolve from both

original: yod pas gnyi ga dag la yang //
analyzed: yod pas gnyi ga dag la yang //
translated: Is not present in the other,

original: med 'gyur 'di ni bshad zin to //üîΩlog par slar yang de nyid la //
analyzed: med 'gyur 'di ni bshad zin to // log par slar yang de nyid la //
translated: It is explained that it is absent from both.üîΩHow could one doubt that very thing

original: the tshom byed par ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: the tshom byed par ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: Again, in the opposite way?

original: gnyi ga rnam gcod bsgrub pa ni //
analyzed: gnyi ga rnam gcod bsgrub pa ni //
translated: The exclusion of both

original: de las ldog pa las gzhan min //
analyzed: de las ldog pa las gzhan min //
translated: Is not other than the reversal of that.

original: gang zhig gang las ldog pa de ci ltar de ltar de rnam par gcod pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las ldog pa de ci ltar de ltar de rnam par gcod pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin /
translated: How could that which is reversed from something not be a proof of the exclusion of that?

original: 'on te gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the proof of the exclusion of both is itself the cause of non-understanding?

original: 'di ni med de /üîΩ'di ltar / gtan tshigs thams cad rnam gcod ni //
analyzed: 'di ni med de / 'di ltar / gtan tshigs thams cad rnam gcod ni //
translated: That is not so.üîΩBecause:üîΩAll reasons are reasons

original: sgrub par byad pas gtan tshigs nyid //
analyzed: sgrub par byad pas gtan tshigs nyid //
translated: Because they prove the exclusion.

original: sgra dang rtags kyi ldog pa ni //
analyzed: sgra dang rtags kyi ldog pa ni //
translated: The reversal of words and signs

original: rab sgrub byed ces rnam par gnas //üîΩgtan tshigs gzhan las gzhan ldog pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: rab sgrub byed ces rnam par gnas // gtan tshigs gzhan las gzhan ldog pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bden mod kyi /
translated: The other is the proof.üîΩIt is true that the reason is the proof of the exclusion of other.

original: 'on kyang de ni gzhan bsgrub 'phen pa nyid @265b kyis yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni gzhan bsgrub 'phen pa nyid @265b kyis yin no //
translated: But it is the exclusion of other that is implied.

original: 'dir ni gzhan 'phangs pa ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhan 'phangs pa ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here there is no implication of anything else,

original: gnyi ga las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the exclusion of both.

original: byas pa nyid las ni rtag pa las ldog pas mi rtag pa 'phen pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byas pa nyid las ni rtag pa las ldog pas mi rtag pa 'phen pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But impermanence is implied by the exclusion of permanence from the produced.

original: de bden te /üîΩrtag pa log las mi rtag pas //
analyzed: de bden te / rtag pa log las mi rtag pas //
translated: That is true.

original: nyid ni gzhan du grub pa med //
analyzed: nyid ni gzhan du grub pa med //
translated: But impermanence is not established as anything other than the exclusion of permanence.

original: gang phyir rjes su dpag pa ni //üîΩgzhan ldog nyid kyis don byas 'gyur //üîΩrjes su dpag pa ni gzhan rtag pa'i sgro 'dogs pa bcad pa tsam gyis don byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang phyir rjes su dpag pa ni // gzhan ldog nyid kyis don byas 'gyur // rjes su dpag pa ni gzhan rtag pa'i sgro 'dogs pa bcad pa tsam gyis don byas pa yin te /
translated: Because the implication of the reasonüîΩis the exclusion of other.üîΩThe implication of the reason is the exclusion of other, because the implication of the reason is the exclusion of the superimposition of permanence.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa dag ni gcig bzlog pas gzhan rang nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa dag ni gcig bzlog pas gzhan rang nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-conceptualization of permanence and impermanence is the establishment of the other by the exclusion of one.

original: der yang res 'ga' med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: der yang res 'ga' med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And even there, it would sometimes not exist.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: de mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is established by direct perception.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la ci ltar zhe na /
translated: What about the reason based on effect?

original: 'di ni re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig gzhag go //
translated: That is set aside for the moment.

original: gal te mnyan bya nyid kyis gnyi ga yang rnam par bcad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mnyan bya nyid kyis gnyi ga yang rnam par bcad pa yin na /
translated: If both are excluded by being an object of hearing,

original: de las 'grub pa mngon sum gyis grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las 'grub pa mngon sum gyis grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the establishment of that would be established by direct perception, so it would be a reason.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan de gcig bsgrubs pas gtan tshigs ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan de gcig bsgrubs pas gtan tshigs ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that a reason is not a reason because it establishes one thing,

original: ma yin te /üîΩmngon sum gyis grub pa gtan tshigs gzhan gyis 'gog par byed pa'am /
analyzed: ma yin te / mngon sum gyis grub pa gtan tshigs gzhan gyis 'gog par byed pa'am /
translated: That is not so.üîΩFor, it is not that a reason refutes what is established by direct perception.

original: sgrub par byed pa ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: because how could a reason that is established by direct perception be refuted or established by another reason?

original: 'on te mngon sum ni 'gog par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum ni 'gog par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, if direct perception does not refute,

original: des ni gzhan gyis bsgrub pa'am 'gog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des ni gzhan gyis bsgrub pa'am 'gog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then it would establish or refute by another.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: mnyan bya nyid kyis gnyi ga rnam par bcad pas /
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid kyis gnyi ga rnam par bcad pas /
translated: because both are excluded by being an object of hearing.

original: ci ltar gzhan gyis grub /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan gyis grub /
translated: How could it be established by another?

original: de ltar ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,üîΩthen

original: dor ba yang gzhan gyis sgrub pa'i phyir ji ltar na gzhan yang tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dor ba yang gzhan gyis sgrub pa'i phyir ji ltar na gzhan yang tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: And since it is established by another, how could it be a valid cognition?

original: des na thams cad yid brtan du med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thams cad yid brtan du med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, everything would be unreliable.

original: mngon sum 'gog par byed pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum 'gog par byed pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that it does not refute direct perception,

original: de ltar yin na ni sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: for if it were, it would not be a proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni dngos po rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni dngos po rtogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: A proof is that which causes one to understand an object,

original: dngos po yang de las gzhan dang tha dad pa med par rnam par bcad pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po yang de las gzhan dang tha dad pa med par rnam par bcad pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and one does not understand an object that is not distinguished from something else.

original: 'di ltar dngos po de gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po de gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'am /
translated: In this way, is that object unmixed with something else,

original: 'on te gzhan dang 'dres par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dang 'dres par 'gyur //
translated: or is it mixed with something else?

original: gzhan dang 'dres na tha snyad ni //
analyzed: gzhan dang 'dres na tha snyad ni //
translated: If it is mixed with something else,

original: med phyir dngos po nyid min 'gyur //üîΩde bzhin du ni gzhan dag las //
analyzed: med phyir dngos po nyid min 'gyur // de bzhin du ni gzhan dag las //
translated: then it is not an object because it is not a convention.üîΩIn the same way,

original: 'gog pa yang ni med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gog pa yang ni med par 'gyur //
translated: there would be no refutation of other things.

original: 'di rnam par dpyad par bya ste //
analyzed: 'di rnam par dpyad par bya ste //
translated: This should be analyzed:

original: dngos po rang nyid kyi ngo bo //
analyzed: dngos po rang nyid kyi ngo bo //
translated: The nature of an object

original: gzhan las ldog pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa'am /
translated: Or is it the opposite?

original: 'on te de lta ma yin /üîΩgal te log @266a * //
analyzed: 'on te de lta ma yin / gal te log @266a * //
translated: Or is it not like that?

original: na mngon sum gyis bzung ba 'am 'on te ma bzung /
analyzed: na mngon sum gyis bzung ba 'am 'on te ma bzung /
translated: If it is the opposite, is it apprehended by direct perception or not?

original: gal te bzung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bzung ngo zhe na /
translated: If it is apprehended,

original: ci ltar gzhan mi 'gog /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan mi 'gog /
translated: how is it that the other is not refuted?

original: de la gzhan bkag pa ni kho na ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan bkag pa ni kho na ste /
translated: In that case, the other is refuted, but only that.

original: de yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: de yongs su spangs te /
translated: That being completely abandoned,

original: de rang bzhin gzhan du snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de rang bzhin gzhan du snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is that which appears as a different nature.

original: de lta ma yin na 'dzings par rtogs pa'i phyir tha snyad med pas na tshad ma don med do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dzings par rtogs pa'i phyir tha snyad med pas na tshad ma don med do //
translated: If it were not so, then because of the understanding of entanglement, there would be no convention. Therefore, valid cognition would be pointless.

original: 'on te tshad ma gzhan gyis gzhan bkag pa las tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na //
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma gzhan gyis gzhan bkag pa las tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na //
translated: But if one makes a convention from the refutation of one thing by another valid cognition,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that also is not correct.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / mngon sum gyis ni rtogs pa la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mngon sum gyis ni rtogs pa la //
translated: If what is understood by direct perception

original: gal te gzhan gyis gnod na ni //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyis gnod na ni //
translated: is harmed by another,

original: mngon sum tshad ma min nyid pas //
analyzed: mngon sum tshad ma min nyid pas //
translated: then direct perception is not valid cognition,

original: gzhan yang tshad ma nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshad ma nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: and moreover, it would not be valid cognition.

original: mngon sum tshad ma ma yin pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: mngon sum tshad ma ma yin pa nyid yin na /
translated: If direct perception is not valid cognition,

original: gzhan la yid brtan du ci yod //
analyzed: gzhan la yid brtan du ci yod //
translated: what confidence can one have in another?

original: 'on te dngos po gzhan dang 'dres pa nyid yin na de las gzhan tshad ma brgyas kyang dgag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po gzhan dang 'dres pa nyid yin na de las gzhan tshad ma brgyas kyang dgag pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is mixed with other things, it is not refuted by a hundred valid knowledges other than that.

original: rang gi rang bzhin ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus so //
translated: But if it is mixed with other entities, it is not refuted by a hundred valid cognitions, because its own nature cannot be made otherwise.

original: 'on te rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gis ma 'dres so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gis ma 'dres so zhe na /
translated: If it is not mixed with any nature,

original: rang bzhin gang gis ma 'dres pa'i tshul des kyang mngon sum gyis bzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis ma 'dres pa'i tshul des kyang mngon sum gyis bzung ba nyid do //
