translated: then it is apprehended by direct perception in the manner in which it is not mixed with any nature.

original: de lta ma yin te ma bzung na ni don ldog par ci ltar yin /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te ma bzung na ni don ldog par ci ltar yin /
translated: If it is not so apprehended, how can it be the referent of a negation?

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa na ldog pa go ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa na ldog pa go ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is understood through the understanding of something else,

original: gzhan gyis de lta ma yin par rtogs na thams cad la yid brtan du med do zhes bstan zin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de lta ma yin par rtogs na thams cad la yid brtan du med do zhes bstan zin te /
translated: then it has been shown that if something else is understood in a way that is not so, then nothing can be relied upon.üîΩAs soon as one enters the house

original: nyin mtshan las ni khyim phugs su //üîΩzhugs ma thag tu gzhan du ni //üîΩsnang yang yin pa phyi ma yi //
analyzed: nyin mtshan las ni khyim phugs su // zhugs ma thag tu gzhan du ni // snang yang yin pa phyi ma yi //
translated: at night,üîΩthe appearance of something else

original: mngon sum des ni snga ma gnod //
analyzed: mngon sum des ni snga ma gnod //
translated: is contradicted by the later direct perception.

original: khang pa'i phugs su dngos po skyes pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: khang pa'i phugs su dngos po skyes pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The appearance of an entity in the house is not a valid cognition.

original: des na dang po'i mthong ba de gnod par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na dang po'i mthong ba de gnod par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the first perception is invalidated,

original: tshad ma nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not invalidated as a valid cognition.

original: des na gal te mngon gyis sgra gnyi ga las log par bzung na de'i tshe gzhan las the tshom za ba'am de lta ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te mngon gyis sgra gnyi ga las log par bzung na de'i tshe gzhan las the tshom za ba'am de lta ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if sound is grasped as absent from both, then at that time there would be doubt about the other, or it would not be so.

original: mnyan bya nyid kyi grub pa las yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid kyi grub pa las yang de bzhin no //
translated: It is the same from the establishment of audibility.

original: des na ldog pa med pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: des na ldog pa med pa nyid kyis na /
translated: Therefore, by the absence of reversal,

original: mnyan bya nyid las the tshom du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid las the tshom du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: there would be doubt from audibility.

original: de bzhin du ldog pa can mtha' dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ldog pa can mtha' dag pa'o //
translated: Similarly, it is for all with reversal.

original: slob dpon gyis ni ma mthong ba tsam la brten nas ldog pa can du bstan to //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni ma mthong ba tsam la brten nas ldog pa can du bstan to //
translated: The master taught reversal based on mere non-perception.

original: 'o na ci ltar gcig tu nges pa ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar gcig tu nges pa ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs she na /
translated: Then how is it said, for the sake of reversal for the sake of ascertainment?

original: gcig tu nges par gdon mi za ba nyid ldog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang gcig tu nges pa'i gdon mi za ba nyid ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par gdon mi za ba nyid ldog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang gcig tu nges pa'i gdon mi za ba nyid ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is not because of the reversal of certainty and undoubtedly that the reason is inconclusive, but rather because of the reversal of certainty and undoubtedly.

original: de ni rtag pa dang mi @266b rtag pa la yod pa dang med pa nyid du nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rtag pa dang mi @266b rtag pa la yod pa dang med pa nyid du nges pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not certain that existence and non-existence belong to the permanent and the impermanent, respectively.

original: des na don dam par na log pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na don dam par na log pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, there is no non-existence of the reversed.

original: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is inconclusive.

original: de ltar na re zhig rtsod phyir khyad par zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rtsod phyir khyad par zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the explanation of the reason called reversal is finished.

original: da ni spyi bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni spyi bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the general explanation will be given.

original: ci ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa'i ldog pa can go bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gcig tu nges pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can yang yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa'i ldog pa can go bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gcig tu nges pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can yang yin no //
translated: Just as a reversal that is not certain to be one is not understood to have a reversal, likewise, certainty of concomitance is not understood to have concomitance.

original: 'di ltar / gzhal bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzhal bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Thus,

original: bum bzhin sgra yang mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: bum bzhin sgra yang mi rtag nyid //
translated: Sound is impermanent, like a pot,üîΩbecause it is audible.

original: nam mkha' med la gtan tshigs 'di //
analyzed: nam mkha' med la gtan tshigs 'di //
translated: This reason is inconclusiveüîΩwith respect to space, which is not an object of perception.

original: ldog med phyir na rjes 'gro can //
analyzed: ldog med phyir na rjes 'gro can //
translated: because it is not otherwise.

original: nam mkha' la ni yod pa 'am med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni yod pa 'am med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that space is existent or nonexistent,

original: de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: de rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa med pa can gtan tshigs ni go bar byed pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa med pa can gtan tshigs ni go bar byed pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the reason, which is the invariable concomitance of that, is the means of knowing,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: nam mkha' med pa'i phyogs la ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' med pa'i phyogs la ni //
translated: In the case of the nonexistence of space,

original: gal te de ni srid min yang //
analyzed: gal te de ni srid min yang //
translated: even if it is not possible,

original: de lta na yang gzhal bya nyid //
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhal bya nyid //
translated: it is still an object of knowledge.üîΩHow could it be otherwise?

original: 'di la ci ltar yang mi ldog / med pa la yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar gzhal bya nyid yod pa kho na ste ;
analyzed: 'di la ci ltar yang mi ldog / med pa la yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar gzhal bya nyid yod pa kho na ste ;
translated: Even in the case of nonexistence, it is only an object of knowledge in some way.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag tu tha snyad byed pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag tu tha snyad byed pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the conventions of affirmation and negation would not exist.

original: yod pa 'ba' zhig ni tha snyad du nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa 'ba' zhig ni tha snyad du nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Only existence is not capable of being a convention.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i bdag nyid kyang dngos po tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i bdag nyid kyang dngos po tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
translated: Even mutually exclusive identities are objects of conventional entities.

original: de lta ma yin na ni don bya bas stong pa'i phyir don bya ba'i don du gnyer ba rnams kyi don du gnyer bar bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni don bya bas stong pa'i phyir don bya ba'i don du gnyer ba rnams kyi don du gnyer bar bya ba nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because it would be empty of function, it would not be something to be sought by those who seek a function.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rnam par 'byed pa med pa ni su zhig gang la'am ci'i don du tha snyad byed de /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rnam par 'byed pa med pa ni su zhig gang la'am ci'i don du tha snyad byed de /
translated: Without the distinction of self and other, who would designate what for the sake of what?

original: des na thams cad med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thams cad med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, everything would be absolutely nonexistent.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs med par ma rtogs par ni rang gi phyogs gzhung gzugs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs med par ma rtogs par ni rang gi phyogs gzhung gzugs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Without understanding the nonexistence of the opponent‚Äôs position, one cannot establish one‚Äôs own position.

original: nam mkha' yang gdon mi za bar thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po med pa tsam du gzhal bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang gdon mi za bar thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po med pa tsam du gzhal bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Undoubtedly, space is to be understood as the mere absence of an obstructive, tangible object.

original: de ltar ma yin na gom gang yang ni 'gror med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na gom gang yang ni 'gror med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no going anywhere at all.

original: des na yod pa'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po so sor nges par rnam par 'jog pas dngos po med pa gzhal bar bya ba yin te de de ltar rnam par gzhag pa tshad mas rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya nyid do //
analyzed: des na yod pa'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po so sor nges par rnam par 'jog pas dngos po med pa gzhal bar bya ba yin te de de ltar rnam par gzhag pa tshad mas rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since things are posited as individually distinct by virtue of their existence, non-things are objects of comprehension, because they are posited by valid cognition in that way.

original: dngos po'i yul can 'ba' zhig ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can 'ba' zhig ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Valid cognition is not only that which has a thing as its object.

original: tshad ma ni rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma ni rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid tshad ma yin te /
translated: Since valid cognition is characterized by exclusion, it is valid cognition that excludes.

original: gal te rang gi yul la gzhan gyis gnod pa ma byas na'o //
analyzed: gal te rang gi yul la gzhan gyis gnod pa ma byas na'o //
translated: If it is not harmed by another with regard to its object.

original: de'i phyir tha @267a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha @267a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: snyad mi slu ba nyid sgrub par byed pa'i shes pas gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa gzhal bya kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snyad mi slu ba nyid sgrub par byed pa'i shes pas gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa gzhal bya kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: since non-things are objects of comprehension because they are to be excluded by a cognition that establishes the non-deceptiveness of conventional usage,

original: gzhal bya kho na yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa med pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya kho na yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul pa med pa can ma yin no //
translated: the statement ‚Äúbecause they are objects of comprehension‚Äù does not have the fault of being inconclusive.

original: de bas na thun mong pa nyid kyis ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na thun mong pa nyid kyis ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not ascertained by the commonality.

original: 'on te gzhal bya nyid mngon sum gyis yongs su gcad par bya ba la brjod na de lta yin na mngon sum ni dngos po las skye ba yin pa'i phyir don byed par nus pa nyid gzhal bya yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gzhal bya nyid mngon sum gyis yongs su gcad par bya ba la brjod na de lta yin na mngon sum ni dngos po las skye ba yin pa'i phyir don byed par nus pa nyid gzhal bya yin no //
translated: But if you say that the object of comprehension is to be discerned by direct perception, then, if that is so, since direct perception arises from a real thing, the object of comprehension is only that which is able to perform a function.

original: des na don bya ba byed pa nyid go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na don bya ba byed pa nyid go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be said that the performance of a function is the proof.

original: de yang dngos po med pa las ldog pa'i phyir ro ldog pa dang ldan pas na ci ltar rjes su 'gro ba can gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de yang dngos po med pa las ldog pa'i phyir ro ldog pa dang ldan pas na ci ltar rjes su 'gro ba can gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: And that is because it is the opposite of non-existence. Since it possesses the opposite, how can it be a reason that is concomitant?

original: med pa dang ldog pa can 'gyur pa yang yin zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: med pa dang ldog pa can 'gyur pa yang yin zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained that it is also the opposite of non-existence.

original: des na dngos po nyid la sogs pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po nyid la sogs pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, existence and so on have also been explained.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid na /
translated: Therefore, when there is only concomitance and the absence of,

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: there are the reasons of effect and nature.

original: gal te dgag pa nyid ni thams cad du mi dmigs pa yis thams cad sgrub par byed ces bya ba la sogs pas mi dmigs pa yang gtan tshigs gsum pa yin par bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dgag pa nyid ni thams cad du mi dmigs pa yis thams cad sgrub par byed ces bya ba la sogs pas mi dmigs pa yang gtan tshigs gsum pa yin par bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: But didn‚Äôt you teach that non-apprehension is a third kind of logical argument, as in the statement, ‚ÄúNegation itself is established in all cases by non-apprehension‚Äù?

original: 'on te dngos po'i yul gyi gtan tshigs kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po'i yul gyi gtan tshigs kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan pa yin /
translated: Or did you teach that it is a division of the logical argument of a real object?

original: de lta yin na mi dmigs ba'i 'brel pa bstan par bya dgos pa yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin na mi dmigs ba'i 'brel pa bstan par bya dgos pa yin na /
translated: If that is so, then you must teach the relation of non-apprehension,

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa ni med do zhes bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa ni med do zhes bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: but you taught that there is no relation other than identity and causality.

original: 'dir brjod pa /üîΩrgyu dang khyab byed med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa / rgyu dang khyab byed med pa'i phyir //
translated: Here we reply:üîΩBecause there is no effect or pervader,

original: 'bras dang khyab bya med na ni //
analyzed: 'bras dang khyab bya med na ni //
translated: if there is no cause or pervader,üîΩthere is no other proof

original: go 'gyur dngos po med pa yi //üîΩsgrub byed gzhan ni 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: go 'gyur dngos po med pa yi // sgrub byed gzhan ni 'ga' yang med //
translated: of a non-existent thing.

original: dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba rang rgyud du tha snyad kyi yul du gyur pa ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba rang rgyud du tha snyad kyi yul du gyur pa ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
translated: There is no existent thing that is a non-existent thing, that is, a thing that is the object of expression, that is, a thing that is the object of expression.

original: 'on kyang brjod par 'dod pa'i dngos po nyid kyi dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang brjod par 'dod pa'i dngos po nyid kyi dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: But the non-existence of the thing itself is what is to be affirmed.

original: dngos po de yang lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis the tshom za ba na ci ltar med ces bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po de yang lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis the tshom za ba na ci ltar med ces bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: And since that thing is hidden, there is doubt about it, so how can it be said that it does not exist?

original: de mi dmigs pa tsam zhig go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa tsam zhig go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere non-apprehension of it does not prove its non-existence,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in a form that is not the object of apprehension.

original: gal te de'i rgyu 'am khyab par byed pa med do zhes bya bar gyur pa de ltan ni de med par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de'i rgyu 'am khyab par byed pa med do zhes bya bar gyur pa de ltan ni de med par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the cause of it or its pervader is absent, then its absence is established.

original: de la yang 'brel pa'i rnam pa gnyis po de nyid yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang ldog pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de la yang 'brel pa'i rnam pa gnyis po de nyid yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang ldog pa nyid du grub po //
translated: And in that case, the non-apprehension and the preclusion are established as the two forms of the relation, because they are just that.

original: dper brjod pa ci ste ma sbyar zhe na /
analyzed: dper brjod pa ci ste ma sbyar zhe na /
translated: Why is no example given?

original: sbyar ba kho na'o //
analyzed: sbyar ba kho na'o //
translated: It is given,üîΩbecause the object is excluded

original: 'di ltar / rgyu dang ngo bo ldog nyid kyis //üîΩdon @267b ldog pa ni brjod pa las //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu dang ngo bo ldog nyid kyis // don @267b ldog pa ni brjod pa las //
translated: by the cause and the nature.

original: mi dmigs dpe ni grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mi dmigs dpe ni grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Since the example of non-apprehension is established,

original: tha dad par ni ma bshad do //
analyzed: tha dad par ni ma bshad do //
translated: it is not stated separately.

original: mi dmigs pa'i dpe ni smos pa nyid de logs shig tu ma yin ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i dpe ni smos pa nyid de logs shig tu ma yin ci ste zhe na /
translated: The example of non-apprehension has already been mentioned, not separately.

original: rgyu dang ngo bo ldog pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi don ldog par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang ngo bo ldog pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi don ldog par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because the meaning of the negation of the effect and the negation of the nature of the cause have already been explained.

original: rang bzhin nyid dam rgyu dngos ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid dam rgyu dngos ni //
translated: The nature itself or the actual cause

original: grub na ldog par 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: grub na ldog par 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: is established when the negation is established.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: This has already been explained by such passages as that.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The non-apprehension of nature has also been explained.

original: rgyu dang ngo bo ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyis dngos po ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang ngo bo ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyis dngos po ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation of the cause and the negation of the nature are the negation of the thing itself.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus,

original: tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyis //
analyzed: tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyis //
translated: those who speak of establishment by valid cognition

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin te //
translated: have already explained this by such passages as that.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nyid kyi khyad par ci ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nyid kyi khyad par ci ltar grub ce na /
translated: How is the distinction of the characteristic of the object of apprehension established?

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩde la'ang skyes bu ma mthong las //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / de la'ang skyes bu ma mthong las //
translated: Here it is explained:üîΩEven in that case, because the negation of life, etc.

original: srog sogs ldog pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: srog sogs ldog pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: is not established from the non-apprehension of the person,

original: gtan tshigs the tshom za bshad pas //
analyzed: gtan tshigs the tshom za bshad pas //
translated: the reason is explained to be doubtful.

original: bltar rung don la de zhes bstan //
analyzed: bltar rung don la de zhes bstan //
translated: But the object that can be seen is taught to be different from that.

original: pha rol po dag gis smras pa //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis smras pa //
translated: The opponent says:

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag la ni bdag ldog pas yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag la ni bdag ldog pas yin te /
translated: In the case of a pot, etc., the self is excluded.

original: des na gal te gson po'i lus la yang bdag ldog na srog la sogs pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na gal te gson po'i lus la yang bdag ldog na srog la sogs pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if the self is excluded in the case of a living body, then life, etc., would also be excluded.

original: 'di la slob dpon gyis bdag bltar mi rung ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med pa nyid ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon gyis bdag bltar mi rung ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa la bdag med pa nyid ma grub ste /
translated: In response to this, the master [NƒÅgƒÅrjuna] teaches that because the self cannot be seen, the non-existence of the self in a pot, etc., is not established.

original: mi dmigs pa tsam ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: This is because mere non-apprehension is a cause of doubt.

original: des na bltar rung ba'i don la mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bltar rung ba'i don la mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he teaches that non-apprehension of an object that can be seen is what brings understanding.

original: gal te rnam par gcod pa bsgrub pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs thams cad mi dmigs pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam par gcod pa bsgrub pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs thams cad mi dmigs pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If exclusion is established by non-apprehension itself, then is not all reasoning non-apprehension?

original: des na gtan tshigs gsum du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs gsum du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In that case, how can there be three types of reasoning?

original: nyes pa 'di med de 'di ltar /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di med de 'di ltar /
translated: This fault does not exist, because it is like this:

original: 'dis ni dngos las dngos po'i chos //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos las dngos po'i chos //
translated: This is the property of an entity from an entity.

original: khas blangs med par dgag pa nyid //üîΩsgrub byed snga ma dag gis ni //
analyzed: khas blangs med par dgag pa nyid // sgrub byed snga ma dag gis ni //
translated: The non-establishment of the non-object is established by the non-apprehension of the object.üîΩThe non-establishment of the object is established by the non-apprehension of the object.

original: ma yin sgrub par byed phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin sgrub par byed phyir ro //
translated: The non-establishment of the non-object is established by the non-apprehension of the object.

original: 'dis ni sa phyogs la sogs pa'i dngos po la yang ma yin bsgrub pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang dngos po'i ngo bo khas blangs pa ma byas par dgag pa bsgrubs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni sa phyogs la sogs pa'i dngos po la yang ma yin bsgrub pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang dngos po'i ngo bo khas blangs pa ma byas par dgag pa bsgrubs pa yin la /
translated: This shows that the non-establishment of the object is not established in regard to such things as the place, but rather the negation is established without the acceptance of the nature of the thing.

original: snga ma rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dag gis ni ma yin pa'i sgo nas dgag pa sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dag gis ni ma yin pa'i sgo nas dgag pa sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The non-establishment of the non-object is established by the non-apprehension of the object.

original: des na 'brel par mtshungs kyang yul tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na 'brel par mtshungs kyang yul tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, although they are similar in being related, they are different because their objects are different.

original: 'o na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa la 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the relation in the non-apprehension of the nature?

original: de'i bdag nyid do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: It is said to be identity.

original: de la dmigs rung rnams kyi ni //üîΩyod pa dmigs pa las gzhan @268a * //
analyzed: de la dmigs rung rnams kyi ni // yod pa dmigs pa las gzhan @268a * //
translated: The existence of those that are suitable to be apprehendedüîΩis nothing other than the apprehension of the object.

original: min ; / med pa ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: min ; / med pa ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Non-existence is nothing other than the non-apprehension of the object.

original: 'on kyang mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: However, it is just the non-apprehension.

original: gal te shes pa ldog pa ni mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te shes pa ldog pa ni mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: If the cessation of consciousness is non-apprehension,

original: yod pa ldog pa ni dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yod pa ldog pa ni dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt the cessation of existence non-existence?

original: da ci ltar 'di gnyis de'i bdag nyid yin /
analyzed: da ci ltar 'di gnyis de'i bdag nyid yin /
translated: How can these two be of the same nature?

original: shes pa shes bya dag tha dad pa de bzhin du de med pa dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: shes pa shes bya dag tha dad pa de bzhin du de med pa dag kyang yin no //
translated: Just as consciousness and the object are different, so too their non-existence is different.

original: shes pa nyid don gyi yod pa ni yin te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid don gyi yod pa ni yin te /
translated: Consciousness itself is the existence of the object,

original: shes pa med kyang de yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar / lkog tu gyur pa'i don rnams kyang //
analyzed: shes pa med kyang de yod pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar / lkog tu gyur pa'i don rnams kyang //
translated: because it exists even when consciousness does not exist.üîΩThus,

original: rjes su dpag pas yod par 'dzin //üîΩdu ba mthong ba me yod par //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas yod par 'dzin // du ba mthong ba me yod par //
translated: even hidden objects are apprehended through inference.

original: rjes su dpag ma min nam ci //
analyzed: rjes su dpag ma min nam ci //
translated: Isn‚Äôt the existence of fire inferred from the perception of smoke?

original: der yang rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: der yang rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even there, the object of inference does not exist,

original: rjes su dpag pa med par yang yod pas na 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med par yang yod pas na 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists even without inference, and because it is mistaken.

original: rjes su dpag pa ldog pas ni de med pa go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ldog pas ni de med pa go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The cessation of inference does not make known its non-existence,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because inference also occurs regarding the past and future.

original: 'di ni legs pa ma yin te //üîΩdmigs par bya ba med par ni //
analyzed: 'di ni legs pa ma yin te // dmigs par bya ba med par ni //
translated: This is not good.

original: dmigs pa med las gzhan ma yin //üîΩdmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa med las gzhan ma yin // dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of an object is not different from the non-apprehension of a non-object.üîΩThe non-apprehension of an object is the characteristic of the non-apprehension of a non-object.

original: de ma dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad du bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ma dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad du bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: The non-apprehension of an object is established as the convention of non-existence.

original: de dag gi yod pa ni dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi yod pa ni dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The existence of those is not different from the apprehension of an object.

original: 'di ltar dmigs par rung ba yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs par rung ba yang yin la /
translated: Thus, it is suitable to apprehend an object,

original: ma dmigs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: and it is also suitable to not apprehend an object. This is contradictory.

original: des na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i don gyi yod pa ni dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i don gyi yod pa ni dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the existence of an object that is the characteristic of an object is the apprehension of an object.

original: 'di ltar gal te dmigs par bya ba nyid ni de don gyi ngo bo kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dmigs par bya ba nyid ni de don gyi ngo bo kho na'o //
translated: Thus, if the object of apprehension is the nature of that object,

original: de ste dmigs par byed pa'i dmigs par byed pa po la gnas par brjod na /
analyzed: de ste dmigs par byed pa'i dmigs par byed pa po la gnas par brjod na /
translated: or if it is said to exist in the apprehender of the object of apprehension,

original: de'i tshe yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa khyab pa nyid do //
translated: then at that time, the characteristic of the object of apprehension is pervasion itself.

original: de las ldog pa med na yang tha dad par ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las ldog pa med na yang tha dad par ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: If it does not turn away from that, it does not turn away from difference.

original: tha dad pa ni ldog pas go bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni ldog pas go bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because difference is understood by exclusion.

original: des na mi 'khrul pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na mi 'khrul pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of non-delusion,

original: dmigs pa nyid yod par brjod do //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid yod par brjod do //
translated: the existence of the object is stated.

original: tha dad pa dus mtshungs par dmigs pas don rnams dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tha dad pa dus mtshungs par dmigs pas don rnams dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The objects are not perceived by the simultaneous perception of difference;

original: 'on kyang der rjes su chud par dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa nyid las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang der rjes su chud par dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa nyid las yin no //
translated: but rather, the existence of the object is from the characteristic of the object of perception, which is the penetration of that.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin la de las ni mi dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩdngos po med pa rnams ni don dam par phan tshun tha dad par 'ga' yang med kyi 'on @268b kyang bum pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin la de las ni mi dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro // dngos po med pa rnams ni don dam par phan tshun tha dad par 'ga' yang med kyi 'on @268b kyang bum pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the object is from the existence of the object of perception, and non-perception is from the non-existence of that.

original: shing rta med do zhes khyad par dngos po tha dad pas tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: shing rta med do zhes khyad par dngos po tha dad pas tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Non-entities do not have any mutual difference ultimately, but rather, by the difference of the entity, there is the difference of the non-entity, as in ‚Äúthe pot does not exist,‚Äù ‚Äúthe chariot does not exist.‚Äù

original: don dam par ni dgag par bya ba tha dad kyang dngos po med pas tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni dgag par bya ba tha dad kyang dngos po med pas tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: But ultimately, even though the negatee is different, the non-entity is not different.

original: gal te med pa nyid mi dmigs pas yin na /
analyzed: gal te med pa nyid mi dmigs pas yin na /
translated: If non-existence is from non-perception,

original: de'i tshe log par rtog pa med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe log par rtog pa med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that at that time there is no misconception,üîΩthat is true.

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: But,

original: 'di ltar / de phyir mi shes shes bya'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de phyir mi shes shes bya'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of the object of refutation

original: mi dmigs dpe gcig 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: mi dmigs dpe gcig 'dod pa yin //
translated: is accepted as the one example of non-apprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa dpe gcig ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dpe gcig ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The one example of non-apprehension is characterized by the non-apprehension of intrinsic reality.

original: re zhig shes pa dang shes bya dngos po med pa dag / tha dad pa med par ma rtogs pa'am grangs can pa gang dag shin tu rmongs pas na ;
analyzed: re zhig shes pa dang shes bya dngos po med pa dag / tha dad pa med par ma rtogs pa'am grangs can pa gang dag shin tu rmongs pas na ;
translated: Those who are very confused, who do not understand the non-difference of the non-existence of the object of knowledge and the knower, or who are Enumerators,

original: thams cad thams cad na yod do zhes kun du 'dzin pa dang ldan pa yongs su shes pa dang bral ba'i mi shes pa de dag shes par bya ba'i don du rang bzhin mi dmigs pas gcig yin no //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad na yod do zhes kun du 'dzin pa dang ldan pa yongs su shes pa dang bral ba'i mi shes pa de dag shes par bya ba'i don du rang bzhin mi dmigs pas gcig yin no //
translated: who are completely ignorant, who are devoid of understanding, who hold the view that everything exists in everything, that non-apprehension is the one example of non-apprehension of intrinsic reality.

original: 'on te der bsgrub par bya ba ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der bsgrub par bya ba ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: But what is to be established by that?üîΩThe object of refutation does not exist,

original: yul med phyir der yul can ni //
analyzed: yul med phyir der yul can ni //
translated: therefore the object of apprehension is not apprehended,

original: shes brjod the tshom 'gog 'gyur te //üîΩdper na sreg par byed min phyir //
analyzed: shes brjod the tshom 'gog 'gyur te // dper na sreg par byed min phyir //
translated: and the object of expression, doubt, and refutation are not apprehended.üîΩFor example,

original: me ma yin zhes bya ba bzhin //
analyzed: me ma yin zhes bya ba bzhin //
translated: just as one says ‚ÄúIt is not fire‚Äù because it does not burn.

original: shes pa dang brjod pa dag gi yul ni yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa dag gi yul ni yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: The object of cognition and expression exists.

original: de dag tu the tshom za ba'i yul ni der the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag tu the tshom za ba'i yul ni der the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: The object of doubt is doubted.

original: yul de med par nges pas ni shes pa dang brjod pa dang the tshom zlog par byed de ;
analyzed: yul de med par nges pas ni shes pa dang brjod pa dang the tshom zlog par byed de ;
translated: The object of negation is ascertained as nonexistent, and cognition, expression, and doubt are eliminated.

original: bzlog pa'i yul yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i yul yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of negation exists.

original: dper na me ma yin te sreg par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na me ma yin te sreg par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚ÄúIt is not fire because it does not burn.‚Äù

original: phyogs gzhan du gyur pa'i me yod na mer the tshom za bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan du gyur pa'i me yod na mer the tshom za bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If fire existed in another place, one would doubt whether it was fire.

original: bzlog pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzlog pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: But because the object of negation exists,

original: de med na srid par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na srid par ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could it exist?

original: 'di ltar sreg par byed pa med pa las me med pa nyid ni gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sreg par byed pa med pa las me med pa nyid ni gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the nonexistence of fire is not different from the nonexistence of burning.

original: ci ltar sreg par byed pa las me gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar sreg par byed pa las me gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as fire is not different from burning,

original: dmigs su rung ba med pa ni //
analyzed: dmigs su rung ba med pa ni //
translated: the object of perception that does not exist

original: mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin //
translated: is not different from nonperception.

original: de phyir de yod pa las de'i //
analyzed: de phyir de yod pa las de'i //
translated: Therefore, the existence of that

original: rgyu mtshan can gyi sgra shes sgrub //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan can gyi sgra shes sgrub //
translated: The sound of a reason is established.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa rnams kyi med pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa rnams kyi med pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called non-existence of those that have the characteristic of being perceived

original: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan phyi rol du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan phyi rol du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: is not something external to the nature of non-apprehension.

original: de bas na de grub na de'i bdag nyid dngos po grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na de grub na de'i bdag nyid dngos po grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, when that is established, the thing that has that as its nature is certainly established.

original: gal te mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa sgrub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa sgrub pa ma yin nam /
translated: If non-apprehension does not establish non-existence,

original: de ci ltar na bsgrub bya dang / sgrub par byed pa dag gcig nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na bsgrub bya dang / sgrub par byed pa dag gcig nyid yin zhe na /
translated: how can the probandum and the proof be identical?

original: @269a * // de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: @269a * // de yang mi rung ste /
translated: That is also not correct.

original: de nyid 'dir ni ma grub ste //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir ni ma grub ste //
translated: That is not established here.

original: ma grub pa yis ma grub pa //
analyzed: ma grub pa yis ma grub pa //
translated: The non-established does not establish.

original: grub 'gyur ma yin 'di la ni //
analyzed: grub 'gyur ma yin 'di la ni //
translated: This is not established.

original: 'bral med de phyir de ma yin //
analyzed: 'bral med de phyir de ma yin //
translated: Because it is not separate from that, it is not that.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byad pa dag tha dad par 'gyur dgos so zhes gang brjod pa bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byad pa'i dngos po de nyid 'dir ma grub pas /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byad pa dag tha dad par 'gyur dgos so zhes gang brjod pa bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byad pa'i dngos po de nyid 'dir ma grub pas /
translated: As for what was said, ‚ÄúThe probandum and the proof must be different,‚Äù the nature of the probandum and the proof is not established here.

original: de ci ltar de bzhin du tha dad par grub pa ma grub pa ni ma grub pas mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de ci ltar de bzhin du tha dad par grub pa ma grub pa ni ma grub pas mi 'grub po //
translated: But if they are not established as different, then they are not established as the probandum and the probans.

original: ci srid du gzhan la bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos por rab tu ma grub pa de srid du tha dad par mi 'grub pa /
analyzed: ci srid du gzhan la bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos por rab tu ma grub pa de srid du tha dad par mi 'grub pa /
translated: As long as the probandum and the probans are not established as different, they are not established as different.

original: ci srid tha dad par ma grub pa de srid du yang bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po ni 'brel pa yod na 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: ci srid tha dad par ma grub pa de srid du yang bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po ni 'brel pa yod na 'gyur ba yin /
translated: As long as they are not established as different, then the probandum and the probans are related if they exist.

original: mi dmigs pa dang med pa dag de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa spong ba la ni 'brel pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang med pa dag de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa spong ba la ni 'brel pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the relation of identity is excluded from non-apprehension and non-existence, and there is no other relation.

original: de dag rgyu dang 'brel bu'i dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag rgyu dang 'brel bu'i dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not related as cause and effect.

original: gal te dngos po med pas mi dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pas mi dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: If non-apprehension is non-existence because of the non-existence of the thing,

original: gang gi tshe bum pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis bsal ba de nyid kyi tshe mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bum pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis bsal ba de nyid kyi tshe mi dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then when a pot, for example, is removed by someone, at that time it is not apprehended.

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true.

original: gal te dngos po med pa mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i tshad mas shes pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i tshad mas shes pa yin na /
translated: If the non-existence of a thing were known by a valid cognition other than non-apprehension,

original: de'i phyir de dag mi dmigs pa lhan cig 'brel pa 'grub kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag mi dmigs pa lhan cig 'brel pa 'grub kyi /
translated: then non-apprehension would be established as being related to that.

original: gzhan du na phan tshun rten pa'i skyon du 'gro ba gang gis zlog //
analyzed: gzhan du na phan tshun rten pa'i skyon du 'gro ba gang gis zlog //
translated: Otherwise, the fault of mutual dependence would occur, but who can avert it?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / 'brel pa tshad mas grub na ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'brel pa tshad mas grub na ni //
translated: If the relation is established by a valid cognition,

original: mi dmigs pa ni tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni tshad ma nyid //
translated: then non-apprehension is a valid cognition.

original: mi dmigs tshad ma nyid yin na /
analyzed: mi dmigs tshad ma nyid yin na /
translated: If non-apprehension is a valid cognition,

original: 'brel pa rab tu 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'brel pa rab tu 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: then the relation is well established.

original: phan tshun rten phyir gcig nyid kyang //
analyzed: phan tshun rten phyir gcig nyid kyang //
translated: But because of mutual dependence,

original: rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: even one is not well established.

original: de nyid phyir na phan tshun gyis //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na phan tshun gyis //
translated: Therefore, because of that,

original: byas pa'i 'bras bu 'grub ma yin //
analyzed: byas pa'i 'bras bu 'grub ma yin //
translated: the effect produced by mutual dependence is not established.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, non-existence is not established from non-apprehension,

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no relation.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yin na ni mi dmigs pa de nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yin na ni mi dmigs pa de nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: If the relation were one of identity, then that non-apprehension itself would be non-existence, and the convention would be established.

original: rnam pa ma mthong na med ces //
analyzed: rnam pa ma mthong na med ces //
translated: If the aspect is not seen, it does not exist.üîΩ

original: bya ba'i tha snyad 'di 'grub pas //
analyzed: bya ba'i tha snyad 'di 'grub pas //
translated: If the form is not seen, the expression ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù is established.

original: de'i 'bras yin yang de las ni //
analyzed: de'i 'bras yin yang de las ni //
translated: Therefore, even though it is the effect of that,

original: blo sgra the tshom med par 'grub //
analyzed: blo sgra the tshom med par 'grub //
translated: the cognition and the word are established without doubt from that.

original: gal te tha snyad 'grub pa la yang dpe med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad 'grub pa la yang dpe med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the establishment of the expression is not without an example,

original: tha snyad thams cad na ni mi dmigs pa'i bsgrub bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad na ni mi dmigs pa'i bsgrub bar bya ba yin no //
translated: in all expressions the object to be established is nonapprehension.

original: de'i tshe 'ang dpe gzhan bsgrub pa ni thug ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'ang dpe gzhan bsgrub pa ni thug ba med pa nyid do //
translated: And at that time, the establishment of another example would be endless.

original: tha snyad kyang mi dmigs pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang mi dmigs pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: And the expression would be the effect of nonapprehension.

original: des na rgyus 'bras bu @269b sgrub par mi rigs te /
analyzed: des na rgyus 'bras bu @269b sgrub par mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that the cause establishes the effect,

original: rgyu ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the cause is certainly not endowed with it.

original: de ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar tha snyad 'di ni ltar rung ba ma mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan can du 'grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar tha snyad 'di ni ltar rung ba ma mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan can du 'grub pa nyid do //
translated: Because in this way, the expression is established as having the reason of the nonseeing of the suitable to appear.

original: de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis med pa'i tha snyad du bya ba rung ba nyid ni mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis med pa'i tha snyad du bya ba rung ba nyid ni mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: The mere reason that it is suitable to use the term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is the very nonapprehension of it.

original: rung ba nyid ni don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba nyid ni don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because suitability is not a different object.

original: sems dang ldan pa de mthong bas tha snyad ni gdon mi za bar 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa de mthong bas tha snyad ni gdon mi za bar 'jug pa yin no //
translated: When one sees that, one must use the term.

original: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad de'i rgyu mtshan can du dran pa ni gdon mi za bar de'i sems pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad de'i rgyu mtshan can du dran pa ni gdon mi za bar de'i sems pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When one remembers the term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù as the reason for that, one must have the thought of it.

original: gal te lus ngag gi tha snyad 'ug par mi byed na yang mi byed mod /
analyzed: gal te lus ngag gi tha snyad 'ug par mi byed na yang mi byed mod /
translated: If one does not use the term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù for body and speech, one may not use it.

original: tshad ma ni rtogs par sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin gyi lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad bsgrubs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ni rtogs par sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin gyi lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad bsgrubs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But valid cognition is valid because it establishes the object; it is not because it establishes the term ‚Äúbody‚Äù and so on.üîΩTherefore, even when the object exists,

original: de'i phyir / yul yod na yang rmongs pas 'dir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yul yod na yang rmongs pas 'dir //
translated: because of delusion,

original: gzhan dag rjes su mi brjod par //üîΩgrub pa dang ni chos mthun las //
analyzed: gzhan dag rjes su mi brjod par // grub pa dang ni chos mthun las //
translated: others do not state it.

original: brda dran byed pa'ang 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: brda dran byed pa'ang 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Only the recollection of the signüîΩfrom the established similar propertyüîΩis stated.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o /üîΩci ltar mthong dang ma mthong bas //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o / ci ltar mthong dang ma mthong bas //
translated: This is the summary.üîΩAs cause and effect are established

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid bsgrub bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid bsgrub bzhin //
translated: through seeing and not seeing,

original: de gnyis las ni 'bras sogs sgra //
analyzed: de gnyis las ni 'bras sogs sgra //
translated: the words ‚Äúeffect‚Äù and so on

original: tha snyad don du bkod pa yin //
analyzed: tha snyad don du bkod pa yin //
translated: are posited as conventional expressions.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i khyad par las ma gtogs par ni rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i khyad par las ma gtogs par ni rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the distinction of seeing and not seeing, cause and effect are not established in any other way.

original: 'di'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di nyid yin te 'di med par ni mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di nyid yin te 'di med par ni mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúeffect‚Äù is this: it does not occur if this does not exist.

original: gal te 'di las tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di las tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If it were different from this,

original: de'i tshe de med kyang 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe de med kyang 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: then it would occur even if this does not exist.

original: de ltar gyur na 'brel pa /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na 'brel pa /
translated: If that were so, there would be no relation.

original: don gzhan med do //
analyzed: don gzhan med do //
translated: There would be no other object.

original: 'on te de med par mi 'byung na /
analyzed: 'on te de med par mi 'byung na /
translated: But if it does not occur if this does not exist,

original: de ltar yin na de nyid 'brel pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar yin na de nyid 'brel pa yin pas /
translated: then if that is so, this itself is the relation.

original: gzhan don med do //üîΩgal te 'brel pa yod na de med na med la /
analyzed: gzhan don med do // gal te 'brel pa yod na de med na med la /
translated: Therefore, another object is pointless.

original: de yod na yod do zhes 'grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na yod do zhes 'grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the relation exists, it is established that it does not exist if this does not exist, and it exists if this exists.

original: gal te 'brel pas de yod na //
analyzed: gal te 'brel pas de yod na //
translated: If you say that the effect exists in dependence on the cause,üîΩthen you must admit that the effect exists prior to its production.

original: yod ces bya bar 'dod na ni //
analyzed: yod ces bya bar 'dod na ni //
translated: If you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?

original: de med na yang 'brel pa sngar //
analyzed: de med na yang 'brel pa sngar //
translated: If you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?

original: gang gis zhes ni yin par brtag /'brel pa gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang gis zhes ni yin par brtag /'brel pa gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: If you say that the effect exists prior to its production,

original: gcig yod pa la ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig yod pa la ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: then what is the use of its production?

original: gal te 'bras bu skye bar ni //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu skye bar ni //
translated: If you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?

original: rgyu rung bar ni 'brel pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyu rung bar ni 'brel pa yin na /
translated: If you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?

original: rgyu nyid las ni 'bras bu skye ba zhes bya ba nyid rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu nyid las ni 'bras bu skye ba zhes bya ba nyid rigs par 'gyur /
translated: If you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?

original: 'di ltar rgyu ni de lta bur gyur pa nyid du rang gi rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ni de lta bur gyur pa nyid du rang gi rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: If you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyi dngos po gzhan ni dbang po las 'das ba mthong ba dag la yang snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyi dngos po gzhan ni dbang po las 'das ba mthong ba dag la yang snang ba ma yin no //
translated: If you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,üîΩthen what is the use of its production?üîΩIf you say that the effect exists prior to its production,

original: @270a * // de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: @270a * // de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad sgrub pa yin no //
translated: then what is the use of its production?üîΩIf

original: 'o na ji ltar don tha dad med par sgra tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar don tha dad med par sgra tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how can there be a difference in the words without a difference in the objects?

original: ma yin te mthong ba dang ma mthong ba de dag nyid la tha snyad zor yang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu la sogs pa'i sgra sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te mthong ba dang ma mthong ba de dag nyid la tha snyad zor yang bar bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu la sogs pa'i sgra sbyar ba yin no //
translated: No, because the words effect and so on are applied to those seen and unseen in order to make the conventions easy to use.

original: des na / nus pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na / nus pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the cause of the possibility is the nature of the effect.

original: des na mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshig yin pa de bas na 'di logs zhig nye bar ma bkod do //
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshig yin pa de bas na 'di logs zhig nye bar ma bkod do //
translated: Therefore, nonobservation is a natural reason, and so it is not set forth separately.

original: gal te ci ltar de'i bdag nyid med par rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du /
analyzed: gal te ci ltar de'i bdag nyid med par rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du /
translated: If you ask, how is the nonobservation of nature included in natural reasons, since it does not exist as their nature?

original: ci ltar dngos po med pa dag phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin pa de bzhin du tha mi dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar dngos po med pa dag phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin pa de bzhin du tha mi dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Just as nonthings are neither different from things nor the same,

original: bdag med pa la yang de'i bdag nyid srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa la yang de'i bdag nyid srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nonself is also not the nature of self,

original: ri bong gi rva ni bong bu'i rva'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ni bong bu'i rva'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: because a rabbit‚Äôs horns are not the nature of a donkey‚Äôs horns.

original: 'di la lan btab pa ni mi dmigs pa ni dgag par bya ba las bzlog pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di la lan btab pa ni mi dmigs pa ni dgag par bya ba las bzlog pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The response to this is that non-apprehension is the nature of the opposite of the object of negation.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / rgyu las 'bras bu grub pas na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu las 'bras bu grub pas na //
translated: Since the effect is established from the cause,

original: 'di ni rang bzhin nang 'dus phyir //
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin nang 'dus phyir //
translated: this is included in the nature.

original: gtan tshigs rab dbye bshad pa la //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rab dbye bshad pa la //
translated: In the explanation of the divisions of the reason,

original: tha dad par ni dper ma bstan //
analyzed: tha dad par ni dper ma bstan //
translated: the example is not shown to be different.

original: stong pa'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po med pa ni tshad ma'i spyod yul du rnam par dpyad par rung ba ma yin la de ni rang gi ngo bo tsam du grub tu zin kyang cung zad kyang 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po med pa ni tshad ma'i spyod yul du rnam par dpyad par rung ba ma yin la de ni rang gi ngo bo tsam du grub tu zin kyang cung zad kyang 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The non-existence of an entity by way of its own nature is not suitable to be analyzed as the domain of valid cognition, and even if it were established as merely its own nature, it would not establish anything at all.

original: de ni dngos po 'chol bar rtogs pa'i lta ba can dag gis de ltar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dngos po 'chol bar rtogs pa'i lta ba can dag gis de ltar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: This is asserted by those who have the view that realizes a jumble of entities.

original: de la gal te dngos po rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gal te dngos po rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, if an entity is different in terms of place, time, and nature by its own nature,

original: ldog pa yin na dngos po med pa gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ldog pa yin na dngos po med pa gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: then what is the use of positing another non-entity?

original: 'on te rang gi ngo bos ldog pa ma yin na de lta na yang dngos po med pa gzhan zhig ni don med do //
analyzed: 'on te rang gi ngo bos ldog pa ma yin na de lta na yang dngos po med pa gzhan zhig ni don med do //
translated: But if it is not essentially different, then another non-thing is pointless.

original: gcig la ni don med la /
analyzed: gcig la ni don med la /
translated: It is pointless in one case,üîΩand in the other it is not possible.

original: gzhan la ni mi nus so zhes sngar bstan zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan la ni mi nus so zhes sngar bstan zin pa nyid do //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i dngos po gzhan gyis dben pa nyid la bum pa la sogs pa'i med pa zhes tha dad pa'i tshul du de ltar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i dngos po gzhan gyis dben pa nyid la bum pa la sogs pa'i med pa zhes tha dad pa'i tshul du de ltar ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the absence of a pot, etc., is taught as a different mode of being, namely, the absence of a different thing that is essentially a pot, etc.

original: 'di ltar brjod par 'dod pa'i don gyi rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i bdag nyid don gcig gis ni dmigs pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par 'dod pa'i don gyi rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i bdag nyid don gcig gis ni dmigs pa gang yin pa de /
translated: Thus, the nature of the object that is the referent of the expression is the same as the nature of the absence of the referent.

original: rang rig pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de nyid las dran pa sngon du 'jug pa na /
analyzed: rang rig pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de nyid las dran pa sngon du 'jug pa na /
translated: When memory precedes the experience of reflexive awareness,

original: 'di ni ma dmigs so snyam pa rtogs pa'i rang gi blo skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma dmigs so snyam pa rtogs pa'i rang gi blo skye'o //
translated: the thought ‚ÄúThis is not observed‚Äù arises in the mind.

original: de las phyogs dmigs pa nyid gzhan mi dmigs pa yin de gang gi phyir @270b 'di ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin du ma dmigs so zhes bya ba yin na //
analyzed: de las phyogs dmigs pa nyid gzhan mi dmigs pa yin de gang gi phyir @270b 'di ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin du ma dmigs so zhes bya ba yin na //
translated: But if it is the non-apprehension of something else that is meant by the non-apprehension of that, then that is not the case, because the nature of something else is not apprehended.

original: 'dir don ni /
analyzed: 'dir don ni /
translated: Here is the meaning:

original: de'i rang bzhin du ma dmigs te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du ma dmigs te /
translated: The nature of that is not apprehended.

original: 'di ni de'i rang bzhin du med do zhes bya ba 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i rang bzhin du med do zhes bya ba 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This is the same as saying ‚Äúit does not exist as that nature.‚Äù

original: gal te bum pa de 'di na med do zhes te /
analyzed: gal te bum pa de 'di na med do zhes te /
translated: If it is the case that the pot is not here,

original: 'di'i rang bzhin du med do zhes bya bar bsgrub par bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin du med do zhes bya bar bsgrub par bya ba yin nam /
translated: is it being established that it does not exist as this nature?

original: ci ltar na bzlog ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar na bzlog ste brjod ce na /
translated: How is it that the opposite is being stated?

original: gal te gzhan yang 'di'i yang 'di'i nang du mi 'du na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan yang 'di'i yang 'di'i nang du mi 'du na /
translated: If something else is not included in this,

original: bden pa zhig na /
analyzed: bden pa zhig na /
translated: then it is true that

original: de'i nang du 'du ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i nang du 'du ba nyid do //
translated: it is not included in this.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / sa phyogs de yi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sa phyogs de yi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The nature of that place

original: dben pa'am 'di yis bum pa'ang rung //
analyzed: dben pa'am 'di yis bum pa'ang rung //
translated: is either empty or it is a pot.

original: mkhas pa rnams la ci ltar yang //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams la ci ltar yang //
translated: In any case, for the wise,

original: 'dis ni rnam dbye snang ba med //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam dbye snang ba med //
translated: this does not appear as a distinction.

original: gal te rang bzhin 'dis dben par ma gyur na 'di yang des dben par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu gsal ba'i don la gzhan dag ni lta ci zhig smos /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin 'dis dben par ma gyur na 'di yang des dben par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu gsal ba'i don la gzhan dag ni lta ci zhig smos /
translated: If it were not devoid of this intrinsic reality, then it would not be devoid of that. What need is there to mention the very clear meaning?

original: de'i phyir des dben pa nyid 'dir de'i dngos po med pa yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir des dben pa'i phyogs mthong ba nyid la de ma dmigs so zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir des dben pa nyid 'dir de'i dngos po med pa yin no // gang gi phyir des dben pa'i phyogs mthong ba nyid la de ma dmigs so zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: Therefore, the mere absence of that intrinsic reality is the nonexistence of that intrinsic reality.

original: de las gzhan gyi rang bzhin du dmigs so snyam pa'i blo skye ba de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa dang / ma dmigs pa dag de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyi rang bzhin du dmigs so snyam pa'i blo skye ba de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa dang / ma dmigs pa dag de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Because the cognition arises that ‚ÄúI do not observe that in the very place where it is devoid of that,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI observe the intrinsic reality of something else,‚Äù therefore, the observation and nonobservation of that intrinsic reality are the same.

original: gal te 'di shes pa gzhan mi dmigs pa yin du chug na /
analyzed: gal te 'di shes pa gzhan mi dmigs pa yin du chug na /
translated: If it is acceptable that the cognition of that does not observe another cognition,

original: shes bya gzhan mi dmigs pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes bya gzhan mi dmigs pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: how is it that the object of cognition does not observe another object of cognition?

original: shes pa dang shes bya dag tha dad pa med do zhes bstan zin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dag tha dad pa med do zhes bstan zin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no error because it has been demonstrated that cognition and the object of cognition are not different.

original: yang na 'am gyi sgra ni de bzhin gyi don to //
analyzed: yang na 'am gyi sgra ni de bzhin gyi don to //
translated: Or else, the term ‚Äúor‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: ci ltar 'di mi dmigs so snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir na de lta nges pa'i dmigs pa dmigs pa yin pa de bzhin du ma dmigs so snyam pa'i nges pa las kyang mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar 'di mi dmigs so snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir na de lta nges pa'i dmigs pa dmigs pa yin pa de bzhin du ma dmigs so snyam pa'i nges pa las kyang mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Just as the object of ascertainment is the object of the thought ‚ÄúIt is not observed,‚Äù in the same way, the nonobservation is ascertained by the thought ‚ÄúIt is not observed.‚Äù

original: gal te dngos po med par bsgrub pa'i dngos po med pa yod pa nyid kyis na dngos po rnams khyad par 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med par bsgrub pa'i dngos po med pa yod pa nyid kyis na dngos po rnams khyad par 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if the nonexistence that is the object of the proof of nonexistence exists, then don‚Äôt the entities become established?

original: de ci ltar na dngos po med pa 'chol bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na dngos po med pa 'chol bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be that the nonexistence is not mixed up?üîΩIt is not so.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / gcig dmigs nyams su myong ba las //üîΩ'di ni dmigs so zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / 'di ltar / gcig dmigs nyams su myong ba las // 'di ni dmigs so zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: Thus:üîΩThe thought ‚ÄúThis is observed‚Äù

original: mi dmigs so zhes rtog can gyi //
analyzed: mi dmigs so zhes rtog can gyi //
translated: or ‚ÄúIt is not observed‚Äù

original: blo ni skye bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: blo ni skye bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: arises in the conceptual thoughtüîΩfrom the experience of the observation of one.

original: myong ba khyad par can nyid las //
analyzed: myong ba khyad par can nyid las //
translated: From the experience itself,

original: don rnams khyad par can du rtogs //
analyzed: don rnams khyad par can du rtogs //
translated: one understands the object itself.

original: de lta'i bdag nyid can myong min //
analyzed: de lta'i bdag nyid can myong min //
translated: The experience itself is not of that nature.

original: 'di yi tha snyad blo rgyu yin //
analyzed: 'di yi tha snyad blo rgyu yin //
translated: The conventional is the cause of the cognition.

original: gal te myong ba khyad par du na myong ba gzhan gyis dben pa med na ni /üîΩmyong bar bya @271a * //
analyzed: gal te myong ba khyad par du na myong ba gzhan gyis dben pa med na ni / myong bar bya @271a * //
translated: If the experience is not distinct, that is, not separate from the other experience,

original: ba'i khyad par rtogs pa la /
analyzed: ba'i khyad par rtogs pa la /
translated: then the experience of the objectüîΩwould not be distinct.

original: gal te rang rig par de'i rang bzhin gyis myong ba nyams su ma myong na de'i tshe khyad par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang rig par de'i rang bzhin gyis myong ba nyams su ma myong na de'i tshe khyad par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the experience of the nature of that object is not experienced by reflexive awareness, then at that time the distinction would not be cognized.

original: dngos po med par rigs pas rtogs so zhe na /üîΩdbye ba med par myong ba la dngos po chod pa rig par nus pa yon pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med par rigs pas rtogs so zhe na / dbye ba med par myong ba la dngos po chod pa rig par nus pa yon pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is cognized by a nonentity,üîΩthen it is not possible to cognize an entity that is not experienced without distinction.

original: tshad mas bzung ba gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas bzung ba gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not possible to apprehend by valid knowledge something that cannot be taken as an object.

original: 'di ni bstan zin pas mi brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ni bstan zin pas mi brjod de /
translated: This has already been explained, so I will not elaborate.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / dran pa med par dngos med kyi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dran pa med par dngos med kyi //
translated: Without memory, a nonentity

original: tshad ma yod par srid ma yin //
analyzed: tshad ma yod par srid ma yin //
translated: cannot be a valid knowledge.

original: khyad par gzhan gyi med par yang /üîΩbzlog pa'i zla bo dran ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan gyi med par yang / bzlog pa'i zla bo dran ma yin //
translated: Also, without another distinction,üîΩthe memory of the opposite is not possible.

original: bzlog zla dran pa med par ni //
analyzed: bzlog zla dran pa med par ni //
translated: Without the memory of the opposite,

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad ma skye ba ma yin la //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad ma skye ba ma yin la //
translated: a valid knowledge of a nonentity does not arise.

original: bzlog pa'i zla dran par yang khyad par can yang rigs med par ma yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i zla dran par yang khyad par can yang rigs med par ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the memory of the object to be refuted is not a special kind of memory.

original: 'on te sngar khyad par can du myong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar khyad par can du myong ngo zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it was experienced as a special kind of object before,

original: de ltar yin na 'di yang yin pas dngos po med pa don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar yin na 'di yang yin pas dngos po med pa don med pa nyid do //
translated: then since it is like that, the nonexistence of the object is pointless.

original: 'on te dngos po med pa de nyid med pa'i tha snyad du bsgrub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa de nyid med pa'i tha snyad du bsgrub po zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the nonexistence of the object itself is established by the expression ‚Äúnonexistent,‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis 'grub pa gzhan gyis bsgrubs pas ci bya /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'grub pa gzhan gyis bsgrubs pas ci bya /
translated: then what is the use of establishing one thing by another?

original: tha snyad bsgrub pa la ni /
analyzed: tha snyad bsgrub pa la ni /
translated: In establishing the expression,

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa de nyid yin no //
translated: the nonperception of the nature of the object is itself the logical argument of nature.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis dben pa nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la tha dad pa de nyid ni de las gzhan med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis dben pa nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin la tha dad pa de nyid ni de las gzhan med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the conceptual thought that is different from the experience of the nature of the object is different from it. And that difference is the nonexistence of the object.üîΩTherefore, the conceptual thought

original: de phyir blo dbye rang nyid las //üîΩgrub 'gyur de dag gis de'i don //
analyzed: de phyir blo dbye rang nyid las // grub 'gyur de dag gis de'i don //
translated: is established from itself.

original: de lta min na thug med phyir //
analyzed: de lta min na thug med phyir //
translated: Otherwise, because of infinite regress,

original: 'ga' yang tha dad 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'ga' yang tha dad 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: nothing would be established as different.

original: blo ni rang rig pa nyid gzhan la ldog par rab tu grub la /
analyzed: blo ni rang rig pa nyid gzhan la ldog par rab tu grub la /
translated: The mind is well established as reflexive awareness.

original: de las kyang don gyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir myong ba'i tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las kyang don gyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir myong ba'i tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: And since it is a specific object, the convention of experience is fully complete.

original: gal te mngon sum nyid las tha dad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum nyid las tha dad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If it is not different from direct perception,

original: 'on kyang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma las yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma las yin na /
translated: but rather from the valid knowledge of non-existence,

original: de lta yin na thug pa med pa'i phyir mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na thug pa med pa'i phyir mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because there would be an infinite regress, it would not be cognized.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gal te dngos po med pa yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te dngos po med pa yi //
translated: If the valid knowledge of non-existence

original: tshad mas tha dad sgrub byed na //
analyzed: tshad mas tha dad sgrub byed na //
