translated: establishes difference,

original: dngos med de yang dngos med pa //üîΩgzhan gyis nges bzung de yang ni //
analyzed: dngos med de yang dngos med pa // gzhan gyis nges bzung de yang ni //
translated: then that non-existence would also be non-existent,üîΩand that would also be ascertained by another,

original: gzhan gyis de yang de las ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de yang de las ni //
translated: and that would also be by another,

original: gzhan gyis yin phyir thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yin phyir thug med 'gyur //
translated: and that would also be by another, so there would be an infinite regress.

original: de ltar na tha snyad med par 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: de ltar na tha snyad med par 'gyur ro / // / bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: Thus, conventions would not exist.

original: gal te dngos po med pa'i tshad mas mngon sum gyis ma rtogs pa'i tha dad pa rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa'i tshad mas mngon sum gyis ma rtogs pa'i tha dad pa rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If the valid knowledge of non-existence cognizes difference that is not cognized by direct perception,

original: dngos po med pa de ni 'gal zla dran pa @271b med par mi 'jug go //
analyzed: dngos po med pa de ni 'gal zla dran pa @271b med par mi 'jug go //
translated: And that non-entity does not occur without the memory of its opposite.

original: 'gal zla dran pa yang mngon sum gyis tha dad par bzung ba las 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po med par don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gal zla dran pa yang mngon sum gyis tha dad par bzung ba las 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po med par don med par 'gyur te /
translated: And the memory of the opposite occurs from the apprehension of difference by direct perception, so the non-entity would be pointless.

original: de ltar yang sngon bzhin du mngon sum nyid kyis tha dad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang sngon bzhin du mngon sum nyid kyis tha dad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And just as before, it would be apprehended as different by direct perception.

original: 'on te der yang dngos po med par tha dad pa ma yin pas na dngos po med pa don med pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der yang dngos po med par tha dad pa ma yin pas na dngos po med pa don med pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that since it is not different from the non-entity there, the non-entity is not pointless,

original: de lta yin na de'i tshe yang dran pa la ltos pas der yang dngos po med pa 'jug par byed pa'i dran pa gzhan yin par 'gyur bas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na de'i tshe yang dran pa la ltos pas der yang dngos po med pa 'jug par byed pa'i dran pa gzhan yin par 'gyur bas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that case, since it would depend on memory, there would be an infinite regress, since the memory that engages the non-entity there would be another memory.

original: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad de /
analyzed: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad de /
translated: This is just a statement of acceptance.

original: gang gis de'i tshe dngos po med par 'jug pa na des 'di las tha dad par 'dzin pa de ltar bzung ba ni de'i tshe 'gal zlar dran pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: gang gis de'i tshe dngos po med par 'jug pa na des 'di las tha dad par 'dzin pa de ltar bzung ba ni de'i tshe 'gal zlar dran pa ni mi srid do //
translated: When one engages in the nonexistence of that, then at that time, it is impossible to remember the contradictory of that, which is apprehended as different from that.

original: des na dngos po med pa ni 'jug par mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa ni 'jug par mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible to engage in the nonexistence of that.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi lta ba la ni tha dad par rtogs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi lta ba la ni tha dad par rtogs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, in the view of others, there is no apprehension of difference.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / rang bzhin khyad par can myong la //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang bzhin khyad par can myong la //
translated: The experience of a distinctive nature

original: gzhan gsal ba ni gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan gsal ba ni gzhan ma yin /
translated: Is not different from the other.

original: de phyir de mi dmigs pa yang //üîΩde las khyad par can mi dmigs //üîΩkhyad par can gyi rang bzhin dmigs pa nyid de las gzhan med par bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de phyir de mi dmigs pa yang // de las khyad par can mi dmigs // khyad par can gyi rang bzhin dmigs pa nyid de las gzhan med par bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of thatüîΩIs the non-apprehension of a distinctive nature.üîΩThe experience of a distinctive nature itself establishes the nonexistence of that which is different from it.

original: khyad par can gyi rang bzhin myong ba med par ni gzhan der med par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rang bzhin myong ba med par ni gzhan der med par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Without the experience of a distinctive nature, the nonexistence of that which is different from it is not established.

original: gal te khyad par can nyams su myang bas ni //
analyzed: gal te khyad par can nyams su myang bas ni //
translated: If the distinctive nature is experienced,

original: de de lta bur gyur pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de de lta bur gyur pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: it becomes just that.

original: de de la med par ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de de la med par ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be nonexistent in that?

original: yul dang dus gzhan du 'gyur ba ni der med pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan du 'gyur ba ni der med pa la ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that it is transformed into another place and time, because it is not nonexistent there.

original: de ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not the characteristic of an object of perception.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.üîΩFor thus:

original: 'di ltar / rang bzhin khyad par can myong na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rang bzhin khyad par can myong na //
translated: Having experienced a distinctive nature,

original: gzhan ma gsal bar ci ltar 'gyur//
analyzed: gzhan ma gsal bar ci ltar 'gyur//
translated: how could another be manifest without it?

original: gal te gzhan gsal la med na ni //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gsal la med na ni //
translated: If it is manifest without another,

original: de nyid grub par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid grub par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: that itself is not established.

original: khyad par can gyi rang bzhin ma myong ba ni don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rang bzhin ma myong ba ni don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The distinctive nature is not experienced without a purpose.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin khyad par can myong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin khyad par can myong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the distinctive nature of a pot, etc. is experienced,

original: dngos po med par rtogs pas gzhan gyis ci zhig bya dngos po med de rtogs kyang rang gi ngo bo khyad par rtogs pa med pa ni khyad par can gyi rang bzhin myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med par rtogs pas gzhan gyis ci zhig bya dngos po med de rtogs kyang rang gi ngo bo khyad par rtogs pa med pa ni khyad par can gyi rang bzhin myong ba ma yin no //
translated: what is the use of another, since it is understood as a nonentity? Even if a nonentity is understood, the distinctive nature is not experienced without understanding its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa ni gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa ni gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is certainly to be accepted that its own nature is understood.

original: dngos po med par gzhan gyi rang bzhin ni rang gi ngo bor rtogs nus pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //üîΩde'i khyad par can nyams su myong ba gzhan @272a * //
analyzed: dngos po med par gzhan gyi rang bzhin ni rang gi ngo bor rtogs nus pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to // de'i khyad par can nyams su myong ba gzhan @272a * //
translated: It has been explained that the nature of another thing, which is not a real thing, cannot be understood as its own nature.

original: dang gzhan dngos po med pa sgrub pa yin la gzhan mi dmigs pa nyid dngos po yang de'i khyad par can dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dang gzhan dngos po med pa sgrub pa yin la gzhan mi dmigs pa nyid dngos po yang de'i khyad par can dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The experience of its distinction is the proof of the nonexistence of another thing. The nonapprehension of another thing is the apprehension of its distinction.

original: des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, this nonapprehension

original: rang nyid mngon sum las rtogs pas //
analyzed: rang nyid mngon sum las rtogs pas //
translated: is understood from perception itself.

original: rang nyid tsam gyis 'jug pa can //
analyzed: rang nyid tsam gyis 'jug pa can //
translated: It is engaged in just that.

original: de med rnam gzhag go byed yin //üîΩdes na rang bzhin nges pa dmigs pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / dngos po med pa dag de'i bdag nyid du grub pa dang / mngon sum gyis grub pa yang yin pas na ma grub pa dang /
analyzed: de med rnam gzhag go byed yin // des na rang bzhin nges pa dmigs pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / dngos po med pa dag de'i bdag nyid du grub pa dang / mngon sum gyis grub pa yang yin pas na ma grub pa dang /
translated: It is the means of understanding the presentation of its nonexistence.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of the nature of nonapprehension is the nonexistence of the nature of the apprehension of another thing. Therefore, nonapprehension and nonexistence are established as the same nature. Since they are established by perception, there is no fault of nonestablishment or irrelevance.

original: mi dmigs pa de yang rgyu nus pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de yang rgyu nus pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: Since that non-observation is the potential cause,

original: rang tsam gyis 'jug pa dngos po med pa'i tha snyad 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang tsam gyis 'jug pa dngos po med pa'i tha snyad 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: it causes the engagement of the convention of non-entityness.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: Otherwise,

original: dmigs pa ngo bo med pa ni dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa ngo bo med pa ni dmigs pa yin la /
translated: if the non-entityness of the observed object were the observed object,

original: dngos po ngo bo med pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo med pa yin na /
translated: and if the entity were non-entityness,

original: de'i tshe thug pa med pa'i phyir mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni /üîΩgzhan du don gyis med pa nyid //
analyzed: de'i tshe thug pa med pa'i phyir mi 'grub pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni / gzhan du don gyis med pa nyid //
translated: then at that time, because there would be no end, it would not be established.üîΩThis is explained as follows:

original: mi dmigs pa las rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: The non-existence of the other is understood from non-observation.

original: gzhan gyis dmigs pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dmigs pa med pa nyid //
translated: Because of the non-existence of the other,

original: yin pa'i phyir na thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir na thug med 'gyur //
translated: the observed object, there would be no end.

original: ci ltar dngos po ngo bo med pa mi dmigs pa las yin pa de bzhin du dmigs pa'i ngo bo med pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang mi dmigs pa gzhan las yin la ;
analyzed: ci ltar dngos po ngo bo med pa mi dmigs pa las yin pa de bzhin du dmigs pa'i ngo bo med pa'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang mi dmigs pa gzhan las yin la ;
translated: Just as the non-entityness of the entity is from non-observation, so too the non-entityness of the nature of the observed object, which is non-observation, is from another non-observation.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid med pa yang gzhan las yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa'i sa las mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid med pa yang gzhan las yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa'i sa las mi 'grol lo //
translated: And because the non-entityness of that is from another, there would be no end, and one would not be liberated from the ground.

original: 'o na dmigs pas dngos po sgrub pa'i phyir na dngos po med pa mi dmigs pas bsgrub pa yin no //üîΩdmigs pa yod pa ni gzhan gyis bsgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir de med pa yang /
analyzed: 'o na dmigs pas dngos po sgrub pa'i phyir na dngos po med pa mi dmigs pas bsgrub pa yin no // dmigs pa yod pa ni gzhan gyis bsgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir de med pa yang /
translated: But if you say that the non-existence of an entity is established by the non-perception of an entity,

original: gzhan gyis bsgrub pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsgrub pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then the existence of an object is not established by another, and the non-existence of that is also not established by another.

original: de rung ste /üîΩdmigs pa rang rigs nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: de rung ste / dmigs pa rang rigs nyid kyis ni //
translated: That is correct.

original: sgrub par rigs pa dang ldan yin //
analyzed: sgrub par rigs pa dang ldan yin //
translated: But it is reasonable that the object is established by its own kind.

original: de med rang las 'grub po zhes //
analyzed: de med rang las 'grub po zhes //
translated: And it is said that the non-existence of that is established by itself.

original: bya ba ha cang bab chol ches //
analyzed: bya ba ha cang bab chol ches //
translated: This is a very absurd statement.üîΩIf the nature of that is

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo ni //üîΩ'di ni dngos po nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo ni // 'di ni dngos po nyid du 'gyur //
translated: an entity,

original: gzhan dmigs phyir na shes med pa //
analyzed: gzhan dmigs phyir na shes med pa //
translated: then it is not known by the perception of another.

original: gal te mngon sum nyid ce na //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum nyid ce na //
translated: If you say it is direct perception,üîΩthen it is established as non-existent,

original: 'on te de bzhin yod pas //üîΩdon med pa yang 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'on te de bzhin yod pas // don med pa yang 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: because it exists in that way.

original: ci ste med pa'i ngo bo med pa gzhan gyi mngon sum las 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste med pa'i ngo bo med pa gzhan gyi mngon sum las 'grub po zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the non-existence of an entity is established by the direct perception of another,

original: dngos po'i yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the existence of an entity would also be like that.

original: gal te dngos po ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi mngon sum las med par mi @272b 'gyur te /üîΩde'i rnam par shes pa las rang bzhin gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi mngon sum las med par mi @272b 'gyur te / de'i rnam par shes pa las rang bzhin gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that an entity is not non-existent in the direct perception of another because it is not the characteristic of the object of perception,

original: rig pa ni rig pa las rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rig pa ni rig pa las rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir na /
translated: then it is not different from the consciousness of that other person, because it is not different from the nature of that consciousness.üîΩBut awareness is not different from awareness,

original: de med pa gzhan gyi mngon sum las 'grub po //
analyzed: de med pa gzhan gyi mngon sum las 'grub po //
translated: so the non-existence of that is established by the direct perception of another.

original: de ltar yang ma dmigs so zhes skyes bu mchog gis dmigs pa gsal gyi don med do zhes ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar yang ma dmigs so zhes skyes bu mchog gis dmigs pa gsal gyi don med do zhes ni ma yin no ;
translated: Thus, the supreme person clearly perceives non-apprehension, but not the non-existence of the object.

original: / des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: / des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, this non-apprehension,üîΩis understood from one's own direct perception.

original: rang nyid mngon sum las rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni shes pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang nyid mngon sum las rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni shes pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: This is said to be the characteristic of non-existence.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩgzhan dmigs pa yis pha rol po //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / gzhan dmigs pa yis pha rol po //
translated: That is not so.üîΩHow can the existence of another be understood

original: gzhan dag med par ci ltar rtogs //üîΩgal te des dben pas zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag med par ci ltar rtogs // gal te des dben pas zhe na /
translated: by the apprehension of another?üîΩIf you say it is because of being devoid of that,

original: de ci mi dmigs las ma yin//
analyzed: de ci mi dmigs las ma yin//
translated: then is that not from non-apprehension?

original: des dben pa nyid med par ni shes pa gzhan dmigs pas shes pa gzhan med par bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des dben pa nyid med par ni shes pa gzhan dmigs pas shes pa gzhan med par bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the cognition of the absence of another cognition establishes the non-existence of another cognition.

original: des dben na dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin pas /
analyzed: des dben na dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin pas /
translated: If it were absent, the object itself would not be perceived.

original: de ci lta na de las gzhan pa'i myong ba med pa mngon sum gyis rab tu 'grub ba /
analyzed: de ci lta na de las gzhan pa'i myong ba med pa mngon sum gyis rab tu 'grub ba /
translated: How then could the non-experience of anything other than that be established by perception?

original: 'o na de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i khyad par du bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i khyad par du bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Well, then, it is not to be qualified as ‚Äúthat which is by the characteristic of the object of apprehension,‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is non-erroneous.

original: de lta yin na khyad par med par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de lta yin na khyad par med par 'gyur mod /
translated: If that were so, it would be without qualification,

original: mi dmigs pa nyid ni mi ldog go //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid ni mi ldog go //
translated: but non-apprehension is not excluded.

original: des na dgag pa gang ci snyed pa thams cad ni mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes so //
analyzed: des na dgag pa gang ci snyed pa thams cad ni mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes so //
translated: Therefore, all negations, whatever they may be, are from non-apprehension.

original: ma yin par dgag pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po med pa ni mngon sum gyis grub bo //
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po med pa ni mngon sum gyis grub bo //
translated: The nature of an absolute negation, which is the absence of an entity, is established by perception.

original: de nyid ni gzhan la ltos te mi dmigs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni gzhan la ltos te mi dmigs pa yang yin no //
translated: That itself, in dependence on another, is also non-apprehension.

original: 'di ma dmigs so zhes skyes bu mchog sbyar ba gang yin pa de ni shes pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir te don gyi med pa dgag pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ma dmigs so zhes skyes bu mchog sbyar ba gang yin pa de ni shes pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir te don gyi med pa dgag pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is not perceived‚Äù is not a case of the definition of non-cognition, because it is not a negation of the non-existence of the object.

original: de dang tha dad pa med pas dngos po'i med pa yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang tha dad pa med pas dngos po'i med pa yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from that, the non-existence of the thing is just that.

original: gang gi tshe yod pa dang dmigs pa dag gcig nyid yin pa de'i tshe dngos po'i ldog pa yang mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid kyi dum bur ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yod pa dang dmigs pa dag gcig nyid yin pa de'i tshe dngos po'i ldog pa yang mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid kyi dum bur ni ma yin no //
translated: When existence and perception are the same, then the negation of the thing is established by perception itself, not in part.

original: gal te khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa las /
analyzed: gal te khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa las /
translated: If it is not established by the non-perception of the pervader,

original: dngos po med pa 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: then is the non-existence of the thing not established by the non-perception of the thing itself?

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i yod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i yod pa ni /
translated: In this way, existence, which is characterized by perception,

original: dmigs pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: is pervaded by perception.

original: de med pa stong ba'i rang bzhin las ni dngos po'i med pa 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa stong ba'i rang bzhin las ni dngos po'i med pa 'grub po zhe na /
translated: And the non-existence of that, the empty nature, establishes the non-existence of the thing.

original: 'di ni bden te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden te /
translated: This is true.

original: de lta yin na thams cad du //
analyzed: de lta yin na thams cad du //
translated: But if that is so, then in all cases,

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'di ni //üîΩmed pa'i sgrub byed min 'gyur te //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'di ni // med pa'i sgrub byed min 'gyur te //
translated: This non-apprehension of intrinsic nature

original: med de @273a * //
analyzed: med de @273a * //
translated: is not a proof of non-existence,üîΩbecause non-existence is known by perception itself.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis rig / gal te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa med pa mngon sum gyis grub na 'o na thams cad du med pa mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid las rang bzhin mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis rig / gal te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa med pa mngon sum gyis grub na 'o na thams cad du med pa mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid las rang bzhin mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba
translated: If the non-apprehension of a pervader, which has the characteristic of being apprehended, proves non-existence by perception, then non-existence would be established by perception in all cases, and the so-called non-apprehension of intrinsic nature would

original: med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ro //
translated: become non-existence.

original: gal te ma rmongs pa las khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dngos po med pa'i sgrub byed yin na rmongs pas kyang de nyid dran pas yul du byed par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te ma rmongs pa las khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dngos po med pa'i sgrub byed yin na rmongs pas kyang de nyid dran pas yul du byed par 'gyur mod /
translated: If the non-apprehension of a pervader, which is not deluded, is a proof of non-existence, then even the deluded would make it an object by remembering it.

original: mi dmigs pa gzhan brtags pas ci bya //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gzhan brtags pas ci bya //
translated: What is the use of postulating another non-apprehension?

original: yang na gal te rang bzhin mi dmigs pa smos pa nyid mkhas pa la yang yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gal te rang bzhin mi dmigs pa smos pa nyid mkhas pa la yang yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature is mentioned, it would be for the wise as well,

original: du ba glo bur ba las rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: du ba glo bur ba las rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as understanding is from adventitious smoke.

original: de la mngon sum nyid med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mngon sum nyid med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it is not that there is no perception itself.

original: gzhan yang / 'dir ni khyab bya khyab byed dag / don dam du na tha dad med //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'dir ni khyab bya khyab byed dag / don dam du na tha dad med //
translated: Here, the pervaded and the pervader are not different in the ultimate.

original: dmigs pa nyid ni yod pa zhes //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid ni yod pa zhes //
translated: The existence of the object is

original: dang po ra rab tu sgrub phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po ra rab tu sgrub phyir ro //
translated: first established by the non-observation of the perceptible.

original: ba ltar rung ba'i yod na ni dmigs pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas bsgrub par smra pa rnams kyi ston pa yin na /
analyzed: ba ltar rung ba'i yod na ni dmigs pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas bsgrub par smra pa rnams kyi ston pa yin na /
translated: If the existence of the pervader is established by the non-observation of the pervaded, then the teacher of the proponents of non-observation is the one who says that the existence of the perceptible is established by the non-observation of the pervader.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin mi dmigs par smra ba la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin mi dmigs par smra ba la yang mtshungs so //
translated: This is the same for the proponents of non-observation of the nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the pervader and the pervaded are not the same nature.

original: de ltar yang dmigs pa ni yod pa nyid yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar yang dmigs pa ni yod pa nyid yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, it has been shown that the object exists.

original: gang zhig 'bras bu de ni rgyu khyab pa dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med pas na de mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i khongs su 'du ba nyid du 'chad pa'i rmongs pa de myong ba mi dmigs pa rang
analyzed: gang zhig 'bras bu de ni rgyu khyab pa dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med pas na de mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i khongs su 'du ba nyid du 'chad pa'i rmongs pa de myong ba mi dmigs pa rang
translated: Because the effect is pervaded by and inseparable from the cause, it is not different from the nature of the cause. Therefore, nonobservation of that is included in the category of nonobservation of a nature.

original: bzhin med dmigs par ji ltar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bzhin med dmigs par ji ltar mi 'thad de /
translated: How could it be untenable that the nonobservation of experience is the nonobservation of a nature?

original: de'i phyir gzhan yod pa nyid gzhan med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan yod pa nyid gzhan med pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore the existence of one thing is the nonexistence of another.

original: gzhan mi dmigs pa gzhan dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan mi dmigs pa gzhan dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The nonobservation of one thing is the observation of another.

original: de yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, that is only the nonobservation of a nature.

original: gal te de lta na yang khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na ;
translated: But if that is so, then the nonobservation of a difference-maker would not exist.

original: bden te / rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bden te / rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir /
translated: That is true, but because all are included in the nonobservation of a nature,

original: 'dus pa ni 'dod pa nyid pas kho bo la chad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni 'dod pa nyid pas kho bo la chad pa ci yang med do //
translated: since inclusion is accepted, I have no fault.

original: 'o na ci ltar tha dad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar tha dad ce na /
translated: Well then, how are they different?

original: shing dang tha pa lhag pa dang // chad phyir khyab bya khyab byed dag / tha dad phyir dang nye ba dang // ring ba las ni tha dad @273b nyid ;
analyzed: shing dang tha pa lhag pa dang // chad phyir khyab bya khyab byed dag / tha dad phyir dang nye ba dang // ring ba las ni tha dad @273b nyid ;
translated: The difference between the non-apprehension of the pervader and the non-apprehension of the nature is that the former is a non-apprehension of a pervader that is based on the remainder of the tree and the excess of the tree, and the latter is a non-apprehension of the nature that is based on the absence of the tree and the cutting of the tree.

original: / shing nyid ni lhag pa yin la /
analyzed: / shing nyid ni lhag pa yin la /
translated: The tree itself is the remainder.

original: shing sha pa ni chad pa dang / thag ring por ni khyab par bya ba la ltos nas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: shing sha pa ni chad pa dang / thag ring por ni khyab par bya ba la ltos nas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: The tree-ness is the excess. The non-apprehension of the pervader is based on the cutting of the tree and the absence of the tree that is far away.

original: nye bar ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin pas de dag tha dad do //
analyzed: nye bar ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin pas de dag tha dad do //
translated: The non-apprehension of the nature is based on the tree that is near. Therefore, they are different.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i yod pa dang / dmigs pa dag ni phan tshun khyab pa'i phyir tha dad par brtags par mi nus so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i yod pa dang / dmigs pa dag ni phan tshun khyab pa'i phyir tha dad par brtags par mi nus so //
translated: The existence that has the characteristic of being apprehended and the apprehension of that are mutually pervasive, so it is not possible to conceive of them as being different.

original: des rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid yin pas rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du'o zhes bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: des rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid yin pas rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'du'o zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: Since that is the case, the non-apprehension of the nature is included within the reason of nature, so it is established that the non-apprehension of the nature is a reason of nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: mi snang nges pa mi rung phyir //
analyzed: mi snang nges pa mi rung phyir //
translated: it is not possible to ascertain the non-appearance,

original: gzhan du gzhag pa 'gog 'gyur dper //
analyzed: gzhan du gzhag pa 'gog 'gyur dper //
translated: so the negation of the other is refuted, as in the example.

original: sems can gzhan la rtags med pa'i //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la rtags med pa'i //
translated: Just as the existence of a pot is not established

original: rnam rtogs la sogs mi 'grub bzhin //
analyzed: rnam rtogs la sogs mi 'grub bzhin //
translated: by the non-existence of a cloth, etc.

original: des na 'bras bu nges med can 'dis ni //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu nges med can 'dis ni //
translated: Therefore, this effect which is not definite

original: ldog pa sgrub par nus ma yin //üîΩnges par bsgrub bya gtan tshig sla //
analyzed: ldog pa sgrub par nus ma yin // nges par bsgrub bya gtan tshig sla //
translated: cannot establish an exclusion.üîΩThe reason is easy to establish

original: dang po'i dbang du bya ba yin //
analyzed: dang po'i dbang du bya ba yin //
translated: when the probandum is definite.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'dis ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nges par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'dis ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nges par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: This non-apprehension of intrinsic nature does not ascertain the absence of the reason in the discordant side,

original: yul thag ring ba la sogs par pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul thag ring ba la sogs par pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible in a distant place, etc.

original: mi snang nas ni 'di dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mi snang nas ni 'di dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not non-apprehension itself, which has the characteristic of apprehending this non-appearance.

original: dang po rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par nges par byed yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dang po rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa gang yin pa ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtha' dag las ldog par nges par byed yod pa yin te /
translated: That non-apprehension of cause and pervasion which is the first is the reason that ascertains the exclusion from all discordant sides,

original: rgyu dang rang bzhin ldog pa nyid //
analyzed: rgyu dang rang bzhin ldog pa nyid //
translated: because it is the cause and nature of the exclusion.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained by the statement the exclusion of cause and nature, etc.

original: khas blangs nas thal bar bsgrub pa la ni sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs nas thal bar bsgrub pa la ni sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: In the case of a reductio, the proof is the acceptance of the pervasion.

original: gal te 'gal zhes bya ba'i rtogs gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam /üîΩ'di na gang ba'i rig pa med de /
analyzed: gal te 'gal zhes bya ba'i rtogs gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam / 'di na gang ba'i rig pa med de /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there another kind of contradiction called ‚Äúthe contradiction of non-existence‚Äù?

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no cognition of a pot, because there is fire.‚Äù

original: de'i dbye ba dang mtshan nyid ci ste ma bshad ce na /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba dang mtshan nyid ci ste ma bshad ce na /
translated: Why is the definition and division of that not stated?

original: de yang mi dmigs pa nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is included within non-observation.üîΩFor example,

original: 'di ltar / rang gi sbyor ba dag la de'i //üîΩrang gi ngo bo sbyor ba'am //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rang gi sbyor ba dag la de'i // rang gi ngo bo sbyor ba'am //
translated: In one‚Äôs own application, it isüîΩthe application of one‚Äôs own nature,

original: don la gnod byed ngo bo ste //
analyzed: don la gnod byed ngo bo ste //
translated: or the nature that is the object of harm,

original: yod na yod pas med phyir ram //
analyzed: yod na yod pas med phyir ram //
translated: because if it exists, it exists, or because it does not exist.

original: 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni med dmigs pa de nyid khyab tu dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni med dmigs pa de nyid khyab tu dbye ba yin te /
translated: The reason of contradiction is that very non-observation that is pervasion,

original: de las gzhan pa'i dbye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dbye ba bzhin no //
translated: like the division of that which is different from it.

original: de lta yin 'gal ba dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang / 'gal bas khyab pa la sogs pa rnams kyang gzhan du tha dad par bstan par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin 'gal ba dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dang / 'gal bas khyab pa la sogs pa rnams kyang gzhan du tha dad par bstan par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then contradiction, the effect of contradiction, and pervasion by contradiction, and so on, would also be taught as different elsewhere.

original: gang gi tshe @274a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe @274a * //
translated: When?üîΩ

original: rab tu dbye ba du ma 'di dag de nyid kyi yin pa de'i tshe nyes pa 'di med de //üîΩ'di ltar rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dang / 'bras bu mi dmigs pa zhes bya bar rang gi ngo bos sbyor ba'am yang na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba du ma 'di dag de nyid kyi yin pa de'i tshe nyes pa 'di med de // 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dang / 'bras bu mi dmigs pa zhes bya bar rang gi ngo bos sbyor ba'am yang na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: When it is the same for these various divisions, then there is no fault.üîΩThus, it is a non-observation of a nature, cause, pervader, or effect.

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes dgag par bya ba'i don la gnod par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bos so //
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes dgag par bya ba'i don la gnod par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bos so //
translated: Or, it is a non-observation of a nature that refutes the object of negation, as in ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch because fire exists.‚Äù

original: ci ltar mi dmigs pa dngos po med pa sgrub byed yid yin pa de bzhin du dngos po dang brgyud pas 'gal ba dmigs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar mi dmigs pa dngos po med pa sgrub byed yid yin pa de bzhin du dngos po dang brgyud pas 'gal ba dmigs pa yang yin no //
translated: Just as non-observation establishes the non-existence of a thing, so too observation of a thing that is contradictory in the sense of being mutually exclusive and observation of a thing that is contradictory in the sense of being an effect establish the non-existence of a thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gal ba zlog byed yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba zlog byed yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the contradictory is the refuter.

original: 'gal bar ci ltar 'grub ce na //
analyzed: 'gal bar ci ltar 'grub ce na //
translated: How is contradiction established?

original: me gcig yod na ni rgyu mtshang ba med pa can gyi grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa'i 'gal bar rtogs so //
analyzed: me gcig yod na ni rgyu mtshang ba med pa can gyi grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa'i 'gal bar rtogs so //
translated: When one thing exists, the other is not observed. For example, when fire exists, the contradictory cold touch is not observed.

original: 'gal ba ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Contradiction is the characteristic of the non-apprehension of the apprehended.

original: des na 'gal ba mthong ba las dmigs pa mtshan nyid kyis gyur pa mi dmigs par bsgrub po //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba mthong ba las dmigs pa mtshan nyid kyis gyur pa mi dmigs par bsgrub po //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of the characteristic of the apprehended is established by the perception of contradiction.

original: de la yul thag ring po na gnas pa'i me las dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i rjes su dpag pas grub pas med bsgrub par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yul thag ring po na gnas pa'i me las dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i rjes su dpag pas grub pas med bsgrub par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the non-apprehension of the characteristic of the apprehended is established by inference from the non-apprehension of smoke in a place far from fire, it proves the non-existence of fire.

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin no /
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa las gzhan ma yin no /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of contradiction is not different from the non-apprehension of essence.

original: dro ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa 'am dro ba'i reg pa de nyid kyang des dben pa yin pa'i phyir grang ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: dro ba yang ma yin grang ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa 'am dro ba'i reg pa de nyid kyang des dben pa yin pa'i phyir grang ba med pa yin te /
translated: A touch that is neither hot nor cold, or even that very hot touch, is the absence of cold because it is devoid of that.

original: des na de dmigs pa nyid de mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dmigs pa nyid de mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the very apprehension of that is the non-apprehension of that.

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: The apprehension of the effect of contradiction is also like that.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su dpag pa las rang bzhin mi dmigs pa grub pa yin la snga ma ni tshogs pa gcig rag las pa'i rjes su dpag pas yin no ;
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi rjes su dpag pa las rang bzhin mi dmigs pa grub pa yin la snga ma ni tshogs pa gcig rag las pa'i rjes su dpag pas yin no ;
translated: The non-apprehension of intrinsic nature is established by the inference of the reason of effect. The former is by the inference of mutual dependence.

original: / phan tshun tha dad grub phyir te //
analyzed: / phan tshun tha dad grub phyir te //
translated: Because of the establishment of mutual difference,

original: brtan dngos dang ni 'jig pa bzhin //
analyzed: brtan dngos dang ni 'jig pa bzhin //
translated: like the enduring thing and the perishable.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba ste /
translated: They are contradictory in the sense of being mutually exclusive.

original: rtag pa dang cig shos bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang cig shos bzhin no //
translated: Like permanence and impermanence.

original: 'di ltar phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal bas ni de'i bdag nyid 'gog par rab tu grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal bas ni de'i bdag nyid 'gog par rab tu grub ste /
translated: Thus, by the contradiction in the sense of being mutually exclusive, the identity of the two is refuted.

original: dper na sngar phyogs 'di ni bum pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na sngar phyogs 'di ni bum pa dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, previously it was said, ‚ÄúThis place is not occupied by a pot,

original: de yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: because it is occupied by something else.‚Äù

original: thams cad du dngos po med pa sgrub pa ni bzlog pa dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du dngos po med pa sgrub pa ni bzlog pa dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: In all cases, the establishment of the non-existence of a thing is by the apprehension of the contradictory object.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod phyir yang //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod phyir yang //
translated: Because it is contradicted by another valid cognition,

original: des 'gyur dang ni ltos bcas bzhin //
analyzed: des 'gyur dang ni ltos bcas bzhin //
translated: like that which is dependent and that which is related.

original: ci ltar phan tshun @274b gnod pas 'gal ba yin pa de bzhin du tshad mas gnod pas kyang yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar phan tshun @274b gnod pas 'gal ba yin pa de bzhin du tshad mas gnod pas kyang yin te /
translated: Just as mutually exclusive things are contradictory because they are mutually harmful, so too they are contradictory because they are mutually harmful by the harm of valid cognition.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa dang nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa dang nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: They are mutually exclusive and they are ascertained.

original: 'di ltos pa dang bcas pa dang ltos pa med pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltos pa dang bcas pa dang ltos pa med pa 'am /
translated: In this way, the mutually exclusive and the non-mutually exclusive,üîΩor the ascertained and the unascertained, are mutually contradictory.

original: nges par 'gyur ba dang / cig shos zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin ltos pa dang bcas pa dang nges par 'gyur ba dag ni phan tshun spangs pa ma yin tshad mas gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par 'gyur ba dang / cig shos zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin ltos pa dang bcas pa dang nges par 'gyur ba dag ni phan tshun spangs pa ma yin tshad mas gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Mutually exclusive and ascertained are not mutually exclusive. Because they are contradictory by the characteristic of being harmed by valid cognition,

original: 'di 'gal ba gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'gal ba gzhan yin no //
translated: this is a different kind of contradiction.

original: 'di ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa las ni nges par 'gyur ba med pa yin la nges par 'gyur ba yod pa dang med pa dag gis kyang don dam phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa las ni nges par 'gyur ba med pa yin la nges par 'gyur ba yod pa dang med pa dag gis kyang don dam phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, from the mutually exclusive, the ascertained does not exist. And from the existence and non-existence of the ascertained, the ultimate is mutually exclusive by mutual exclusion.

original: gal te de lta na tshad mas 'gal ba bsgrub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te de lta na tshad mas 'gal ba bsgrub pa yin gyi /
translated: If that is so, then the establishment of contradiction by valid cognitionüîΩ.

original: tshad mas 'gal ba zhes bya ba gzhan med do zhe na /
analyzed: tshad mas 'gal ba zhes bya ba gzhan med do zhe na /
translated: There is no other so-called ‚Äúcontradiction with valid cognition.‚Äù

original: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'gal bas khyab pas rang bzhin las kyang don gyis na 'gal bar 'gyur bas na 'di bshad do //
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'gal bas khyab pas rang bzhin las kyang don gyis na 'gal bar 'gyur bas na 'di bshad do //
translated: This is true, but still, since contradiction is pervasion, even from the nature of the reason, the contradiction is implied. Therefore, this is explained.

original: 'di la yang dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di la yang dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of this?

original: 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yang gnod pa sgrub par byed pa po yin no zhes ci nas kyang bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yang gnod pa sgrub par byed pa po yin no zhes ci nas kyang bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The observation of the pervasion by contradiction is the proof of the harm. It is for the purpose of teaching this in every way.

original: 'di ltar dngos po byung ba'i 'jig pa yang nges par 'gyur ba med de rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes sbyor ba mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po byung ba'i 'jig pa yang nges par 'gyur ba med de rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes sbyor ba mthong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the destruction of an arisen thing is also not ascertained, because it depends on another cause. This is the way the syllogism is seen.

original: 'di las gzhan dag smra ba ni //üîΩ'gal 'bras khyab bya dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan dag smra ba ni // 'gal 'bras khyab bya dmigs pa ni //
translated: Others say about this:üîΩThe observation of the pervasion of the contradictory effect

original: rab tu sbyar ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: rab tu sbyar ba gang yin pa //
translated: Is the application.

original: der ni 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: der ni 'bras bu rang bzhin gyis //
translated: There, the effect and the nature

original: gtan tshigs dag kyang 'du 'gyur bas //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dag kyang 'du 'gyur bas //
translated: Are included in the reason.

original: gtan tshigs thams cad gcig nyid kyis //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad gcig nyid kyis //
translated: Therefore, all reasons

original: mi dmigs pa las gzhan med 'gyur //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las gzhan med 'gyur //
translated: Are included in non-observation.

original: des na gtan tshigs rnam gsum yang //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs rnam gsum yang //
translated: Therefore, the three kinds of logical reason

original: de nyid kyis ni rab dbyer 'gyur ;
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni rab dbyer 'gyur ;
translated: are distinguished by their very nature.

original: / mi dmigs gcig pu zhig gtan tshigs yin /
analyzed: / mi dmigs gcig pu zhig gtan tshigs yin /
translated: Non-apprehension is the only logical reason.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gnyis ni de'i dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gnyis ni de'i dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The other two, causal and essential, are its subdivisions.

original: de'i dbye ba ni de las tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba ni de las tha dad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The subdivisions are not different from it.

original: khra bo nyid la sogs pa la ba lang nyid las tha dad pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khra bo nyid la sogs pa la ba lang nyid las tha dad pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the quality of being variegated is not different from the quality of being a cow.

original: de las 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bur dmigs pa yin la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang 'gal bas khyab par dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de las 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bur dmigs pa yin la rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang 'gal bas khyab par dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The causal logical reason is the apprehension of an effect that is incompatible with it. The essential logical reason is the apprehension of a nature that is incompatible with it.

original: me ma yin pa dang rtag pa dag med par sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: me ma yin pa dang rtag pa dag med par sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: For example, the nonexistence of non-fire and permanence are established.

original: de ni 'di ltar mi rung ste //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar mi rung ste //
translated: This is not correct.üîΩThe effect and the nature

original: de bdag de las byung ba yi //
analyzed: de bdag de las byung ba yi //
translated: of that which is to be established are not different from it.üîΩIf the logical reason is understood to be related to

original: gal te gtan tshigs 'brel pa dang // rjes su mthun par rtogs @275a * //
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs 'brel pa dang // rjes su mthun par rtogs @275a * //
translated: the object to be established,üîΩthen the essential and causal reasons

original: na ni ; / rang bzhin dang ni 'bras bu nyid //
analyzed: na ni ; / rang bzhin dang ni 'bras bu nyid //
translated: are not different from it.

original: mi rtag pa yin nam me dang lhan cig 'brel na gtan tshigs khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba yin pas de mi dmigs pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin nam me dang lhan cig 'brel na gtan tshigs khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba yin pas de mi dmigs pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin no //
translated: If it were impermanent, then if it were related to fire, the reason would be contradictory, because it would be contradictory. Therefore, it is understood to be the nature of non-apprehension.

original: de la dngos su gtan tshigs su rtogs pa bor nas brgyud pa la brtan pa ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dngos su gtan tshigs su rtogs pa bor nas brgyud pa la brtan pa ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it is not possible to abandon the direct understanding of the reason and rely on the indirect.

original: 'bras bu ni me rtogs pas de dang 'gal ba'i grang ba bzlog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni me rtogs pas de dang 'gal ba'i grang ba bzlog pa yin gyi /
translated: The effect is the understanding of fire, and by that, the contradiction of cold is eliminated.

original: dngos po ni du ba grang ba sel ba la byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ni du ba grang ba sel ba la byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the entity does not exist in the elimination of cold smoke.

original: des na brgyud nas rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpog pa'i gtan tshigs su rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na brgyud nas rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpog pa'i gtan tshigs su rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is understood as the reason of inference through indirect inference.

original: de la gnyis sam gsum sgra gcig gis bstan pa ni de gtan tshigs gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gnyis sam gsum sgra gcig gis bstan pa ni de gtan tshigs gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: In that, the teaching of two or three by one word does not make it another reason.

original: gang du yang sgra'i dbang gis don gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang du yang sgra'i dbang gis don gzhan du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Nowhere does the meaning become different by the power of the word.

original: sbyor ba tsam zhig tha dad par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba tsam zhig tha dad par byas pa yin no //
translated: Only the application is made different.

original: de lta yin dang / 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la du ba las me rjes su dpog pa ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang / 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la du ba las me rjes su dpog pa ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: If that is so, then here there is no cold touch because there is smoke, where the inference of fire from smoke is an effect reason.

original: mes grang pa'i reg pa med par bsgrub pa ni 'gal ba dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: mes grang pa'i reg pa med par bsgrub pa ni 'gal ba dmigs pa yin la /
translated: The establishment of the absence of cold touch by fire is the observation of an incompatible object.

original: grang ba ma dmigs pas grang ba med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams brgyud pa yin no //
analyzed: grang ba ma dmigs pas grang ba med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs rnams brgyud pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of the expression ‚Äúabsence of cold‚Äù by the non-observation of cold is the indirect cause of the non-observation of the intrinsic nature.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni rjes su dpag pa gzhan kho na'o //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni rjes su dpag pa gzhan kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the inference of an inference is only another inference.

original: gsum po rnams sgra gcig gis bstan pas gcig nyid dam /
analyzed: gsum po rnams sgra gcig gis bstan pas gcig nyid dam /
translated: Since the three are indicated by one word, they are not identical.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that they become different reasons.

original: de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang /
translated: Even so,

original: 'dis ni dngos po la dngos po'i cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po la dngos po'i cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: this has already been explained in the statement ‚ÄúIn things, the part called thing‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on te don dam par rnam par gcod pa tsam sgrub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid do zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par rnam par gcod pa tsam sgrub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid do zhes 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that non-apprehension is the proof of mere exclusion in the ultimate sense,

original: de lta yin na rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid do zhes ci ste brjod de'i phyir 'di ni mi bzang ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin na rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid do zhes ci ste brjod de'i phyir 'di ni mi bzang ngo //
translated: then why do you say that it is the direct perception of self-awareness? Therefore, this is not good.

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba tha dad pa nyid las 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba tha dad pa nyid las 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the difference in the application, the pervasion is the difference in the apprehension of the contradictory.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ni 'jig pa nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ni 'jig pa nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But because it is dependent, destruction is not ascertained,

original: 'di ltar / rgyu gzhan las skye nye bar ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu gzhan las skye nye bar ni //
translated: because in this way:

original: gdon mi za ba ga la yod //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba ga la yod //
translated: How can there be certaintyüîΩfrom the arising of another cause?

original: rgyu gzhan de yang rang gi rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir nges pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan de yang rang gi rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir nges pa ma yin la /
translated: And that other cause also is not ascertained because it depends on its own cause.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin yin pas 'bras bu yod par mi nges so //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin yin pas 'bras bu yod par mi nges so //
translated: And because the other is also like that, the existence of the effect is not ascertained.

original: 'on te rdza mkhan la sogs pa dngos po'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid de'i 'jig pa'i yang yin pas @275b nges so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rdza mkhan la sogs pa dngos po'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid de'i 'jig pa'i yang yin pas @275b nges so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is ascertained because the potter, etc., which is the cause of the entity, is also the cause of its destruction,

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: here we say:

original: dngos po'i rgyu las byung yin na //
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyu las byung yin na //
translated: If it arises from the cause of the entity,

original: brgyud pa'i dub bas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: brgyud pa'i dub bas ci zhig bya //
translated: What use is there in a long lineage?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gal te rgyu des 'jig pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te rgyu des 'jig pa bzhin //
translated: If it is destroyed by that cause,

original: bskyed pas de yin 'jig 'gyur na //üîΩdngos po de nyid 'jig pa yi //
analyzed: bskyed pas de yin 'jig 'gyur na // dngos po de nyid 'jig pa yi //
translated: as it is produced, it is destroyed.

original: dang du bskyed pa ci zhig 'byung //
analyzed: dang du bskyed pa ci zhig 'byung //
translated: What is the use of producingüîΩthat very thing which is destroyed?

original: gal te rang gi rgyu de nyid kyis 'jig pa bskyed nas ;
analyzed: gal te rang gi rgyu de nyid kyis 'jig pa bskyed nas ;
translated: If it is destroyed by that very cause which produces it,

original: de 'jig pa yin na 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid du bskyed do cog nyid brgyud pa 'dis ci bya /
analyzed: de 'jig pa yin na 'jig pa'i ngang can nyid du bskyed do cog nyid brgyud pa 'dis ci bya /
translated: then it is produced as having the nature of being destroyed. What use is there in this long lineage?

original: 'dir dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid la gang 'debs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid la gang 'debs so zhe na /
translated: Here, if it is said that it is the nature of things,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin de lta ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin de lta ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of things is not like that.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / de ni bdag nyid grub gyur na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ni bdag nyid grub gyur na //
translated: If it is established by itself,

original: bdag la phan 'dogs byed pa gang //
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs byed pa gang //
translated: what is it that benefits itself?

original: bdag la phan 'dogs byed min na //
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs byed min na //
translated: If it does not benefit itself,üîΩwhat is the use of depending on it?

original: de yis ltos bya gang ci zhig / gal te rang gi ngo bos grub pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyus bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ni mi srid na /
analyzed: de yis ltos bya gang ci zhig / gal te rang gi ngo bos grub pa yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyus bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa ni mi srid na /
translated: If it is essentially established, then it is not possible for the cause of its destruction to benefit itself.

original: de grub pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan du 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: de grub pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan du 'gyur dgos so //
translated: It must be different from the nature of that which is established.

original: de la yang med pa la 'jig pa'i rgyu med do//
analyzed: de la yang med pa la 'jig pa'i rgyu med do//
translated: And in that case, there is no cause for the destruction of what does not exist.

original: 'on te grub pa la yang khyad par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te grub pa la yang khyad par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the cause of a difference in that which is established,

original: de lta yin na khyad par grub pa nyid dam /üîΩ'on te de las gzhan yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin na khyad par grub pa nyid dam / 'on te de las gzhan yin la /
translated: is that difference established or not?üîΩIf it is established,

original: gal te grub pa nyid yin na snga ma bzhin du thal lo //
analyzed: gal te grub pa nyid yin na snga ma bzhin du thal lo //
translated: then it follows that it is just as before.

original: gal te de grub na de'i bdag nyid bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid las tha dad par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te de grub na de'i bdag nyid bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid las tha dad par bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is not established, then it is not possible to establish it as different from that which is established, because it is not possible for it to be of the nature of that which is established.

original: de lta yin na 'di de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid pas 'di de'i ci zhig yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na 'di de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid pas 'di de'i ci zhig yin te /
translated: If it is established as different from that, then it is not a cause of that, and so what is it?

original: ci yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is nothing at all.

original: gnyi gar snang ba ni bshig zin pas yang mi bya'o //üîΩgzhan yang dngos po rang gi rgyu las dus gzhan khyab pa'am /
analyzed: gnyi gar snang ba ni bshig zin pas yang mi bya'o // gzhan yang dngos po rang gi rgyu las dus gzhan khyab pa'am /
translated: The appearance of both is refuted, and so it will not be done again.üîΩMoreover, is a thing pervaded by its cause at another time,

original: de las gzhan du gyur pa grub //
analyzed: de las gzhan du gyur pa grub //
translated: or is it established as different from that?

original: gal te phyogs dang po ltar yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te phyogs dang po ltar yin na de'i tshe /
translated: then it would be like this:üîΩIt would pervade all parts of time

original: dus kyi cha kun khyab pa dang // 'bras bu thams cad grub byed par //
analyzed: dus kyi cha kun khyab pa dang // 'bras bu thams cad grub byed par //
translated: and would produce all effects.

original: gal te de tshe rtogs na ni //
analyzed: gal te de tshe rtogs na ni //
translated: If it were understood at that time,

original: 'jig par byed pas ci zhig yod //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pas ci zhig yod //
translated: then what would the cause of destruction do?

original: chus khyer ba la rags 'dzugs pas su /
analyzed: chus khyer ba la rags 'dzugs pas su /
translated: It is like a dam that is built to hold back water.

original: rags 'dzugs pa ni chu bzlog don du yin /
analyzed: rags 'dzugs pa ni chu bzlog don du yin /
translated: The dam is built for the purpose of stopping the water.

original: chu mi 'gog par rags 'dzugs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chu mi 'gog par rags 'dzugs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the dam is built without stopping the water.

original: rags 'dzugs de ni ngal ba tsam du bas /
analyzed: rags 'dzugs de ni ngal ba tsam du bas /
translated: Since the dam is just an effort,

original: 'on te 'di ni de bzhin du rtogs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni de bzhin du rtogs pa ma yin na /
translated: if it is not understood in that way,

original: de lta yin na rang gi yul nges pas ma rtogs par ci ltar 'jig pa'i rgyu 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta yin na rang gi yul nges pas ma rtogs par ci ltar 'jig pa'i rgyu 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: then how could the cause of destruction engage without understanding its object?

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po brtags nas 'jug go zhe na ma yin te /üîΩnges par brtags na rang gi ngo bor grub pa la @276a * //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po brtags nas 'jug go zhe na ma yin te / nges par brtags na rang gi ngo bor grub pa la @276a * //
translated: If you say that it engages after investigating the thing that will arise, that is not so.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu nye bar sbyor ba ci yod /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu nye bar sbyor ba ci yod /
translated: If it is definitely investigated, what is the use of applying the cause of destruction to that which is established as its own nature?

original: 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gyo mo la nye bar sbyor ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gyo mo la nye bar sbyor ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is applied to the nature that is incompatible, such as a pot,üîΩthen that is not so.

original: 'gal ba 'di yang zlog par byed pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'gal ba 'di yang zlog par byed pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Is this not also a contradiction?

original: de la yang thal ba snga ma nyid so na 'dug gi /
analyzed: de la yang thal ba snga ma nyid so na 'dug gi /
translated: In that case, the former reductio remains in force.

original: phan tshun spangs pa tsam gyis ni zlog par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pa tsam gyis ni zlog par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Merely being mutually exclusive does not make something a contradiction.

original: 'on te dus gzhan gnas par grub pa 'jig pa'i rgyu stong pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po med par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan gnas par grub pa 'jig pa'i rgyu stong pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po med par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cause of destruction, which is the nonexistence characterized as the absence of endurance at another time, makes that which endures at another time cease,

original: dus gzhan du gnas pa la de dang mi 'gal ba'i ltos pa nyid byas pa ni /
analyzed: dus gzhan du gnas pa la de dang mi 'gal ba'i ltos pa nyid byas pa ni /
translated: then that which is made to depend on something that is not incompatible with it

original: de zlog par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de zlog par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: does not make it cease.

original: gzhi bo la chu bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhi bo la chu bzhin no //
translated: It is like the water in the ground.

original: chu yang bum pa so ma btang ba'i zlog par byed pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: chu yang bum pa so ma btang ba'i zlog par byed pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the water makes the unbaked pot cease,

original: de la dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dus gzhan du gnas pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not established that it endures at another time.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas dus gzhan du gnas par grub pa nyid log par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas dus gzhan du gnas par grub pa nyid log par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the inference that establishes endurance at another time makes it cease,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that is also not correct.

original: rjes su dpag pas rab grub pa //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rab grub pa //
translated: That which is well established by inference

original: de nyid log par byed ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid log par byed ma yin //
translated: Does not make that cease.

original: gzhan ni med pa nyid yin pas //
analyzed: gzhan ni med pa nyid yin pas //
translated: But the other is non-existent,

original: de yang ldog par byed pa min ;
analyzed: de yang ldog par byed pa min ;
translated: and it is not what is negated.

original: / mngon sum dang 'dra bar rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma kho na'o //
analyzed: / mngon sum dang 'dra bar rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma kho na'o //
translated: Inference is a valid means of knowledge, just like perception.

original: des na de grub pa yang bden pa nyid pas ci ltar de med par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na de grub pa yang bden pa nyid pas ci ltar de med par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since it is established as true, how can it be non-existent?

original: de med na de rtogs pa mi bden pa nyid pas na /
analyzed: de med na de rtogs pa mi bden pa nyid pas na /
translated: If it is non-existent, then since the realization of it is false,

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: perception and inference would not exist.

original: de med pa'i phyir dngos po mi 'grub pa'i sa na gang zhig 'jig /'gyur ba srid pa 'jog go zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dngos po mi 'grub pa'i sa na gang zhig 'jig /'gyur ba srid pa 'jog go zhe na /
translated: If they do not exist, then since things are not established, what is there to be destroyed?

original: de ni dmus long gom stabs dang 'dra bas dngos po gtan la mi 'bebs pa'i phyir na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de ni dmus long gom stabs dang 'dra bas dngos po gtan la mi 'bebs pa'i phyir na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Since that is like a blind person's gait, it does not establish things. Therefore, this is nonsense.

original: 'on te de nyid 'jig pa'i rgyus gyo mo la sogs pa gzhan nyid du byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de nyid 'jig pa'i rgyus gyo mo la sogs pa gzhan nyid du byed do zhe na /
translated: But if the cause of destruction makes it another, such as a pot shard,

original: 'di la yang brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la yang brjod pa /
translated: then in response to that, it is said:

original: gzhan nyid bum sogs la'am ci //
analyzed: gzhan nyid bum sogs la'am ci //
translated: Is it anotherness in pots and so forth,

original: 'on te 'jig pa'i rdzas la 'dod //
analyzed: 'on te 'jig pa'i rdzas la 'dod //
translated: or is it asserted in the substance of destruction?

original: bum sogs la ni gzhan nyid kyis //
analyzed: bum sogs la ni gzhan nyid kyis //
translated: By anotherness in pots and so forth,

original: dngos de ci ltar 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos de ci ltar 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: How could that thing be established?

original: gal te gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyis dngos po de bum pa'i rang bzhin la yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyis dngos po de bum pa'i rang bzhin la yin na /
translated: If the thing itself is the nature of the pot, due to its transformation,

original: gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyis ni gzhi de nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa nyid kyis ni gzhi de nyid yin na /
translated: then due to its transformation, that very basis would be

original: des na bum pa rang gi ngo por mthong bar 'gyur bas na ci ltar gzhan du gyur /
analyzed: des na bum pa rang gi ngo por mthong bar 'gyur bas na ci ltar gzhan du gyur /
translated: the pot itself. Therefore, since it would be seen as the entity of the pot, how could it be transformed?

original: 'on te bum pa ma mthong na 'di gang gis gzhan du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa ma mthong na 'di gang gis gzhan du gyur pa yin /
translated: But if the pot is not seen, by what is it transformed?

original: bum pa la sngon du 'gro ba can gyis gzhan du gyur pa ni de'i zhes bstan par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: bum pa la sngon du 'gro ba can gyis gzhan du gyur pa ni de'i zhes bstan par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the transformation is preceded by the pot, it would be taught that it is of that.

original: 'jig pa yod na ni /
analyzed: 'jig pa yod na ni /
translated: But if destruction exists,

original: de sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin no //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin no //
translated: it is not preceded by that.

original: 'jig pa de yang gzhan du gyur na ni thug pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig pa de yang gzhan du gyur na ni thug pa med do //
translated: Moreover, if that destruction is transformed, there is an infinite regress.

original: 'on te 'jig @276b pa'i rdzas gzhan du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig @276b pa'i rdzas gzhan du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the substance of destruction is transformed,

original: de yang ma zhig pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de yang ma zhig pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt that also not destroyed?

original: ci ltar gzhan du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig par yin /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig par yin /
translated: How could it be destruction, which has the characteristic of being transformed?

original: de yang sngar gyi 'jig pa'i rdzas ni mi 'jig ste /
analyzed: de yang sngar gyi 'jig pa'i rdzas ni mi 'jig ste /
translated: Moreover, the previous substance of destruction is not destroyed.

original: de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist at that time.

original: phyi ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the latter,

original: yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists.

original: gal te khyed kyi phyogs la yang nyes pa 'di nyid de /
analyzed: gal te khyed kyi phyogs la yang nyes pa 'di nyid de /
translated: If you say that this fault applies to your position as well,

original: 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu med pas //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu med pas //
translated: since the cause does not exist at the time of the effect,

original: ci ltar de de'i 'bras bu yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar de de'i 'bras bu yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could it be the effect of that?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,üîΩbecause it is like this:

original: 'di ltar / rgyu ni sngon du 'byung nyid de //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu ni sngon du 'byung nyid de //
translated: The cause occurs earlier,

original: dus mtshungs pa ni rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa ni rgyu ma yin //
translated: but that which is simultaneous with it is not the cause.

original: 'jig pa dngos dang dus mtshungs pa //
analyzed: 'jig pa dngos dang dus mtshungs pa //
translated: Since destruction is simultaneous with the thing,

original: yin phyir lan ni rung ma yin //üîΩdngos po ni gzhan gyi tshe yin la //
analyzed: yin phyir lan ni rung ma yin // dngos po ni gzhan gyi tshe yin la //
translated: the response is not appropriate.üîΩIt is not tenable that a thing is destroyed at another time

original: 'jig pa yang gzhan gyi tshe yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig pa yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'jig pa yang gzhan gyi tshe yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig pa yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: and destruction occurs at another time.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po yod pa de nyid kyi tshe 'jig pa yod pa de na 'jig pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bar 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po yod pa de nyid kyi tshe 'jig pa yod pa de na 'jig pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bar 'thad do //
translated: When a thing exists, at that time destruction exists, so it is tenable to say that it possesses destruction.

original: med pa la ni med pa tha mi dad de /
analyzed: med pa la ni med pa tha mi dad de /
translated: But if it does not exist, it is not different from nonexistence,

original: shi ba la shi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shi ba la shi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because death does not exist for the dead.

original: 'bras bu'i ni shi ba la yang 'thad pa kho na ste de ni dngos po gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ni shi ba la yang 'thad pa kho na ste de ni dngos po gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the result is tenable only in the case of death, because that is a different entity.

original: dngos po med pa ni de nyid kyis stong pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni de nyid kyis stong pa yin te /
translated: A nonentity is empty of that itself,

original: de med do zhes gzhi mthun par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med do zhes gzhi mthun par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood as a common locus of ‚Äúthat does not exist.‚Äù

original: dngos po'i 'jig pa zhes gzhi mthun pa ma yin pa ni bstan pa can gzhan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po'i 'jig pa zhes gzhi mthun pa ma yin pa ni bstan pa can gzhan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The common locus of ‚Äúthe destruction of an entity‚Äù is a different entity,

original: ci ltar mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no//
analyzed: ci ltar mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no//
translated: just as, for example, the body of a tortoise.

original: de bzhin du me du ba zhes bya ba bzhin no mthun pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du me du ba zhes bya ba bzhin no mthun pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not similar to, for example, ‚Äúfire and smoke.‚Äù

original: gal te 'dir yang gzhi mthun pa don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dir yang gzhi mthun pa don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that here also a common locus does not exist ultimately,

original: sngon gyi rang bzhin dran pa la zhig go zhes rtogs pa yin la de yang phyis byung ba'i 'jig pas yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi rang bzhin dran pa la zhig go zhes rtogs pa yin la de yang phyis byung ba'i 'jig pas yin no //
translated: because in remembering a previous entity one understands ‚Äúit has been destroyed,‚Äù and that is due to a later arising destruction,

original: gzhi mthun pa de ni de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa de ni de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: that common locus is not like that.

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: That is also not correct.

original: de lta yin na 'gal ba chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na 'gal ba chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, there would be a great contradiction.
